title: Quality hotel and nice interior design
text: Great Midtown location, EXCELLENT staff and very safe.  There is a tiny coffee/snack spot in the lobby that is decent, but it has only early day availability-but I believe they are building something permanent with extended hours.  Rooms are TINY, i mean tiny.  It was two of us in a two bed room for 5 nights and the beds are the only seating available.  The design and decor of the hotel are lovely, and the Lockwood products smell amazing.  Would recommend for a few days, but you might get frustrated with more than that with the limited space.

title: Polished Boutique Hotel
text:
Polished boutique hotel located in the center of the action in NYC. Nice vibe in this cool hotel including well designed rooms and sitting areas off the lobby. Loved the feel of this hotel and all the amenities it offered. The staff is very good and goes out of the way to make your stay comfortable.
Highly recommend this hotel for your next t stay in NYC.

title: Newly renovated room served my purposes, but don't expect much
text:
Pros:
- Room was clean, and seemed to be recently renovated.
- Receptionist was nice and efficient
- Location was great for this trip
- Lobby and coffee/pasty shop were small and unremarkable, but sufficient for a hotel without many guests (presumably lots of business people like me, in and out after one night)

Cons:
- Room was small (even by NYC standards); barely fit the King bed with a little walking room around it
- Furnishings were cheap (e.g., coffee maker  - which was on a cart right under hangers that implied the overall contraption was supposed to be my closet - could have been from a 2008 Hampton Inn)
- Elevator looked 50+ years old
- I used the Hilton app to check-in and requested a Digital Key the night before, but it still wasn't "ready" when I got to the hotel (as promised) at 6pm the following day.  If you have to wait in line a the front desk to get your key (digital or plastic), your time has simply been wasted.

title: Charming little hotel
text: Stayed here this past week for 3 nights. I’m surprised reading some of these previous reviews and wondering if those people have never been to NY before. I loved the charm of this hotel, as with most it’s an older building, but very clean. The bed was very comfortable. Great water pressure and HOT shower. I was alone and didn’t mind the smaller room at all.  The staff was always friendly and helpful. I felt very safe here staying alone. The only noise I heard was my last night, I had some loud neighbors but they quieted down around midnight.  Was here for work around the corner, will definitely stay here again.

title: Itigated print
text:
In Midtown, acceptable location, uninteresting street.
Professional, if not smiling, receptionists; no recognition of Hilton status.
Good bedding but the room is tiny, even by Manhattan standards and when staying alone; vis à vis.
Takeaway breakfast at a small counter (quality products).
Multiple accommodations all around.

title: Lipstick on old bones
text:
I know that NYC is expensive, so my review isn’t a judgement on ‘value for money’.  However, it’s worth knowing what you will get for $350 per night (the rate I paid).

Tapestry by Hilton are individual hotels operating loosely (very loosely) under the Hilton banner.   I am Hilton Diamond, and really only booked this hotel because it came under that banner.  However, the Hilton affiliation is meaningless as there are no facilities, room upgrade possibilities etc to speak of.    

This is an old building that has been give a makeover at minimum cost.  The bones are still very old, but painted and finished to a fresh standard.  Elevators are a bit beaten up and slow.  Plumbing took 5 mins to deliver hot water to the 16th floor when checking out in the middle of the night.  Light switches haven’t been moved/upgraded meaning you can’t darken the room from your bed etc.  What you are left with is a Hotel Ibis standard with nicer finishes (a bit of nice wood, marble, tiles etc).  

Staff are nice at the front desk, but uniforms are a bit shabby (better to go more casual than have those ‘50x dry cleaned’ jackets).

There is a breakfast bar in the reception area, which seems to have some construction still ongoing to turn it into a cafe.  However, for now you eat in your room.  Food quality was ok, but it is done is a rather unprofessional air.  See the photo of the sign which sums up how what could be a nicely designed hotel is being operated in a shabby fashion.  “We are separate from the hotel!”  Honestly?  I doubt they have ever had a customer who doesn’t stay in the hotel, and I bet 90% of their customers are using Hilton Diamond $18 credits.  So what a way to speak to your customers.    

Rooms will not be serviced unless requested.  So trash etc is left in the room.  This stunned me at $350 per night.  Is that actually a thing now?  Housekeeping seems a bit slapdash.  My bedlinen had fresh biro marks on it.  I told myself if must have been a housekeeper’s mistake - the linen looked clean…  Clocks hadn’t been adjusted for daylight saving changes (and wasn’t clear how to do it).  Very poor when many guests will have changed timezone.  Setting people up to miss a flight.

I was given a pass for free to use a v good Crunch gym 2 blocks away.  Great gym.  I was told this was due to Diamond status.  Not sure what the situation is for others, and I only got it by asking about a gym.

Would I stay again?  The bed was comfortable.  The room was ok.  I could probably have found somewhere else in the area for a similar rate with a bigger room and more facilities - but those were things like ‘Crowne Plazas’ with zero character at the time I booked.  This had a bit of personality.  So maybe I would.  

The hotel just needs to take more pride in the details (like the fact that the cafe is strange, the door to the facilities office behind reception was never closed and therefore back of house was visible etc etc).  The concept was OK, and I respect them trying to renovate an old building at best value.  But it’s a shame to see it being done without care.

title: Famu time
text: Everyone was nice this is a very nice hotel. The rooms are very small there’s no closet because I’m a diamond member I got $18 to spend so I brought like juice and stuff. There’s a little juice and coffee shop downstairs by check and check out. They are two blocks from Macy’s on 34th St. and Avenue of America two blocks from the train station.

title: Do not recommend
text: Mediocre at best, stay here only if it's the location you really want. The rooms are quite small, not much bigger than a cruise ship internal room. There is no closet, the maybe 2 foot wide rack to hang clothes is on top of the coffee maker. The bathroom is small enough that to close the door you almost have to be inside the shower. And the cleanliness and appearance of the room leaves a LOT to be desired. Two towels had weird looking black marks, like grease stains, on them, the sheets look like they hadn't been laundered in a week, the light fixtures looked like they were 40 years old, and there was paint on the walls above the baseboard over several feet of the walls

title: Great if you do not plan on being in your room much
text: The staff are all very friendly. The location is fantastic if you’re catching shows, very easy walking distances to lots of activities and food. Very small rooms. Not particularly great for families. Cafe downstairs has yogurts, coffee, quick snacks but, very pricy. The shower water pressure is lacking, and our floors weren’t clean on entry; very dusty/dirty. Not our most impressive Hilton stay ever, and we’ve stayed at quite a few Hilton properties. Good views, but probably better views other places.

title: The Draper---Highly Recommend
text:
Have been here several times and they set the standard  for customer service.
Entire front desk is always extremly helpful and friendly.
They go above and beyond to accomodate.
Rooms are extremly clean and well appointed.
Have stayed at many hotels in NYC, The Draper is always Top of My List!

title: Clean and quiet, modern; small rooms
text: Clean and quiet hotel in a great central location in Manhattan.   Be aware that the rooms are very small,  so small they don't even have a closet.  They do have a nice TV, a small refrigerator and have an updated, contemporary look.  There is also a small cafe in the lobby that's open for breakfast.

title: Remarkably poor management, but clean & quiet room
text:
It took six months for "The Draper"-staff to figure out they couldn't correct their own incorrect invoice - you will love their statement. ;-)

This happened: When I received an invoice with the wrong address, I politely asked for a corrected version by email.  I received the same incorrect invoice again - and from then on no more answers to my (very polite) emails.

On the fifth (!) attempt (now via Hilton's Instagram chat) the answer comes today: "The hotel has advised that they are unable to modify an address associated with a booking after the guest has checked out, such as in your case."

I'm surprised by this regulation (after other hotels can do it), but: Why does it take six months for “The Draper” to discover this rule? ;-)

Since then I have avoided Hilton, but the hotel may be suitable for other people's short-trips:

The room was clean and quiet, but (as expected) cramped. I like the design and the mattress was comfortable. The place is good for a short business-trip or tourists who want to be around Times Square. The nearby Bryant park is good for a lunch break outside.

title: Little Gem
text:
This little boutique hotel is now part of the Hilton Tapestry collection.  I had stayed there before they joined hilton and decided to check it out again since I am a Diamond Member with Hilton. Front desk granted my request for a room not facing the back of the building.  Very nice and welcoming staff,
The rooms are rather  small but beautifully decorated and if you get one facing the front,  the views are gorgeous. 
Their best feature:  The Bed.  Simply glorious.  
They are still working on remodeling the back part of the lobby so it does feel a bit incomplete still.... It seems there is going to be a bar and some outside seating.  Looking forward to going back and checkout the results.
All in all very nice little place with a great location!

title: A very nice hotel but not without some flaws
text:
The good: 
The staff was very nice and accommodating especially the two ladies working the cafe every morning. The bed was comfortable, little noise at night. I slept very soundly. Decent location between Herald Square and Bryant Park, safe and convenient to most sites. Nice view from the room facing north. In room safe. The shower had good pressure the bath products were very nice. The room was very clean and the heat worked well.

The not so good: 
No restaurant. I was given an $18- voucher which I could spend on coffee and some microwavable options. I spent it on granola bars and chips then bought breakfast out. The room has very little storage and that includes no shelf in the shower, or next to the bathroom sink. The TV offered Netflix but it never worked. The TV guide screen showed channels but no listings so there was no way to know what to watch other than scrolling through stations.  Also the management was aware of this as an ongoing issue. 
There is a bar under construction so maybe in the near future there will be more use for the voucher. 

It was a nice stay and I think a lot of the issues are minor and fixable. I think the hotel would be wise to fix them.

title: Perfect
text: Stayed at this hotel in the beginning of the week, but when my friend left, switched to a different hotel toward the end of the week because it was a bit less expensive. Should have stayed here for the extra $70. Great location. Very safe! Desk staff was attentive to people coming in and out of the building. Your card was needed to press the elevator button. Big room! Super comfy, bed and pillows. So much better than the place I switched to. Only negative was you had to get up to turn off all the lights. Which meant no reading lights by the bed and no controls by the bed for the lights.

title: Great Balcony, but no bar
text: This was an excellent location in the heart of many different walking destinations for my fall trip solo traveler.  Although it was really rainy that weekend, the staff of the hotel were accomodating to help out when some water came into the room.  It was a really nice balcony overlooking the empire state building. The room was a nice size as far as NYC hotels are concerned! The room was updated and although there was not a central area to have a drink or grab dinner, door dash delivered! Would stay here again.

title: A great weekend at The Draper
text: We had a wonderful experience at The Draper, from check in to check out the staff was friendly and welcoming. The location of the hotel is amazing and really so close to everything. I’m Hilton gold and was hoping to get a room upgrade as their were better rooms available till be booked up until the morning we checked in, but didn’t, however the room was great either way. They’re definitely small as everyone has mentioned, so we just lived out of our suitcases for the weekend we were there. We mainly were just in the room to sleep and shower. We got $18/person per day for food and beverage credit, however this can only be used at a small cafe in the lobby that’s only open in the morning. I hope that a bar/restaurant is in the works so it just takes The Draper to the next level.

title: The Draper fit the bill
text: The Draper New York was an excellent choice. Super helpful staff, room was spacious by New York standards, bed and shower were up to the task. Great location for walking to Rockefeller Center and Central Park. Great Steak House (Keens) just right around the corner.

title: Fantastic stay.
text: The staff is very friendly and helpful! It is also a very clean hotel. The proximity to sightseeing is great. We enjoyed Macy's parade, the Empire State Building, Bryant Park, Macy's, and many food establisments.

title: I would stay here again for the location
text:
This boutique hotel is very cute and will be even better when they complete the expansion on the ground floor.

Location: great location. Within a 6 minute walk to Bryant Park and half a mile to Times Square. There are lots of restaurants in the area and public transportation near by. 

Check-in: I requested a 3PM check-in and selected an available room via the Hilton app but had to wait when I arrived at 4:02PM on top of a couple who arrived after we receiving their room keys before me. As a Hilton Diamond Member, we received 2 complimentary bottles of water and informed of the available credit to enjoy complimentary breakfast at the lobby cafe.

Room: the room was clean upon appearance (no noticeable hairs in the bathroom or around the room); a stain on the bath towel skeeved me out a bit but nothing major. The King Room is small and does not have a traditional closet. They do have space to hang clothes above tea/coffee station which also houses a mini fridge. There is a small desk with a chair and some additional hooks on the wall to hang your coat, jacket, or bags. The bed was comfortable and there were enough charging outlets to my liking (both USB ports and standard outlets).

Hotel: their are two ice machines on the Cellar floor as well as a Bike Closet.

TIP: if you are driving, use SpotHero to reserve a spot and pay a lower rate. For overnight parking at a lot 9 minutes away by foot, I paid $43. The standard rate is $70 for overnight parking.

title: Clean place to sleep.
text:
The Draper is a no frills hotel. The rooms are very small and there is no lobby or restaurant. There is a small cafe that offers bottled drinks, coffee and breakfast pastries. If you are a Diamond member you will get a voucher to use there. 

It is a good choice if you just need a place to sleep and plan to go to explore all day. 

Our room was clean.

I saw several comments about the staff being rude but I did not experience that at all. They were friendly and helpful. We asked for more towels and a remote to the room and they were delivered promptly. 

It was a decent hotel for a quick trip to NYC.

title: Great hotel, great location
text: Great stay in NY on a holiday weekend with my family. Everything was clean and comfortable and the staff was friendly and helpful. I was a little nervous reading some of the reviews, but we had a great time and would stay again.

title: Don’t Waste Your Time
text: I stayed at the Draper Hotel for 4 nights arriving the day before Thanksgiving 2023. Originally I was to arrive on Wednesday afternoon but due to an emergency of my long time family pet dying before my flight I had to push my arrival to a little after midnight. Already distraught from the pain and suffering of losing my pet of 20 years I was greeted by reception that took a very long time to check me and my fiancé in. We were told the computers become slow around that time (there was no other guest checking in so I don’t know how could your computers become slow at a period of practically no usage) so we were allowed to go to our room and complete the check in process in the morning. An hour after we were settled into our room to go to sleep we received a call from front desk to come back down to try the check in process again at 1am in the morning where I had to redress and make my way back down to the lobby. Later that morning me and my fiancé was greeted to a loud fire alarm going off and then a PSA announcement stating that the little cafe downstairs had burned a customers item and that was the reason for the alarm being set off. They took forever to explain this reason rather than stating false alarm and proceeding with normal operations. As the days progress we notice the walls of the hotel room were paper thin. I could hear constant thumping of luggage all around me and noise in the hall way. The hotel only offers housekeeping upon request and only provided 2 small water bottles upon arrival and nothing further. In the room the mini fridge was such a loud disruption to my sleep I had to unplug the whole unit. The cafe they have downstairs had a very limited selection of food and beverage and also only operate from 8am - 1pm. I had ordered take out and received a bottled Coke to that required a bottle opener. When I asked front desk if they had one they told me that another guest had it in their room. On my last day leaving the hotel front desk asked me how was my stay to which I replied it was ok. The front desk agent proceeds to ask if I did not like the room so I politely told her no it wasn’t a pleasant experience to which she chuckled and skipped the conversation. When I asked for the hotel to hold my luggage for a few hours since my flight was later in the evening I was told it would be $1 per bag we take cash only. I was honestly astonished and asked her why? She told me it was hotel policy to which I replied “I’ve never stayed at a hotel that would charge me to hold my bags for a few hours” she waved her hands to other guest bags (which was weirdly placed up against the hotel lobby glass door for anyone walking by to see and told me “we have a lot of bags as you can see” I replied I’m not paying for something that’s always free everywhere I stay and she reluctantly took my bags for me to hold. Upon returning to the hotel to collect my things I gave the same front desk agent my ticket for my bags to which she asked me to help her find them without even trying to look for my items. I then noticed my luggage that held numerous expensive items inside were put up against the glass door like all the other bags but what really surprised me was that the glass door was unlocked and she pushed my bags outside and told me to collect them in the freezing cold. I will never stay at this hotel again and they have shaped my perception of Hilton as a non caring establishment that only cares about profit than their guest.

title: The Draper Hotel does not have the life-savings tools to care for their guests.
text:
Look beneath the surface of The Draper Hotel to understand what potentially life-saving aids are or are not available for their guests.  

On this Thanksgiving day, the sudden death of my beautiful sister-in-law is on a lot of peoples minds right now.   The evening before her collapse, there were six of us hanging out on the balcony of our NYC hotel room.  We had spent two action-packed days seeing the sites in NYC.   We laughed and talked about what we had seen—the Empire State Building (yes, King Kong was there), the reverence of the 9/11 Memorial and Museum, the Observation Deck of the World Trade Center, and my sister-in-law chasing the infamous Naked Cowboy to get a photo.  Let’s not forget the awe of the bright lights at Broadway and Times Square.  

Little did we know our trip to the Statue of Liberty would not happen the next day.  Instead, while at The Draper Hotel, I watched my brother valiantly try putting his life-saving skills to work on his own wife.  I watched as the ambulance rescue team arrived and moved her to the ambulance and transported her to NYU Hospital.  The medical team in NYU used everything at their disposal to try to save her.  

Unfortunately, the Draper did not have an AED and we have since learned it is not a requirement in New York for hotels to have them.  But why does a hotel need a law to tell them it’s the right thing to do for the guests they welcome?  Would it have saved my sister-in-law’s life?  We’ll never know because there wasn’t one available to her.  

CPR is an undeniably valuable skill that is absolutely necessary for the event of a sudden cardiac arrest, by supplementing CPR with AED defibrillators, the chances of survival with the least amount of damage actually double.

When you travel, when you’re out and about following your daily routine, look for where AEDs are and aren’t.  Ask the management of those locations what are they doing to ensure their patrons safety.  It takes a village to affect change.  We can all be the change we need in the world.  

I’m also disappointed that no one at the hotel has reached out to express their sympathy for our loss.

title: Great Location, Great Hotel
text: We really enjoyed the Draper Hotel.  It’s a good central location.  The staff was very friendly, and the room was great.  The rooms are small, but they are all small in NYC.  It’s very clean and stylish.  My only minor complaint is there isn’t much oh room in bathroom for storing family of four toiletries.  Not a big deal to us though.  I’m a diamond member and saw many complain about breakfast/food voucher choices.  We were pleasantly surprised and thought it was just fine.  There were coffee drinks, water, sodas, sandwiches, snacks and som really really tasty fresh pastries.  There’s not a full breakfast meal available, but you’re in NYC, so why eat in your hotel lobby?!  We’d definitely come back.

title: NYC weekend stay
text: Great hotel near Bryant park. Have stayed several times. Hotel is very clean, rooms are bright and comfortable. Bathroom is small but very nice. Slept wonderful. Friendly staff throughout our stay. The neighborhood has numerous eateries and not a long walk to most popular sites.

title: Nice Hotel - Small Rooms, Comfortable for a Short Stay
text: I was only there for one night so the small room wasn't too bothersome. The desk was more of a very small table - hardly big enough to fit my laptop - not ideal for work. No closet. My window looked into other windows of other buildings.  Room itself was ok - could have been a little cleaner.... bed was comfortable. Bathroom was fine - seemed somewhat updated - just big enough to be somewhat functional. Great location.

title: Midtown in style.
text:
The Draper New York is stylish, clean and impeccably managed. Combine that with a great location and a terrific view of the Empire State Building and you have the perfect home base for a wonderful New York City adventure.
(And great local late night delivery options as well)

title: Disappointing
text:
The pluses:
- Extremely well appointed, particularly for sites such as the Empire State Building, Central Park, MOMA, Times Square and shops along Fifth Avenue
- Nice decor although a little tired in places
- Great view from bedroom window
- Decent size room given central NYC location
- QR code on room wall links to really useful info local shops and restaurants
- Nice quality towels and bathroom products

The negatives:
- When we visited (1-2 Nov) there was construction two doors' down at a shop being fitted out that went on right through the night which meant getting to sleep was nigh on impossible.  I expected noise in a centrally located hotel but not construction.  I flagged with front desk the morning of checking out and they claimed it's illegal for anywhere to do construction work anywhere in NYC overnight but that clearly hadn't stopped those working several doors down.  Realise this is not the hotel's fault, but disappointing nonetheless.
- Lack of instructions on how to use amenities in room
- Bizarrely the only place to hang clothes was a clothes rail above the fridge and coffee making machine and doesn't provide enough length for dresses or trousers
- Our TV didn't work, but realised it was due to missing battery and front desk staff happily replaced but would have been good if this had been checked when room was prepared
- Air fan in bathroom did not work, which meant odours lingered
- $150 security deposit taken on top of room charge (refunded in 5 working days after check out) - I can't see anywhere in my booking confirmations any mention of this charge so came as a surprise and not something I had budgeted for which impacted my spending while waiting for the refund

For me, the negatives outweighed the positives.  For the cost, I wouldn't go back and I felt like it didn't live up to the Hilton brand.  Overall, disappointing.

title: What a disappointment!
text:
I took my wife to The Draper to spend the weekend in Manhattan for her birthday. I chose The Draper because it was centrally located in Midtown and gave us easy access to many things (subway lines, Times Square, Macy's), and because it was a Hilton property (and I am stupid and loyal). I read the reviews -- I knew the room would be small -- but I was not at all prepared for what a disappointment the whole 'hotel' was, from beginning to end.

The Good

Having read the reviews, I was prepared for a small room, so I was delightfully surprised by the room's size. There was room to move around, and room for a luggage rack with an open suitcase on it. There was room for a king-sized bed and an aisle on both sides of the bed. I've stayed in smaller hotel rooms in NY. The 'closet' consists of five hangers over a mini-fridge, which is weird (photo included), but again -- space is tight in NYC. Not a dealbreaker.

Unfortunately, that's the only 'good' thing about our stay.

The Bad

NO CITY VIEW. I paid for an upgraded 'city view' room. You'll see our view in the attached photos. Apparently, looking directly into the windows of the building next to you counts as 'city view'. Very disappointing.

THE ROOM WAS SHABBY. I tried to capture it in the photos, but the room featured ceiling damage and unevenly half-painted walls. It's hard to see in the photos, but gloss paint had been rollered on the lower half of the walls with no consistency. It felt like we were staying in a room that they'd been working on fixing and then abandoned the fix-in-progress to let us check in.

NO WORKING TV. The television turns on, but none of the channels are the channels listed in the guide and a full 2/3 of them don't actually display anything at all. I went through every channel trying to find the local news, and I do not believe that they have any local or network programming (no NBC, CBS, FOX, ABC). I asked about this at the front desk and they acknowledged that, yes, the guide is inaccurate. No further action. I didn't come to NY to watch TV, but I sure would have appreciated being able to get a weather report, at least, to start my days. No luck.

UNTRAINED STAFF. There are only two elevators at The Draper, and they are shared by the 'we only come if you ask for us' cleaning service. That's fine. It's a boutique. In and of itself, that doesn't surprise me. But on two separate occasions during my 4-day stay, while in the elevator, the doors opened, an employee stepped in and held the door open with his foot, waited for some time for someone else to appear, and then stepped into the elevator, pressed another floor. All without even acknowledging that there were guests in the elevator. Not even so much as a 'sorry', just -- nothing. One of the two times this occurred the gentleman holding the elevator was on the phone the whole time, and somehow used his fob to clear out the lights on the elevator and take him directly to the floor he needed, then we had to re-scan our room key to get to our room. I don't mind sharing an elevator. I get it. But at least train your staff they they are sharing it with guests. Oof!

NO BAR. I called the Draper when I made the reservation some months ago to make sure there was a bar and restaurant at the hotel (so we could get late night and/or early morning food and drinks). He told me it was beautiful, brand new, and scheduled to open a month before we arrived. Only it was still under construction when we got there. There was a coffee station with some convenience foods (packaged sandwiches, orange juice, etc.), but it was only open from 8:30-1:00p daily, and there was otherwise NOTHING available except water. And the coffee! A cup of coffee, at the hotel where I'm staying -- just brewed coffee -- was $6. I could get a better cup of coffee and a pastry on the block, at Dunkin', Paris Baguette, Krispy Kreme, or any of the many food carts in the area on weekdays for less. I'm okay with no free coffee (though most Hilton properties I've stayed at have free guest coffee in the morning), but to be the most expensive coffee in New York is unconscionable. 

NO LOBBY. There was never I time when I passed through the lobby and there was a place to sit. The lobby is a hallway with a couch on one side, and that couch -- 24 hours a day, it would seem -- was always full. I could sit on my bed in my room or leave, those were my only choices when at The Draper. I guess that's fine -- but that's not for me.

NOBODY CARES. We checked out a day early on our pre-paid reservation. We paid for four nights, but we checked out at the front desk after three nights. Did the front desk inquire as to why? Nope. Did they ask if everything was OK with our stay? Nope. Did they offer to credit us for our last night's stay? Definitely not. They said 'we'll send you a receipt electronically and see you next time!' Yikes.

REALLY. NOBODY CARES. Then they sent us the receipt, also included below. If I have any concerns about my bill or my stay I am instructed not to reply to the e-mail, but instead to call them. At 000-000-0000. For real. 

THIS WAS NOT CHEAP. I didn't pick The Draper because it was cheap. Not even close! There were three hotels ON THE SAME BLOCK I could have stayed at for less. I stayed there because it was MORE EXPENSIVE than the Embassy Suites on the same street. Oof. What a mistake. I've been trying to decide for a while whether my loyalty is better spent at Hilton or Marriott properties. It looks like The Draper has made the decision very easy for me.

title: Nice clean botique hotel.  Great, small room, but options are limited.
text:
We had a quick Saturday night overnight trip to NYC, and we chose The Draper as our Hilton Hotel of choice due to the close proximity to Penn Station and also to the 5th Avenue subway station to catch the 7 train to go to Citi Field.  

This hotel basically great for our needs.  Room was tiny but that's expected in NYC.  Room was very clean and beds were very confortable.  Climate control was perfect for a good night sleep.  Bathroom was very clean and walk in shower was great.  Elevators, whch tend to be a problem at NYC skyscrper hotels, were very fast, and we didn't have to wait long for one.

The only reason why I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 was due to the lack of breakfast options at the lobby cafe.  As a Hilton Diamond Member, I'm entited do a $18 F&B credit per guest.  To get this credit, you have to go to the front desk, and they will provide you with a voucher, which the rep at the front desk hapily took care of for us.  However, the options very very poor.  There were mostly hot drink options.  The food options were extremely limited.  No bagels, even frozen, no muffins, no fruit.  Just a few egg and cheese sandwiches that they microwave for you and some things that we didn't know what they were because they weren't labled.  To keep the Tapestry label by Hilton, the hotel should be required to offer a better breakfast.  I included a picture of all of the lame food options available.

Other than breakfast, it was a great hotel that I would recommend and stay at again.

title: Nothing special.
text: Rooms are just fair.  Small rooms.  Breakfast is a choice of pastries and coffee  only.  I did see they are adding a back patio w/ bar- that might be cool.  Nothing great! Just ok. Location is good. Easy access to the Lincoln tunnel.  Don’t even think of parking on that street- saw multiple cars getting towed- you will have to pay for parking if you have a car.

title: Not worth it
text:
Started with the checkin. They are a franchise so they have no loyalty to Diamond members so if you are looking for a perk, dont stay here.  Had to argue to get a tiny upgrade
Speaking of tiny, that upgrade wasnt much.  The room had no closet, I think the bathroom was bigger than the room.
The cafe downstairs was nice and they were cool.

They also dont take the Hilton Gift card because they are a franchise, they are on a different payment system.

They were just rude all around, not worth the money.  I travel all year including multiple times to NYC a year but never here again, too bad, location is great.
Location and the cafe made it 2 stars.

title: A 3 star marketed as a 4 star that should be a 1 star
text:
I booked this hotel after  it was a marketed as 4-star property, only to arrive and find out it was actually rated 3 stars. The false advertising was just the beginning of a terrible experience.

The lobby was far from welcoming; it was unkempt, no air conditioning, and featured broken signs. I had high hopes that the room would be better, but I was sorely mistaken. The walls were damaged, and the furniture was so cheap that even IKEA would have been an upgrade.

I couldn't bear to stay, so I immediately went to the front desk to request a refund. They assured me it would be "no problem." Relieved, I found another, cleaner hotel down the street.

To add insult to injury, Hilton, who is associated with this property, is now fighting the refund that the hotel desk had promised. I am extremely disappointed and would advise everyone to stay away from this hotel at all costs.

Hilton should be embarrassed to have their name on this hotel.

title: Utilitarian Luxury
text:
I think utilitarian luxury is truly the best way to describe this place.  I was there for business and spent a good amount of time in the lounge to take meetings… sadly the back was closed for renovations (and i was not aware of that prior). But the lounge was comfortable and it worked well for what i was doing. 

The room itself was great.    The up side to my room was i had a terrace…. And that was magnificent….(room 1605 is perfect)…. It was a corner room and the only terrace around so very private.   I kept the door open at night….the bed was heaven…. And i always request extra pillows which the accommodating instantly and those were also fab…..

So…. What were the down sides…..no closet….  Just a bar to hang things on…. Which is ok…. But not great….my biggest beef with the room is the lighting….there was one way to to turn the lights on and off….and it was all of nothing…..and the light switch was by the door…not near the bed….. so for me reading in bed was not really possible….i would have liked a couple of lamps by the bed that i was able to control from bed……

I did think there was a cafe……there is not……it is a little market that you can get coffee and premade sandwiches……things like that….would have been nice to have a cafe there…..

It is centrally located….and easy to get around…not  inexpensive.   Would satay again…(especially if i have the terrace)!!

title: La base di partenza perfetta per visitare la Grande Mela
text:
Ognuno chiaramente ha una visione soggettiva di cosa si aspetta da un hotel.
Per me il Draper è perfetto nel contesto di Manhattan. Partendo da dove si trova, 5 minuti a piedi da Times Square e Empire State Building, affacciato sulla Fifth Avenue e ben collegato con la metropolitana per tutte le altre location turistiche della città.
La camera ha due pro: pulitissima e senza un cm di moquette. Il bagno ha la doccia con box (non scontato nella Grande Mela). Chi si lamenta che le pulizie della camera sono su richiesta e non quotidiane ha ragione, ma con un minimo di ragionamento è giusto e corretto, oggettivamente a casa nostra nessuno cambia asciugamani tutti i giorni. Basta richiederlo alla reception al mattino e la pulizia viene fatta in modo ineccepibile, anche tutti i giorni se necessario.
Noi siamo stati 5 notti e abbiamo richiesto la pulizia a metà soggiorno per esempio.
Insomma, se dovessi tornare a NY, tornerei da loro. Il prezzo è un buon compromesso tra servizi e qualità offerta.
La colazione è l'unico neo, ma una volta arrivati si capisce subito che è inutile, attorno all'hotel ci sono almeno 6-7 tra Dunkin Donuts, Starbucks, Paris Baguette e simili che offrono il servizio a prezzo più competitivo di quanto potrebbero fare loro stessi. Se comunque voleste la colazione, loro hanno un piccolo chioschetto nella hall che offre il servizio al mattino (a pagamento ovviamente).

title: Excellent Midtown location.
text: Excellent location and a great value. I had a great stay. My room was clean and well kept. The staff was just OK. I would return if/when I'm back in NYC. I'm not making my 200 characters minimum. I'm not making my 200 characters minimum. I'm not making my 200 characters minimum. I'm not making my 200 characters minimum. I'm not making my 200 characters minimum.

title: Very loud vents that do not turn off
text: Surprised by all the great reviews - tiny room with a very loud vent that is impossible to turn off. Room booked with points, I'm told I cant get a refund of points if I were to check out early. Guess I'm stuck

title: The Draper is Dapper!!
text: Our experience with this hotel was stellar. Perfect location and the staff was amazing. Check in and out were great. Perfect outside courtyard off the lounge area for eating breakfast or preparing for the day. Rooms are small but it’s NYC!!

title: Can be better
text:
The hotel is centrally located but the room s size is disappointing on par with other competitors around. Lacks basic things like a microwave. Iron. Hangers. Etc
The good part about the hotel is the front staff I was loaded with 5+ bags the manager named IMRAN was very kind to offer help, helped me with bags easy check in, such good behavior is rare to see in this busy town. From my experience in new from 7 days as a traveller, I recommend the management strongly to encourage such sincere people, and so was the other front office, siddhu was quiet polite. In the end. I want to rooms to be as good as the staff.

title: Great place to stay with friendly staff.
text:
What a great place to stay:)  Walkable to so much; our theater play Wicked, fun coffee shops and bakeries (the Draper does have an in-lobby takeout spot), and Penn Station.
The Draper is spotless and our room had a great view of the Chrysler Building.  Our hotel clerk Imran was so very helpful for all of our NYC excursions, giving us helpful tips and ideas.  He was a welcome sight after our long days of touring!

title: Very poor overall.
text: This is a strange hotel. The room was extremely small but nicely decorated. However, it doesn't even have a closet, or an iron a d so on. Also for a hotel of this stature it doesn't even have a proper place to eat. It was really surprisingly poor. I think the combination of basic amenities that it lacks is unacceptable.

title: Recomend to Stay
text: The front desk staff was extremely helpful. Yousuf got us checked in quickly and helped us getting a Gym pass. Our stay was just for one night but I would highly recommend and would definitely return if visiting nyc again.

title: A really good stay
text: Just what we needed after a couple of nights in a different not so good hotel! The Draper was a really good experience, with a well-finished decor in the room, spotlessly clean, big window with some view, coffee machine, comfy bed, fast elevators and water cooler in the lobby. It's in a really good central location. Staff are friendly and helpful. I can't fault it and would/will stay again.

title: Would definitely recommend!
text: The front desk staff was extremely helpful.  Deepika got us checked in quickly and willing to help.  Our stay was just for one night but I would highly recommend and would definitely return if visiting nyc again.

title: Highly recommend 👍
text: We were stuck scrambling for a room that could accommodate early check in since our flight home was canceled. Deepika was extremely helpful & got us a room quickly & stored our bags until we checked in.  Would highly recommend and return!  Great location.  Thank you Deepika for your excellent customer service!

title: Mid-Town Boutique Hotel
text: Great location, very nice designed room, friendly staff, Thanks to Farhan Imran for his assistance. Convenience location to shopping and Times Square. Highly recommended for a short stay easy in and out location.

title: Dirty
text: Disappointing & dirty, Upon checking into my room I almost slipped on the floor it was greasy & grimy.When I went get into bed I noticed a hair and when I pulled the sheets back seen there was debris

title: Great hotel
text:
Great lovely hotel, perfect for solo travelers, nice room, and great location.
I was greeted by the lovely Nithya at the front desk, and my check in was quick and smooth, kudos.
This is a place I'll definitely consider coming back to in my next visits to New York.

title: The Draper---Highly Recommend
text:
The ENTIRE staff at The Draper are exceptional.
I always request a room with hand rails in the shower/tub and they ALWAYS deliver.
Rooms are very comfortable. ..Bed is very comfortable.   Well appointed..
Best Customer Service....
Can't wait to go back.

title: Fantastic Stay and great night personel
text: Very nice and brand new and super I’m critical of cleanliness, this is by far one of the cleanest hotel and fresh smelling rooms/ only drawback wish had closet space  and extra chair - but big shouts to Muhammed night auditor for making 10 star customer service!! He really was very personal and helpful with making this a great stay!! Def will back to stay at this hotel !!thank you !! Great location and clean and helpful !

title: DO NOT STAY HERE!!
text:
This is the worst hotel to stay in, in nyc! There are many others that will offer you better rooms and service. The many five stars reviews are questionable on here given the level of attention and service I got. I actually reached out and provided this feedback to Sheniza but she can care less and was dismissive the entire time. First, she lied and said she was the General Manager and then I called her out saying Mustafa is, then she confirmed he was away and cannot help me. I said I wanted to talk to him and she refused saying she is the only one who can help me at this hotel. 

Firstly- this hotel is poorly managed. The staff at the front are incompetent and do not offer any solutions but a stare. Secondly- the hotel stinks of weed as soon as you walk in - not okay with children frequenting it. Thirdly, my toilet clogged and there were puddles everywhere in the room - the entire washroom was flooded. My kids almost slipped and banged their heads but of course they do not care. They had no comparable rooms to offer us and refused to refund us. I spoke to Sheniza the next morning and she accused us of causing the clogged toilet- then she accused me of defamation  and I pretty much said this is not defamation if this is truly my experience which it is. Do yourself a favour stay far away from this hotel. You will thank me later.

title: Excelente hotel!
text:
Quando chegamos ao hotel fomos recebidas pela Deepka que nos fez sentir em casa, acolhidas e bem vindas.
Eu até diria que o atendimento dela é uma das melhores coisas que o hotel oferece. Ela parece conhecer os hóspedes, sempre atenciosa, com sorriso no rosto.
Houve um fato que me preocupou um pouco, chegamos um dia no quarto e a porta estava aberta. Tive a impressão de que a pessoa que fez a limpeza não se certificou de ter fechado. Nada sumiu e não houve maiores problemas, mas ao relatar o acontecido o rapaz que atendeu o telefone sequer se desculpou e respondeu que “pode acontecer” . Pode, mas não deveria, e muitas situações ruins podem surgir de eventos como esse. Me pareceu descaso diante de ima situação que poderia ter causado prejuízos.
Mas isso foi uma situação pontual. O hotel é maravilhoso, 2 elevadores grandes, nunca ficamos muito tempo esperando. Tem um café no térreo, e tem sempre água gelada disponível no hall. Muito bem localizado, silencioso, quartos muito limpos e sem carpete. Éramos 4 no quarto com 2 camas de casal. Não tem muito espaço, mas não foi algo que chegou a nos incomodar. O banheiro é lindo, mas acho que podem pensar em disponibilizar algum apoio perto da pia para facilitar o dia a dia. Chuveiro muito bom, ar condicionado silencioso. 
Tem sempre alguém na recepção a qualquer hora, em geral os funcionários são muito atenciosos. 
Esperamos nos hospedar outras vezes.

title: Great personal attention
text: We used the hotel to store our luggage while touring  the NYPublic Library before boarding a bus for Long Island.  The staff, specifically Peter, provided very personal attention and anticipated our needs.  We intend to stay at the hotel on future visits.

title: solved a big problem
text:
I left my cell phone in the lobby. Called 7 hours later, actually got a human being named Peter  who answered 
and confirmed  they had it and told me they would return it the minute I sent them a ups shipping label (by phone).
Peter texted (anotherphone) to confirm each phase of the phones journey with UPS. Peter provided timely,
efficient service with confidence and warmth. I could not ask for more attention to my problem, which was
resolved, and it involved no tipping or compensation of any kind to Peter. Now that's good service!

title: Great Staff Experience
text: The Staff was so welcoming and helpful with regard to storing our luggage and returning a left behind cell phone that we determined we would make this our go to hotel on our next NYC trip. They were so attentive to our needs and we weren't even guests, most especially Peter who gave us personal attention.

title: Great for exploring NYC
text:
Really large comfy great and amazing location to explore NYC. 
The view from the internal facing rooms is not very good - I believe it's next to an abandoned building which was a tad uncomfortable. The shower door is poorly designed and your fingers can easily get stuck.

title: Great experience
text:
The room was very clean. Great location. The staff was very nice, cheerful and helpful. They helped with parking, towels, and ideas on eating. 
Whole family enjoyed the visit. We will definitely return.

title: Nice Stay In Midtown
text:
I chose the Draper due to its location within short walks to Koreatown, Times Square and work.

I was very appreciative that they allowed an early check in so I could rest after my red eye flight.

The room itself did not have much of a view unfortunately so I kept the full window shade down the entire stay.  Luckily there was a lot of lights in both the room and bathroom so that offset the lack of natural light.  Room insulation was acceptable as every now and then I could hear my neighbors mostly as they got off the elevator and entered their rooms.

The room was compact but nicely decorated with a comfortable bed.  A small desk and even a compact refrigerator fit inside.  The closet was an open rack above the fridge. 

In the bathroom all bulk amenities provided to be greener.  Limited countertop space though.

There was no gym onsite but they did issue passes for a nearby one.  The onsite restaurant was just a small coffee shop with very limited seating.

The Draper worked out for my short stay.

title: Great stay
text: Max was extremely helpful and upgraded my room to the city view. I wish Max could work at every hotel. Exceptional service, great rooms, awesome location. Walking distance of so many great places for food and drinks

title: Best Hotel to Stay In NYC
text: The rooms are super clean with one of the best guest services I have ever experienced. Max at the front desk was super accommodating and very helpful. Really comfy bed with a great view of the city. A central location for everything you want to do in the city. Definitely recommend as a place to stay.

title: A Fantastic Stay at The Draper Hotel
text: the beds were very comfortable, everything was very clean, and the staff was very friendly. the location is in a centralized area in mid-town. we had views of the empire state building and bryant park was an easy walk. the coffee shop in the lobby was great too.

title: Excellent hotel and awesome staff!
text:
Excellent hotel!
The location is perfect, walking distance from a lot of popular places.
The rooms are super clean with a nice design and compared to NYC hotels- they are pretty big.
The staff is amazing, really helpful and nice. Max from the front desk will help you with anything you need with a pleasant smile and a great attitude. 
Came back in June 2023 for a team event. booking and checking in went really smoothly thanks to Max.

title: Great spot to stay
text: This property has a great location. The customer service was very friendly, and the accommodations were clean, well designed, and comfortable. We would stay here again, and recommend it for easy access to downtown New York City.

title: Best boutique hotel experience in NYC
text:
Amazing little boutique hotel in mid-town. From the wonderfully welcoming greeting the moment we stepped into the lobby, to the extremely clean corridors to the wonderful room, we would
Happily return to this hotel. Definitely worth the money.

title: Hospitality matters
text: Thank you for the the frontdesk employees Deepika, Nithya and Siddhu. They made me feel comfortable and were always helpful. Their friendliness is a role model for good hospitality. It's really good customer service.

title: Boutique Hotel Oasis in a Bustling NY City
text: If you value the  personalized boutique hotel experience , look no further. This is the place. FIrst of all, the rooms are very modern, comfortable, impeccably serviced and maintained, smell good, and super quiet.The bathroom is so clean and modern, and a delight to take a shower in. And the personalized heater on the floor wall is nice to keep you toasty out of the shower. this place reminds me of the 5 star boutique hotel I stayed in Paris..small rooms but so comfortable!!

title: Front desk
text:
Deepika at the front desk was very helpful and was attentive  , impressive service

Prompt, detailed !

Her outstanding service at Draper NYC's front desk left a lasting impression. 

Her warmth and efficiency made my visit truly enjoyable

Thank you so much

title: Great hotel in the middle of mid-town
text:
We had a very pleasant stay at the Draper. The hotel is new, modern and in a great location. The bed was super comfortable - exactly what we were looking for! The location is in the middle of it all - you can walk to Times Square and all other attractions in mid-town. 

amazing value for the money we paid!

title: Wonderful staying in nyc
text:
Amazing atmosphere - I feel like home here.

My favorite hotel, very good location the rooms are super clean, everybody is very welcoming, the front desk the manager everyone is kind all the time. 
I super recommend it.

title: Great hotel for a quick trip
text: Room was clean and area was very walkable. Everything is near the hotel that you might need. Check in process was easy and quick, didn’t have to wait long. Max at the front desk was very nice + helpful!

title: Sweet boutique hotel with a heart.
text: I came in the morning after 18 hours of flights  a red-eye. I was exhausted and asked for early check-in and a quiet room. Fortunately Max at the front desk and thr cleaning staff were able to check me in 5 hours early at 11am. It was the sweetest little room, spotlessly clean, and I was so grateful got their consideration. I loved the location near the NY Public library and amazing cafes and bakeries.

title: Draper hotel is the best
text:
Great and polite  service 
 Small rooms bit really nicely finished and clean.  No prepared meals but good continental breakfast and previously prepared lunch food with food drink variety. Best thing is politeness and concern for guests-

title: Studio in Midtown, No Perks for Hilton Honor Members
text: Clean, great location and decor but for Hilton Diamon members - find somewhere else that will honor your status. The daily dollar spend allowance is a waste because there's nothing to use it on. The coffee bar has hours of choosing and by 3 - nothing is open. The staff uses the elevators at their leisure, so be prepared to wait for one. No upgrades, no irons without request. Basic room in middle Manhattan. Staff will not move you.

title: A truly boutique hotel experience
text: The double bed suite on the 23rd floor is perhaps one of the most amazing rooms in manhattan. It should be called the Empire State room. When you open the curtains, you have the most amazing, unobstructed view of the Empire State Building. The staff was warm and accommodating. The cleanliness of the room was impeccable. The decor was so chic. The room was everything I’ve ever wanted in a stay in Manhattan. A stay at the Draper is a MUST.

title: Draper Tapestry NYC
text: Hotel was clean with  new bathrooms, comfortable beds, mostly quiet side street between 5th and 6th Avenues. Close to Bryant Park, Macys and lots of shopping. I walked from theater district and it was about a mile-nice walk. Staff was friendly, welcoming and helpful.

title: Max is the best
text: Max is the greatest if all time. Love it. Super clean! The view is amazing. We can see right at the Empire State Building. If I had to complain about one thing, it would be that there are, in my opinion, no walkable Paper source stores

title: Never again-horrible experience
text:
Only because I can’t give it a zero. I called the day before our arrival to say we would be arriving early and they said fine. When we got here our room wasn’t ready and they said it would be two hours. FIVE hours later and I’m still waiting.  They offer no reason except the housekeepers aren’t  done/are on break.  If I could get a refund I would leave immediately and go elsewhere. They have no concern that we have been traveling since 4 AM and this is my daughter’s 18 th birthday trip-which we are spending sitting in the “lounge” waiting. 
Horrible experience. Never again. 

Worst experience I’ve had at a hotel.

title: MAX!
text: Max is very helpful. He was able to help get my room check earlier than expected. Great staff. Very helpful. First time coming to this hotel. The layout is good. No complaints from here. Time to experience NYC.

title: Max was magnificent
text: Me and my friend flew in early from the west coast, arrived at the hotel around 10AM and check in was not until 3PM. Max at the front desk worked his magic and was able to get us in to a room much earlier than we anticipated. Max was very great and accommodative. Rooms are on the smaller side, no real closet, but the staff was fantastic. Especially Max.

title: Front desk magic
text: Max at the front desk what great! The man needs a raise! He was a delight with our rooms, helped us upgrade, and even made sediment recommendations about the city 😊 Gotta check this place out if you’re in New York

title: Best staff in NYC!!!!
text: The Draper changed to the Hilton brand, but the staff did not and that is a great thing, because that is the best part of the Hotel! Pathik, Shenezia, Max and the rest of the staff have been amazing! As a Hilton Diamond member, and with so many options to stay in NYC, I still prefer the Draper!

title: Great place to stay for a few days in Manhattan
text:
Deepika on front desk is super; she really made a positive difference to my stay with her charming personality and willingness to help. 

Great location close to all amenities; views towards Empire State. Basic, clean accommodation with fridge & quality toiletries; nice and quiet given the limited number of rooms on each floor. 

Thanks Deepika!

title: Way overrated and overpriced
text:
Pros -
- updated room decor
- comfortable bed
- quick hot water
- no carpet 

Cons-
- the TV system is slow and terrible
- there is NO counter space in the bathroom 
- the shower doors have no gaskets so water gets all over the bathroom floor
- no closet in the room , hang your clothes over the mini fridge but the space is not high enough between the top of the fridge and the hanger
- whoever designs the rooms obviously has never traveled

title: Great place to stay
text:
Great place to stay. Central location near to the Empire State Building. Our room had a good view of the empire state - highly recommend booking the rooms with a view. 
Check in was easy and staff were friendly and helpful. Lifts were quick so we didn’t have to wait long to get to the room. 
The room was fairly small but still enough space for two people without feeling cramped. Plenty of usb charging points and power sockets. The beds were really comfy and the rooms were quiet - even in the middle of the city we got a good night’s sleep. Fridge in the room to store drinks and snacks etc. 
Subway lines, plenty of places to eat and drink around. Only minor negatives were not being able to turn the lights off from the bed (but not a big deal given the size of the room) and there was limited storage space in the bathroom. However the toiletries provided by the hotel (hand soap, moisturiser, shampoo and conditioner) were nice.
Overall a great stay.

title: Family’s first nyc trip.
text: Mr.Max and miss Dipika weresuper nice and they helped to check-in in a convincing manner. Early check-in was given as it was raining and they helped us get a room super early. To my surprise the rooms were super cozy and pleasant smell. Lobby has a cafe and also a business center. Always recommend this as it is located at a very nice location on 37th and 5th.

title: Poorly designed rooms
text:
Rooms are modern and well finished but just too small and poorly designed.  Many NY hotel rooms are small but more thoughtfully arranged.  A few things you should know if you go:
1) No rooms have closets.  At most you get four hangers over the coffee maker
2) there is no shelving or place in bathrooms to put your toiletries, and only one towel hook, no racks
3) the floors are clean (hotel is quite clean) but the floor wax is sticky - esp in bare feet
4) very little place to unpack - just one drawer underbed (the second drawer is for the safe)
5) standard rooms are small, no where to set up a luggage rack without blocking something else or the door
So if you are coming for 1 night perhaps it's ok, but they just really didn't think it through. 

Staff and service were fine, hotel and linens clean, mattress comfortable, shower had fine pressure, etc.

title: Great location for solo travelers
text:
I had some issues with my reservation before I arrived. When I made the reservation, The Draper was affiliated with Choice hotels and during the time I made the reservation and the time for me to actually stay at the hotel, they became affiliated with Hilton hotels instead. I recieved an email from Choice hotels stating that my reservation may no longer be valid and I fretted about it quite a bit, especially since there was no other way to come in contact with the hotel than giving them a phone call. I did call them twice, the first time was the same day I received the email from Choice hotels, and a second time a few days before my departure, and both times they confirmed my reservation. 

The hotel itself is located between Bryant park subway station and Herald square subway station and within walking distance from Penn station and Times square, so the location is great. 5th Ave is just around the corner from the hotel.
I had booked a king room with a city view and I could see the Empire State Building from the room. The room was really quiet, I hardly heard any street noise and I either lucked out with quiet neighbors or the walls and roof were thick enough to not let me hear the people beside me and above me.
The standard rooms are small compared to regular US hotel rooms, but I really didn't think much of it because I'm used to staying in hotel rooms that size in Sweden and in Europe. For me as a solo traveler, it was sufficient, but it would be somewhat small for two people to share a standard room since there's not much room to move around. My suitcase almost fit entirely under the bed but there's really no place to put your large luggage other than trying to put it under the bed. There are two drawers under the bed but one of them is taken by the in-room safe and the other one is big enough to hold an empty or flat backpack. The rooms also have a small fridge, which was great as I could buy breakfast items at the nearby Whole Foods and eat breakfast in the room before venturing out.
You need to ask reception for housekeeping, which was fine by me. All the staff I came in contact with were really friendly and welcoming and I will definitely keep this hotel in mind for my next trip to NYC.

title: Great stay
text: A new and lovely boutique hotel, great location and excellent costumer service. All the front desk employees are really welcoming and helpful. Clean rooms. Close to Time Square and safe area to walk at night. We felt safe in this area. We slept like babies in this quiet area

title: Diamond/Gold members steer clear of this hotel
text:
The Draper is bare bones of a hotel. I get it it’s a boutique hotel, but so are most Kimpton’s and they offer much more than this Hilton property. The Draper is more of a fancy dorm/hostel. 

There’s no bar, no restaurant, no gym, no rooftop, no room service, no nothing. There’s no app check in, so be ready to hang out at the front desk when you arrive. There wasn’t a line when I checked in but somehow it still took the girl 15 minutes to give me my key.

Rooms are tiny. There wasn’t a proper closet. No iron or ironing board. I asked for upgrade while checking in and was told there wasn’t any. I got a 5th floor room with a view of a dirty fire escape and another building. Asked for robe and was told that’s for guest staying in suites only. 

I wasn’t given bottled water or a voucher for the breakfast cafe. Cafe is open from like 8am-1pm so if you have an early morning you’ll have to go somewhere else to get coffee. It’s funny the other reviews on here are like “it’s so close to restaurants and cafes”. Hello!! It’s Manhattan not New Jersey. Any hotel you stay at will be near eateries, attractions, etc. The hotel is east side so train options are minimal so you need to walk west towards Times Square for more options. 

Overall it’s a no for me. No Diamond status perks and for the price I paid there are a million other choices within a 5 block radius. 

I usually stay at the Hilton Garden Inn a few blocks away on Park Ave but wanted to try something different. Big mistake! At least I get my hot breakfast and coffee starting at like 6am there, they have gym, laundry room, restaurant attached has rooftop, rooms are decent size and they always put me on a high floor, corner room with city view. 

Oh and when most Hilton’s are taking a $50 or $100 deposit this place is taking $150. A little steep for a hotel you can’t even order room service from. What also doesn’t make sense is that this hotel hasn’t connected with one of the 20 different gyms in the area to give passes to guest so they can work out during their stay. There’s a crunch gym 2 blocks away. Such a missed opportunity. I don’t see this hotel being a Hilton property for long.

title: Wouldn’t stay again
text:
The area is great but when you arrive there isn’t a large loading in area or anyone outside to take luggage or help in any way. The parking is around the block so not far away but not convenient if you can’t unload easily at the hotel first. The parking is cheaper by $10 a day with validation. 
The rooms are quite small and extremely narrow, not one closet to hang things up, the beds are extremely soft and you can hear everything happening the dinging of the elevator, other guests in their rooms etc. The room was neat but not exactly clean. 
To leave your luggage after checkout they charge you per bag and obviously if you go over the 24 hour limit with parking you’ll be charged for another full day which is expected but expensive. 
When we left my son forgot his electric toothbrush as well as other toiletries. I called that day and it was not turned in so it’s disappointing that the staff would just take it. 
I don’t recommend.

title: Excellent hotel
text: This hotel is in an excellent location between 5th and 6th Avenue.  Staff are very helpful and friendly.  Rooms are perfect with two double beds.  Coffee shop opened till 1pm each day.  They have a lovely lounge area where we brought takeaways back to on 2 days.  For the price we paid it was excellent value.  Hotel was spotless and I'd definitely stay there again.

title: Three out of four were EXCELLENT
text:
The hotel is nice. The entrance is nice. The staff (for the most part) was nice.
The arrangement was that my fiance will check in before I do. The name was provided. I 
checked with the staff the day before to confirm is such is not bad. I was assured that it was not b bad. When my fiance got to the hotel, the person, Peter, at the desk greeted her and things were not a problem. I then went to (after having paid for the room that morning) the room that night and the person at the desk seemed to not want to believe that I knew the staff by name, had paid, showed my printed receipt, knew the room number, knew the name of the person in the room and essentially gave me a hard time when I wanted to get upstairs. The staff besides that, Peter, Max and the woman who is the fire safety person there were nice. The only person who was a problem was the gentleman who wanted (after I showed I paid) to see my I.D. Having worked in hotels, I knew once a person can prove one paid, one need not show one's I.D. I state that because I was not checking in, my fiance had already been checked in and I prior to that had paid. I showed the printed receipt. There is no way that could have been forged. Would I recommend that hotel to people? Yes. But, make sure the person is not the night time gentlemen who checks you in.

title: Bad, Poor customer experience when 'service' was actually needed
text:
Registered this complaint to the GM and have only had the bare minimum I service standards as clearly she is too busy and has many meetings or isn't in office.

Max, your staff member has consistently been rude, passive aggressive despite me being courteous from the day I requested to change my room. When I requested for the manager, he disregarded me and became rude - triggering me.

Secondly, it is clear your hotel is trans exclusionary with misgendering and further reflecting a standard unbecoming of Hilton or even your competitors (IHG, Wyndham specifically where I am platinum and gold respectively) 

Other points:

They double debited my credit card with the full amount (plus deposit I assume). 

Someone had been smoking on the floor I was on on the first and second night.

I heard a Baby crying, Man snoring during my stay at night.

Shower handle not fit properly and seemed like it needed maintenance in my second room.

The TV wasn't working in my first room.

Receptionist mentions someone else's name and not mine as I requested housekeeping over the phone. Further confirming that the room change was not reflecting after the fact.

Hilton hotels in Southern Africa have done much better for the brand that this deplorable place. Don't waste your hard earned money. Regret not using my other loyalty hotel groups as I tried out this waste of my money.

title: A lot more Manners and space !!!
text: The rooms were clean as was  the bathroom but absolutely not big enough for 2 adults my adult daughter and I had 2 small double beds we hadn't even room to pass each other or to properly store our clothes or cases shower was tiny you couldn't swing a cat seriously not big enough at all .staff were not pleasant or helpful in any way infact they were rude leaving their guests to stand around while they finished telephone conversation only one person on desk most of the time , they wouldn't even help my daughter and I as we struggled with our luggage they offered no assistance at all with anything during our stay definitely would not stay here again Manners and polite conversation even a nice good morning etc would go a long way and a lot more room space !!!

title: Poor Customer service by Dipika
text:
We stayed at this hotel due to its location. It is a very small room which is understandable for Manhattan, with that said we did have a bad experience. 

First the good: 
Max, was very nice and on top of things
Location was good
Room was clean (upon arrival at least)

The not so good:

I asked for the room to be cleaned about 3 times (nicely) throughout the day, each time they said “don”t worry it will get done, they have until like 5 or 6pm to do it”

Around 5 pm I come down to lobby, (mind you we left to make sure they had time to clean) and I ask Dipika “this is the fourth time I need to ask for room cleaning” she then tells me everyone left already and this never got done, she did NOT have a solution. I had to tell her “you can either give me partial credit because I am not getting what we paid for or get us another room”

Finally we get a different room, in the process we left a wallet in the old room cause this is such a pain in the neck to move, and it was a nightmare trying to retrieve it later after checking out,  once we realized we left it behind.

Could have been a solid 4 stars but due to this bad experience we likely won’t return.

title: Amazing Staff and Location
text: This hotel is a perfect location for a Manhattan adventure, only  blocks from the Empire Sate Building. The real gem was the friendly and helpful staff. Max was amazing at check in, friendly, knowledgeable and made us feel like a valued guest. He made sure we will stay at the Draper on future trips to NY.

title: Romm deposit not returned after 16 days, ignoring all contact
text: Happy to take a $200 deposit for room incidentals, happy to confirm it was due back in full. However, 16 days after we checked out we still have received the deposit back. Sent 10 messages but not had a response to a single one

title: Waaaay better than expected for the price $$$
text:
Stayed from the 18th of February to the 22nd - 9 of us in 3 rooms 

First of all, I’d like to thank the Gentleman who checked us in on the Saturday, and provided us with information when we needed it, I think he works nights on reception 

Brilliant location, at the end of the street there’s a five guys, McDonald’s, Taco Bell, chil fil a, Paris baguette and kirspy crème (4th Avenue) 

The hotel is modern and clean, there’s a little cafe area in reception that’s open in the day time.

Rooms are smaller than most places (but that’s New York for you) it had 2 beds, modern clean bathroom, flat screen Tv with 100s of cable channels, the only negative is that there’s no wardrobe space

It’s 3 up down from the Empire State Building, Maceys etc and 3 blocks down from Bryant park

In my opinion it’s a perfect location easy to get to things, subways close by.

All new amenities in the rooms, vending machines in the basement

I would 100% recommend this hotel and I will be returning

title: Great visit
text: Everything is new and shiny at the Draper.  Such a well equipped room with a comfy king bed. Staff was wonderful. The location is perfect.  Central to midtown, yet I was able to easily walk to the Highline on 30th and head to the Whitney. Rooms are on the small side, that's the only negative, but why would you come to Manhattan and stay in your room?

title: Nice hotel, good location
text: Stayed here unexpectedly after being moved from the Best Western round the corner. Nice hotel, not a lot of floor space in the room but was ok for one person.  Good location for transport links and tourist spots.  Friendly staff.  Housekeeping is on request

title: Nice small hotel with friendly staff in good location
text: When we got bounced to the Draper Hotel from the closed Best Western Herald Square, I was concerned. But the Draper worked our really well. It is located near many attractions and the staff is very friendly and accommodating. Our room was small, but very clean and the bed was comfortable. We asked for partial housekeeping during our stay and were pleasantly surprised to get full housekeeping. The one thing lacking was counter space in the bathroom and shelves in the shower. We also had very noisy neighbors our first night but thankfully they checked out.

title: Friendly staff in a clean, contemporary hotel
text: This is a great little hotel in Midtown. The staff was friendly and helpful... they led me to the best pizza I've ever had! The rooms were clean and neat, with a contemporary feel.  I would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Worst Customer Service I've Ever Experienced
text:
I booked a reservation with this hotel in January for an upcoming stay next month.  I received a call two days ago from the hotel saying they were cancelling my reservation because they were switching flags to Hilton.  The hotel staff admitted that they knew about this switch over last year, but let me go ahead and book the reservation on the website anyways.  I asked to speak with a manager and it took three days to get a call back.  When I did speak with the Assistant Manager, she was abrasive, rude, condescending, and constantly cut me off while speaking.  I had never been spoken to this way by a member of a hotel staff ever in my life.

The hotel cancelling my reservation seems like a blessing in disguise if this is how their hotel staff operates.  I'm a Diamond member at Hilton as well and this gives me serious pause about wanting to stay with them in the future if they're going to put this hotel and it's atrocious management/customer service under their flag.

title: Love love love!!!
text: I had fantastic time at the Draper! The location is perfect and I really loved the decor in my room. The room was bigger than I expected and my bed was cozy. The supervisor, Max was amazing and he made sure I felt welcomed. He was knowledgeable and helpful and I will definitely make sure I come back and stay here! 10/10

title: Great Hotel that I highly recommend!
text: I booked a room at the Draper for a quick overnight business trip and wish I could have stayed longer! I was warmly welcomed at the front desk and check in was a breeze. My room was on the 17th floor and I had an amazing view of the Empire State Building. The Rate was very reasonable, the Bed was perfect and the pillows were even better. The room was clean, nice hot shower and quiet for a solid nights sleep. I highly recommend the Draper and will be staying there again in May. Special thanks to Dipika!! Such a lovely young lady that made me feel right at home.

title: Great value for money!
text:
I booked 7 nights in a King Room City View (room 1801) via Choice Hotels for $872/£707 ($125/£101 avg per night),  free cancallation up until a few days before and also recieved nearly 8,000 Choice Points for the booking. No resort fees/city tax had to be payed at check out, card was charged $120 the day before arrival to secure booking then refunded a few days later and paid around $120 damage deposit which was refunded shortly after stay.

Room was perfect for a solo traveller, large TV with chromecast, fridge, safe, coffee maker and storage. May struggle storage wise for 2. Bathroom was stocked well with towels, wash cloths, shampoo and body wash. Housekeeping had to be booked 1 day in advance although towels/toiletries could be requested anytime. There also was access to vending machines, ice machines and microwave/cafe which I did not use. My city view was facing uptown had noted in my booking special instructions and emailed to request a view of the Empire State Building although had no response. The King Room with no city was $807 for my dates, in future I would likely not opt for the city view in this property. 

No issues with elevators, serviced by 2 and never had to wait.

Hotel is situated in a safe and quiet area, had no issues coming and going at all times. Walking distance to 34th St Herald Sq subway and Times Sqaure.

Will definitely stay again if can get at the same rate.

title: Great location, friendly staff
text:
We recently spent 4 nights at the Draper in a Premium King room (#1805). It was overall a lovely stay, and I've listed pros and cons below. Nothing egregious in the cons list, but just some little things that could have made the trip even better!

PROS:
-Great location
-Friendly staff
-Great view from our room of the Empire State Building
-CitiBike rental just outside 
-Fridge and safe in the room (safe occupies one entire under bed storage drawer)

CONS:
-As expected, it's a very tiny room and has no closet. We appreciated the storage drawers under the bed (the suitcase space under the bed was not tall enough for my bag though.) However, like most women I need space to put my things in the bathroom. There was AMPLE wall space for more shelves or hooks, but the walls were completely bare save for one hook.
-There were no outlets or chargers on one side of the bed
-The website advertises shuttle service, but when I called to ask about it was told they don't offer it at all. It's still on their website as an amenity.
-The coffee shop in the lobby seemed really lovely, but is only open until 1pm. Like many tourists, we liked going out in the morning and coming back before dinner. It would have been really nice to be able to grab a coffee or beverage/snack in the afternoon.
-The guide on the tv only showed the names of the channels, not what was on so it really wasn't helpful at all.
-One morning, they were fire alarm testing (which we completely understand and are totally glad it gets done!) But the testing had gone on constantly for over an hour by the time we left the room.
