It was obviously loud, but my only issue with this is that the hotel has a texting system (I got messages the whole trip) and it would have been really nice if they could have let everyone know the system was going to be tested. Even a notice in the elevator or lobby would have been courteous to give us a heads up.

title: Pocket hotel that brings sudden wonders
text:
In NYC on business working near Penn, so location and a quiet oasis vibe was paramount to my needs: The Draper delivered. I scored a deal on one of their most economical rooms, and it was newly renovated and very quiet, facing the back on a lower floor, with not much of a view but windows that opened and a really cool large shade that was easy to operate. 

Bed was super big and comfortable-- I'm thinking they could go with Queen beds or even Fulls for a room this size bc most of the room is bed, and it's big even for two ppl.  Or maybe their parent company could experiment with Murphy Beds or similar, as per what is trending on social media these days. As someone earlier reviewed, the pillows are indeed softies but I like that, and coupled by the fact that there were like five, I was good.

Bathroom was freshly renovated, painted, lots of favorable lighting, perfect. Water pressure strong, water hot. Etc. Plenty of towels. I appreciated the full length mirror near the door, good for 'last looks' and errant food fails and such.

I also liked the extra touches of room decor, good color choices, darker, patterned, with irreverent art work above the bed and little choices like this small green chair at the small desk that was so charming. Having a refrigerator (cold) and room safe (it's in the pull out beneath the bed) rounded out the extras, as well as a softly glowing alarm clock and back lighting on the mirror that doubled as a nightlight. very cool. 

The front desk was professionally staffed and overall the hotel felt like a 'real hotel experience' in that way you're greeted (not always tho) when you enter and exit. I did not avail myself of their services but felt they were in charge and competent throughout. 

Also echoing what someone has said about the elevators -- they are ridiculously fast. Never had a problem getting to and fro on those. Visited the "Concourse level" aka the basement for ice, and there was no problem at all going down six or so floors for this effort in my sweats. 

Setbacks included a TV that did not operate correctly or maybe was no longer synced to the cable channels etc. It kept saying "weak antennae signal" or something. But that's fine with me, I was busy and out of the room most of the day and night, and I also had my lap top. But seeing that the TV is another huge visual element  in the small room, the hotel could either get more bang out of it, or think about reducing the size altogether or going a different route.  

An element I am sensitive about is Wifi, and I was discouraged to see the hotel uses an open network approach, which is the least protective in regards to data breaches, and phising. A password protected Wifi would be great, especially as I needed to access some financial stuff that I didn't want to share with the global online community. etc.  

Also, when I first showered, the water pressure was so strong that it caused a little flood on the bathroom floor, I believe because the shower head is too big for the shower? Idk. But I was mindful and kept a towel there and there were no other problems. The handle t to the shower is also a tad modern for my preference, and it took a second for this Luddite to break the code of the hot/cold levers and such. You'll see what I mean. Also could not source the trap for the sink, to shave, etc. but didn't pose any hazards there.

Last setback for me was minor, but the hotel is located far closer to 5th Ave than 6th Ave, so a walk to the subways is two clicks longer than you'll want, but still reasonably close, closest subway is at Herald Square I believe, so that's a small note but I did feel that distance going back and forth from my meetings and such. Not a big deal. When I Uber'd around at night of course this issue was irrelevant. 

I'll def be back, booking a larger room on a higher floor. I like these little pocket hotels that bring sudden wonders. Have a look at The Draper.

title: Loud room with poor customer service on check out
text: I was told I was assigned a quiet room far from the elevator but was awakened multiple times overnight with elevator noise and the sounds other guests in the hallway and adjacent rooms as well as a leaky toilet  stopper.  My room phone did not connect to the front desk.  On check out the front desk attendant did not apologize for the inconvenience, rather put the blame on me for not calling reception overnight.

title: Cozy hotel with a great location
text:
Location was perfect, midtown NY. 5 minutes walk from Herald subway station making our  experience a very good one. 

The room had a nice view, everything was clean, and room service was great. 
Staff was very kind and helpful.

Small hotel, great location, cozy and cute.

title: Small room, but extremely clean and comfortable
text: Had an small issue getting checked in because of a communication error between employees. But easily resolved and then the rest of the stay was wonderful. Recommend one of the rooms with an outside balcony and I never tried the liquor bar but the coffee bar was very good. Maybe a 5-10 minute walks to most common subway entrance.

title: Best hotel in Midtown Manhattan!
text:
This was the best stay in Manhattan! The location is perfect in Midtown and central to the upper and lower parts of Manhattan especially if you take advantage of the subway. We really enjoyed the stay and will recommend this boutique hotel to anyone going on a trip to New York! The rooms were clean and house keeping always kept up with fresh towels and sheets. Just be sure to let the receptionist downstairs know when you’d like housekeeping scheduled! The view was still really nice from 5th Ave and the price was amazing. Hope to stay at the Draper in the future! 

Thank you to the Draper hotel staff and thank you to Max for all your help and kindness!

title: Girls Trip
text: The rooms were very clean, a little tight but comfortable, Max at the front desk was super helpful, and great costumer service. Check in was a breeze, hotel staff was fabulous! So far It’s been a great experience. Good location!

title: Will return to this hotel
text:
Kind service. Clean comfortable room. Great location with access to all city services

Good bathroom.

Coffe shop in lobby and nice lounge at back of the lobby with plenty of seating and internet access access.

title: Girls trip to New York
text:
Hotel was clean, everyone we encountered was very nice and accommodating, The location was perfect for us as we were there for the theatre district.  Beds and pillows were very comfortable. There is a coffee shop in the hotel but it didn't open till 8am which was a little late for me. 
Also a hotel employee by the name of Dupita was most helpful and courteous.

title: NYC? STAY AT The Draper!
text:
Spectacular, friendly service that went above and beyond! Clean spacious rooms- you might forget you are in NYC! Easy to get to, easy check in and check out, WONDERFUL! 
If you are going to visit New York City, stay here! Really. We had a king room, a double, and a suite- all of them were fabulous!

title: Great location
text:
The location of hotel is absolutely perfect. The Broadway shows are all within 15 minutes walk, Empire State Building around the corner, several other interesting places are within walking distance. 
Hotel is clean, well furnished and staff is nice. Great advantage is, that there is a small café selling some pastries, sandwiches etc. for breakfast so you don´t need to go somewhere else. I highly recommended the stay here.

title: Excelente
text: Excelente la atención y la amabilidad del personal, muy cerca de zonas principales para ver de noche como el empire y times square.. los chicos muy atentos en todo y siempre predispuestos… genio mohammed

title: We would stay there next visit
text: The hotel is convenient to all the main attractions and safe. The room is small but the bed is very comfortable and a very clean and good bath and shower. Very quick elevator and staff are friendly and helpful! There is a nice area to relax and wait for cab near the lobby.

title: Worthy Hotel close to many attractions
text:
Older Hotel. Comfortable rooms. Not very big. 
Only wish they had a breakfast. There is a fiid place in lobby. Just not a real breakfast. 

Had a great rate. No closets in room. Drawers under bed.  Again small older hotel.

title: Clean and convenient!
text: The hotel is well situated right off 5th Ave and within walking distance to restaurants and stores. We were welcomed and able to check in a little early which was very convenient. The room is small, but fine for two people and it was modern and clean. My only complaints are the pillows were small and flat; I need a little elevation, and there were no decaf options in the cafe downstairs. I’d stay here again!!

title: Great place to stay for Business
text: One of the quietest places I have stayed anywhere, let alone NYC. The staff was very professional and helpful, especially Depika. I will certainly stay here the next time I am in New York City for either business or pleasure.

title: Minor bathroom problems
text: Great location.  Near the Empire State building. This is the second  time we've stayed in this hotel. Minor issues- ventilation fan in the bathroom didn't work (repeat problem). Toilet paper is rough, bring your own toilet paper.

title: Cool place
text: The best hotel in new york city which is near to most of the tourist destinations in NY. The receptionist MISS DEEPICA is awesome. She always assists us with our needs. The room is neat and clean but small (but its ok). We are sure to be back next time.

title: Great hotel in a great location.
text: The hotel was fantastic, I would highly recommend this hotel, if you wish to stay in Manhattan. Very central and close to attractions such as the Empire State Building. The reception staff were excellent, always willing to help or advise in any way, for anything we needed. The room was big enough to stay in, (the bed was a super king and was very comfortable), staying in New York, you don't stay in the hotel. We had a fantastic time, but it was always nice to get back to the hotel, for a nice relaxing and comfortable rest.

title: Fantastic value and stay
text:
I was truly surprised by this hotel considering the price I paid.  The location, decor and cleanliness exceeded my expectations.  I have stayed at many New York hotels (for work) and typically I stay at 5 stars that break the bank, and most recently stayed at few smaller boutique hotels that we're huge disappointments.  This one checked the boxes, the elevator was fast and reliable, rooms are up to date and well cared for, featured a nice window with a street view.  I loved the lobby, decor, and halls. Front desk was helpful and informative about maid service, the cafe, and amenities. My only suggestion is they should offer to assist guest with bags; I had two kids and 6 bags no one offered assistance.  Lastly I suggest they should offer bottled water at arrival or in the guest room instead of cups. 

Overall a boutique fantastic hotel that I would book again  and plan to stay on my next visit!

title: Amazing customer service
text: Our stay was wonderful from check-in and check-out. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. For first timers in the city, we lucked out with the location of The Draper. It was close to all the major tourist attractions and the subway. Our room was clean with huge windows. We will be back to the city and will be staying at The Draper again.

title: The Draper - The Hidden Gem in New York City
text: I actually live in NYC but go to the Draper once a month (Day Use) for my day of escape.  Shenezia, the manager, is incredible in making sure every single one of your needs are met.  If I didn't live in NYC and was a tourist this would be the definitive place to stay!

title: Perfect stay
text: Beautiful hotel. Close to all the sights. Excellent, helpful staff. Clean and comfortable room. Quiet night even though we were near the heart of the city.  I would stay again the next time I am in NYC.

title: Birthday celebration for my daughter
text: Spent 4 days and 3 nights in New York City at the Draper. Was a fantastic experience. Spoke to Max on the phone when we booked and he was very helpful. Also he was a total gem throughout our stay making sure we had what we needed as well as giving recommendations and answering questions. Reasonable prices and nice rooms. Everything was updated and clean.  Comfortable beds. A little small but what do you expect in New York City.  It was the perfect location to see everything we wanted to see. Close to the Subway and within walking distance of all the fun stuff. Highly recommend.

title: Quick Trip to NYC between XMas and New Years.
text:
The hotel is conveniently located a few blocks from Herald Square.  The rooms are small, but clean and modern.  There are restaurants and bars at your doorstep.  Great hotel for a quick trip to NYC.

The room had a modern finish and the hotel staff were always friendly and ready to help.

title: Great Place To Stay
text: The perfect place to stay when in NYC. This is the fourth (maybe fifth) time we've stayed at The Draper and it's always a great experience. Very close to Time Square and the Broadway theaters. Hope to be there again soon. Highly recommended!

title: Vacation
text: Best experience ever. Hotel clean, ALL of the staff went above and beyond! Max was very helpful and so kind, also the gentleman that works the night shift was so kind to help me when I kept locking myself out of my room. I felt right at home at The Draper.

title: Loved our stay!
text: We traveled to NYC for Christmas and really loved staying in this beautiful hotel close to Times Square! Such a great location, clean & cozy room, and VERY friendly and accommodating staff! Highly recommend!

title: Great hotel, great location.
text: Great hotel, beautiful decor and comfy beds and very clean ! Great location to all the sites in NYC! We were very happy with our stay and would recommend! I would recommend free coffee station as they do have a coffee bar but it closes and in NYC a cup of hot coffee after walking in the cold would be nice!

title: Typical Ne York prison cell size room
text: While the stuff was friendly and professional, the fact is that room is typical New York Prison Cell size of the room without microwave. As you might already know, I am not fan of the city and it's hotels. From some reason, holloway and elevator were warmer than room. Happy to get out as soon as it's over.

title: Not a fan of this hotel
text:
I stayed at a Hilton Garden for 3 days prior to spending my final night in New York at Draper. The difference is night and day. Location - further away from Broadway and more quiet somewhat boring area. No gym - they recommended heading to Best Western to use theirs. 

Also, my freaking room was cold and the heater wasn’t effective enough with temps outside near zero. I didn’t have this issue at the Hilton. The hotel solution give me a ghetto heater and extra blankets.

Definitely not boutique like it claims when you need to go the bottom level to use a microwave instead of having one in your room.

I will not stay here again!

title: Very nice.
text: The hotel is relatively new and very clean. The staff is super friendly and always ready to help.  The rooms are efficiency type but had everything we needed. The only thing I would ask is for a little  more heat in the business area. Then again, it was 7 degrees  Fahrenheit outside.

title: So pleased…
text: I truly could not have asked for more. When I visit NYC, I typically expect (for my price range) that I will have a small, older room that meets my needs - not much more. This year we took the family, and we got two rooms at The Draper, both with incredible city views - the Empire State Building loomed just outside. The king single was modern and well appointed. Our suite was surprisingly large and modern, as well. The staff was incredibly courteous, there were periodic check-ins via text, and everyone was ready to help. The hotel is located right off 5th, so you miss the Times Square noise, but you lose a little of the convenience of the subway stop at seemingly every corner in the heart of Times Square. The stops here are a few blocks’ walk, but it’s easily doable, and you end up around Grand Central/Bryant Park, so it’s not bad at all. In all, I have no complaints, and my thanks to the staff for making it a stay to remember.

title: Amazing Value in NYC
text: The Draper has an amazing location (walkable to a lot of key sights).  It is also very reasonably priced, particularly for New York City.  The rooms were a bit cramped (especially for a family of 4) and basic; however, we couldn’t have expected much given the price and doesn’t really matter anyway since we are too busy experiencing the city.  The staff were also very good.

title: A gem of a hotel
text: We have stayed at The Draper twice  in 2022 and keep coming back. I love the location, the staff are always friendly, knowledgeable and helpful  and the rooms are very clean! The price is reasonable for NYC.

title: Amazing Hotel!!!!
text:
We went to NYC for a Christmas getaway and our journey started a little bumpy. The airline we flew with lost our luggage and delayed our flight by almost 2 days. But when we finally arrived and checked into our hotel, the draper. Everything felt amazing. The staff were kind, welcoming, and helpful. I loved the amenities like the heating and the ice machine. And when we needed clothes due to our luggage lost they directed us to a great store nearby. They booked us a taxi when we asked and called the company multiple times to check where it was. They went the extra mild where they could and that is more than what you can hope for. The hotel was clean and the room was cosy. Our view wasn't too bad but considering we're in the middle of manhattan it'd be silly to expect an ocean view or anything like that. Where we couldn't count on our airline we could count on the draper. 

Thank you so much for the stay we hope to see you qgain !

title: Diamond in the middle of NY!
text: It is very nostalgic, decor is modern, rooms are a great size since you are spending most of the time around the city. It is literally in the middle of everything, the hotel is in the prime location of the city !  It takes a minutes to walk to the time square , Vanderbilt-summit one , etc. staff is superb, friendly, and eager to help and ask if you need anything !  The beds are comfortable, it’s truly a Diamond hotel!

title: Great Hotel & Location
text: This was a great hotel and the location was amazing. I almost feel like this was a hidden gem right in the heart of NYC. It was very clean, staff was friendly, it was affordable and everything went smoothly. The room wasn't huge but big enough for two people comfortably. Walking distance to a lot of sites or close enough to the subway to easily get around. Would definitely recommend and stay here again!

title: Accommodating
text: Small and quaint hotel. Clean and the staff is very helpful. Mix up in my reservations and they accommodated me. The hotel was not busy so they were able to make other arrangements and did. Will use in the future.

title: Beautiful Hotel
text: Beautiful hotel, close to everything…Time Square, restaurants, and fun. Would LOVE to go there and stay there again. Staff was wonderful and so very helpful! My only complaint is one of the elevators was out of order so we had long waits. Other than that, we had an amazing time.

title: The Draper
text: We stayed during the last weekend.  We had a great experience while staying there.  The room, while very small, was comfortable.  The room was cold but warmed up nicely.   My only complaint is that there is no room to store anything.  The bathroom has no place to put your toiletries and the room had very little place to store our things.  Other than that, we were pleased.

title: Good and Bad
text:
Great location, clean, nice cafe, extra bedding available,nice friendly staff.
and then it goes downhill. $50 early check in, even though room is ready, charging to store bags, even though when I called, the staff said no charge
Tiny rooms which were FREEZING cold, so we needed LOTS of extra bedding !!they took a few hours to warm up, and never made it to the desired temperature.
Bathrooms are also tiny, but sufficient .
Random credit card charges- the full amount was charged at check in, and then also $720, which was unnecessary as there were no extras available to charge to the rooms…

title: NYC at Christmastime
text: Lovely hotel. Centrally located. Well maintained. Clean. Staff exceptional and helpful. Delivered a seemless well executed experience. Thank you Ali, Shenezia and others. You and your staff exceeded expectation. Cheers!

title: 5 Days in New York
text:
Great hotel in a fantastic location. Good points- welcoming reception team, good facilities, comfy and very clean room. Good shower with toiletries included. Safe in the room to keep valuables and an excellent of oversized tv. Best of all what a great location, minutes from Empire State Building, Macy’s and everything shopping you could want.
Bad points- apart from the coffee shop that closes early in the afternoon a bar would have been nice. If you want these there are so many within walking distance it didn’t really matter.
P.s. avoid the beer hall across the road, service is terrible and it’s incredibly overpriced.
Thanks Team Draper

title: Excelente ubicación y buena opción, siempre teniendo en cuenta el precio
text:
Tengo bastante experiencia en hoteles en la ciudad de Nueva York , ya que vamos cada mes de noviembre por acción de gracias de vacaciones, y ésta ha sido nuestra novena visita.
El Draper es uno de los mejores hoteles en el que nos hemos hospedado, pero como todo en la vida, tiene sus inconvenientes, pocos, pero los tiene.
Cómo aspectos positivos, la ubicación, que es inmejorable, la quinta avenida es lo más céntrico y lo más conveniente en esta ciudad, y el Draper tiene esa ventaja.
Las personas que trabajan en recepción son muy, muy, pero que muy amables, siempre te atienden con una sonrisa, y hacen literalmente todo lo que está a su alcance para que la estancia sea lo mejor posible. Mención especial a Mohamed por su amabilidad, pero mis felicitaciones al resto de recepcionistas, que nos hicieron el enorme favor de quedarse con paquete que debía recoger UPS para una devolución de Amazon, que dicho sea de paso (y para evitar que paséis por los mismos problemas que hemos tenido nosotros), había que estar esperando al transportista hasta que  tuviera a bien pasar a recoger el paquete, y estando de vacaciones esto es una faena, cosa que como digo, tuvieron la enorme amabilidad en la recepción de custodiar y entregar el dichoso paquete, así que ni se os ocurra comprar nada en Amazon USA, y menos de valor, porque funciona fatal y sólo te complica la vida con las devoluciones.
En cuanto a la limpieza de las habitaciones, tienes que pedir que te la limpien antes de las once de la mañana. Aquí es donde el hotel recibe numerosas críticas, pero para nosotros es una ventaja, ya que por nuestras costumbres preferimos que nos dejen a nuestro aire y no tener que estar con prisas, dejando la habitación para que la limpien cada día, entre otras cosas porque no es necesario limpiar todos los días, así que cuando te viene bien, lo pides y punto, menos molestias para todos, y la verdad es que limpian y dejan todo bastante bien.
El hotel no ofrece desayuno incluido en el precio, cosa que en principio puede parecer otra desventaja, y cosa que volvemos a preferir, para evitar prisas y molestias por el hecho de que hay horarios y mesas repletas de gente, y no tienes dónde sentarte, mucho más cómodo en la habitación.
Ahora bien, he de decir que por 158€ la noche  que conseguí en el mes de febrero, el hotel es inmejorable, pero por los 400€ que lo he llegado a ver, o los doscientos y pico, o trescientos, la verdad es que buscaría otras opciones, porque no creo que lo valga, la habitación es pequeña, si bien en recepción nos cambiaron la habitación el primer día a una con algo de pasillo donde poder abrir las maletas, ya que en la primera que nos dieron, literalmente no podíamos pasar al baño con las maletas abiertas, y a pesar de que las habitaciones en Manhattan son pequeñas, esto ya es para pensarse pagar más de 180€ la noche, y mucho menos estando doce noches en Nueva York, aunque como digo, en recepción nos hicieron ese favor que ni siquiera pedimos, salió de ellos, así que hay que decirlo.
La verdad es que hemos estado muy a gusto, pero hay un enorme inconveniente, y que no atribuimos al hotel, ya que cada vez que nos quejamos, hicieron todo lo que estuvo en su mano para poner remedio al problema, y no es otro que el incivismo y la mala educación de la gente. En Nueva York se ha legalizado el consumo de marihuana, cosa que no me corresponde juzgar, si está bien o está mal, la cuestión es que es legal, y la ciudad huele a marihuana literalmente, pero es que los huéspedes del hotel, aún habiendo depositado 150 dólares en concepto de prohibición expresa de fumar en las habitaciones, se lo saltan a la torera y les importa un comino si eso molesta o no al resto de huéspedes, aún a riesgo de perder 150 dólares, es mucho más importante drogarse y molestar al resto, y si no queremos drogarnos, nos aguantamos y nos drogarnos todos, y el humo se filtra por el conducto de ventilación del hotel, que a pesar de que se puede cerrar, la intensidad del humo es tal que hasta que al indocumentado de turno no se le termina el porro, tienes que estar oliendo a marihuana en tu habitación, y esto no puede ser, y es razón suficiente para mí para no volver más si no le ponen remedio.
Otro detalle que no me gustó nada de nada es el hecho de que cobran un dólar por maleta cuando dejas la habitación el último día, y que evidentemente no vas a estar cargando por la ciudad, y menos si tu avión (como fue nuestro caso) sale a última hora de la tarde. Me pareció un detalle feo que hizo que cambiara mi opinión final del hotel, y que en realidad no sé si les compensa que por un detalle como éste, la valoración que se haga por parte de un cliente, sea inferior a la que tenía pensado poner antes de que le digan que tiene que pagar nada menos que cinco dólares por cinco maletas, y tengo que decirlo, lo siento, es que me parece un detalle muy, pero que muy feo.
¿Volveremos al Draper? Por menos de 180 dólares la noche, y teniendo en cuenta que el hotel carece de gimnasio, cosa que siempre agradezco, quizás, pero lo del olor a marihuana me echa para atrás.
No obstante, y si el hotel me lo acepta como consejo, yo no seguiría subiendo los precios como lo están haciendo (y esto va por todos los hoteles del distrito de Manhattan), porque si en trece días que he estado allí he visto sólo a dos parejas de españoles, cuando otros años me cruzaba con más de cincuenta, creo que os estáis haciendo un flaco favor y váis a acabar con el turismo en Nueva York, ya que encima me rompieron la maleta en el JFK para inspeccionar en interior, teniendo la opción de abrirla con la llave TSA que deben tener, pero que se ve que les costaba mucho esfuerzo utilizar y era mucho más fácil cortar la cremallera con unas tenazas, y eso también tengo que decirlo, ya que el trato que he recibido por parte del NYPD en la frontera del JFK (y no fui el único, ya que hubo otras cinco maletas en la misma situación), fue sencillamente deplorable y fuera de lugar, por supuesto, he hecho una reclamación, pero que todo el mundo sepa cómo te tratan en el JFK, sin educación y sin respeto, cosa que espero hagan por igual a los turistas estadounidenses que vengan a España.

title: Amazing stay
text: Everyone was very helpful. We had a wonderful stay. Bed was so comfy. Very helpful with directions each day. Only thing wasn’t enough counter space in bathroom. The shower was awesome. The Draper was center of all the things we wanted to do..

title: Nickel !
text:
Hôtel propre et très bien situé. 
Un petit point négatif pour le petit déjeuné inexistant. 
Nous avons passé un très bon séjour dans cet hôtel. Le métro est très facile d’accès ainsi que les lieux les plus emblématiques a visiter.
Nous avions une chambre côté court donc pas trop de bruit la nuit. 
La salle de bain était propre, lit très confortable, personnel souriant et à l’écoute.

title: Great stay!
text: I would first like to say that Max at the front desk was the more than accommodating! The room was a good size and the bed was super comfortable! Being able to use the luggage room for only a dollar per bag while we shopped around New York was absolutely the best. Great spot to walk to Central Park and Rockefeller. Plenty of great bars surrounding the hotel. Definitely will be back! Thank you!

title: Excellent location, excellent attention
text: Excelente ubicación, habitaciones pequenas pero agradables. El personal es especialmente atento, todos los recepcionistas son de gran ayuda y muy agradables. (Especialmente atentos resultaron Mohammed, que esta en fin de semana por la tarde y la noche, y una chico y una chica que estaban habitualmente por la mañana. Como íbamos a estar dos semanas, Mohammed y el equipo del Front Desk nos ayudaron a conseguir una habitación un poco mas grande con mejores vistas y nos ayudaron a tramitar una devolución de Amazon que nos dio problemas, por lo que el trato del personal es inmejorable). Por otra parte, la cama es muy cómoda y la zona en la que esta ubicado el hotel es fantástica, pues tiene muchos comercios y zonas de interés alrededor y muy buena conexión de MTA. Por ultimo, el business center es muy agradable y se puede estar libremente. Los únicos aspectos a mejorar serian el cobro de un dólar por cada maleta que te guardan en recepción unas horas el dia de salida y el olor que entra en la habitación por los conductos del aire cuando algún huésped cercano fuma (y es un hotel de no fumadores) y el personal no puede hacer nada.

title: Perfect for 2 night stay
text: Our stay at the Draper  was just what we were looking for: a safe, comfy, and centrally located hotel for our short trip. Everyone at the front desk was very accommodating and friendly. The rooms are very small but that was expected. The beds were comfy and room was quiet. Family of four so it was tight but we were only there to sleep and get ready in the morning. I liked the hooks in the  room to hang our coats, purses, backpacks. There was a drawer under each bed for storage that we did not use. Nice size fridge in the room, no microwave (there was 1 microwave downstairs for all to use).  We utilized the cafe and the business center. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would recommend others to give it a go! I never felt unsafe and everything was a short walk away. Very close to Bryant Park.  My suggestions would be to add a shelf to the shower and bathroom for guests’ toiletry items and also maybe a microwave in each room. Thanks for a nice stay!

title: Excellent Stay!
text:
Very central location and helpful staff. Rooms are small, but that’s too be expected. It was fine with two people. 

Comfy beds and very clean hotel! I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay around Midtown Manhattan.

title: This place is a beautiful option
text:
My experience in this hotel was fantastic. The rooms are small but sufficient as well as nice. The bed was absolutely one of the most comfortable I've stayed in, and I stay in hotels about 60-70 nights/year. 

The front desk staff were really nice.Especially Khan. He worked a double the second night I was there and he helped me out a lot. Thanks a million! I would def recommend this establishment due to the comfort, the location and the service.

title: Wonderful stay at the Draper
text: We were there for 2 nights. Facility was clean and quiet. The staff was veryprofessional and courteous. Excellent location. Could not ask for more in a reasonably priced accommodation in the Big Apple.

title: Friendly Staff, cute bathroom
text: Typical sized NYC room but comfy bed and cute bathroom. Really great front staff. Would stay again. They even let us check out half hour late with no charge (we asked in advance). Traveled in Dec 22 with a friend.

title: 100% recommend.
text:
Back from a lovely trip to NY. Our travel agent recommended The Draper and they didn't disappoint. Lovely reception welcome. The room is small but met our needs for comfort, cleanliness, and 2 lovely  double beds. The lady in the cafe accomodated me with a free cup of hot water every morning so I could make my own tea! Nothing was too much trouble from the staff. Location was only 10 min walk to Times square, empire state building. And where able to find our way round. A very enjoyable holiday n superb hotel 
I highly recommend the Draper n will be saving my penny's again for another visit to NY/Draper.
Thanks guys

title: Great experience at The Draper!
text: Excellent experience — comfortable, lovely hotel; great location; helpful staff. We especially appreciated their helpfulness in managing our somewhat complicated bookings (2 rooms, slightly different dates, combo of points and direct payments).

title: A wonderful Christmas in NY experience!
text: Perfect location, great room, amazing view, lovely front desk staff. Walkable to Empire State, Bryant Park, Times Square, Rockefeller, etc. View from 23rd floor was incredible. King bed was comfy, and the room was well-appointed. Would absolutely stay again!

title: Best Visit to NYC
text: Since first day on November 25 until December 1 we had great service, very professional staff. Room excellent, very clean and housekeeping very professional too. We want to thanks Max at front desk that always had a smile for us and all the guests. He had excellent customer service. Sanchez family.  We Love New York.

title: Great value and location
text: Recently stayed a night to see the holiday sites of the city.  Our room was immaculate and quiet and we had a great view of the Empire State Building.  There was also a coffee maker and a refrigerator and downstairs, a small place for coffee and pastries.   I loved being close to Bryant Park and 5th Avenue.  We got a great deal for our room and I appreciated that there were no add on fees that I've been seeing with other hotels.  Draper may become our go to for NYC!

title: Espectacular!
text: Hotel muito bem localizado, moderno, bonito e perfeito para conhecer NYC! Funcionários simpáticos e muito prestáveis! Gostava que tivesse pequeno almoço incluído, mas também tem muitas opções perto para comer! Perfeito!

title: Lovely hotel
text:
Stay at the draper ascend for 3 nights on the 23rd of November. On arrival found staff very welcoming.  Check in was fast. The  gentleman checking us in was very pleasant and helpful.
The room a little on the small side was very clean and comfortable. 
Location is superb, its just off 5th Ave and 3 minute walk to macys. 
We would definitely stay at this hotel when we return again in the future.

title: We’ll stay here again!
text: Great location and incredible service and hospitality.  Highly recommended!  Rooms are small but very comfortable.  Staff were very friendly and helpful.  We will stay here again when we come back to New York.

title: Great location
text: Great location. Close to subways and central enoufh. he rooms are tiny and no storage for clothes and suitcases. A bit tough for a trip longer than a few days. Nice staff. Recommend for a short stay.

title: Perfect stay in a great location!
text:
Myself and my family visited the Draper at the beginning of the month and we had an amazing stay! Would absolutely book again without hesitation if we ever return. Max and all of the other staff made us feel so welcome and were great with my girls and I felt like nothing was too much trouble.

Both of the rooms we had were clean and nicely decorated, a perfect space to rest our heads after a long day of exploring the city. The location was absolutely perfect only about a 10 minute walk from grand central, summit one, empire state building, times square, etc.

The price we paid was amazing for such a great location and a lovely hotel, thanks very much :)

title: Great NYC Stay thanks to the Draper!!!
text: Great hotel! Loved the view. Clean! Front desk was amazing and helpful! Especially our new friend Pathik!!! He is a rockstar!!! He was so helpful to us and taught us how to use the subway map! We will stay here again!!!

title: A favorite in midtown.
text: Great location in between 5th and 6th avenue. Front desk reception was excellent. Very responsive to request to change lightbulb. Lots of choices for restaurants and accessible to Theater district. Request not to be on the street side, much quieter.

title: Perfect for a brief visit to the city!
text: Spent a night here for a work trip. Super clean, great location, nicely decorated, incredibly nice reception staff, very comfortable bed. A bit small (but it’s NYC, so expected!) but otherwise perfect stay. Odd closet situation for a longer stay, didn’t impact me because it was only one night

title: Great hotel in Central location
text: I was very happy with my stay at The Draper. The hotel was very clean and the room was a nice size for NYC. They made great use of the space.  Staff was friendly. The location was convenient as well. I wish they had onsite food/drinks in the evening, but plenty of options nearby. Will definitely stay here again.

title: Good location / Good room
text: The location on 37th just off 5th was great.  Our room had big windows for lots of light on 20th floor facing 37th. We liked the location as it was easy to walk up or downtown and there were plenty of nearby spots to eat and drink as well.  The staff were helpful and we felt that the price made this a reasonable value.

title: Amazing surprise
text: An amazing surprise! The Draper looks like a little gem in the city. Perfectly located just between 34th st East and Bryant Park, nestled in a very quiet spot. The building is basically new, recently renovated, room’s size just fine with very trendy interiors, the staff is really helpful and kind. A special mention to Dupika that welcomed me with a really professional and active attitude!

title: Great location, awesome staff
text: This was a great location and great price! Max at the front desk was particularly helpful on a very busy long holiday weekend. He was patient with a large crowd and very attentive to what we needed. I would say the hotel is ‘minimalist’ in design and the only slight criticism was lack of towel bars, hooks, etc. in the bathrooms.

title: Great Boutique Hotel in the heart of it all
text: As a solo traveler, safety is a priority. While at the Draper,  not only did I feel safe, but also cared for. Max, the concierge, was very helpful with recommending small places to eat and caring for the needs of the guests.

title: Very Disappointed
text: Tried to check in at 3:15, checking time is 3. A full lobby of travelers many with lots of luggage faced the same issue. Room is clean which  is a plus. Woke up this morning to get a cup of coffee. Cafe downstairs which advertises being open by 7:30 wasn’t open at 8. This is my first trip to NYC in 2  and a half years, hotel was very disappointing  I will come back to NY, but not to this horel

title: Could be very good with a few tweaks
text: Me, my husband and 12 year old daughter stayed here for a week in November. I booked this hotel for its central location, good reviews and reasonable (by New York standards) price. The hotel is located mid town on West 37th Street between 5th and 6th Avenues so it’s good for a first visit to NYC as a lot of attractions are within walking distance and ideal if you want to go shopping on 5th Avenue. It’s a very busy area and if you are looking for a hotel in a relaxing area maybe look elsewhere. There are lots of places to eat and drink nearby but obviously nowhere cheap. You can stroll up to Times Square, Central Park (beautiful in the autumn), Met museum, Empire State etc. Grand Central and Penn stations close by.  34th Street Herald Square subway station is 5 minutes away and very useful as lines B D F M N Q R and W go through here. An unlimited 7 day metro card was just $34, great value, felt very safe too although we didn’t ride late at night. We had a room on the 12th floor with two double beds. It was clean and modern, the bed was comfy (bit soft for my liking but that’s just my personal preference), the shower was very good and  I liked the fact that the window in the room was able to be opened (so many hotels now have sealed windows). Our room overlooked the street however the street noise wasn’t as bad as I thought it might be. However, the room was very small and lacked virtually any storage. No drawers no wardrobe. Just a strange sort of rail about 18” long positioned directly above the coffee machine which is a really strange and impractical design choice. There was no net curtain on the window, so you had a choice of either pulling down the blackout roller blind or the people in the offices opposite being able to see straight in. On the plus side, there is a proper fridge. Note that the safe is in a drawer under the bed, we didn’t find it until we enquired at reception as to its whereabouts. This hotel has over 20 floors. There are just two lifts and no service lift and they are quite temperamental. They also bong loudly and the noise from them is audible in the rooms and can be quite annoying, especially at 5am. Also note that housekeeping is on request, which I actually quite like because it saves me having to nag the daughter to tidy her stuff up; for some reason housekeeping chose to clean the room and change the beds the day before we left, not sure why. I would like to say a big thank you to the staff on the front desk who were always very professional, friendly and helpful.  I would say that with a few design tweaks this could be a very good hotel. Final note, a yellow taxi from JFK will cost about $70 with a tip. The hotel can arrange a car to the airport for $85 plus tax plus tip ($85 is not the total price, despite what they tell you on reception!)

title: Loved The Draper
text: We found The Draper to be one of the best places we have ever stayed. We ordered towels twice and they were sent up both times within 3 - 5 minutes.  Highly recommend this hotel. We will be back to The Draper.

title: Girls trip
text: The Draper Ascend Collection was very attentive to my needs.  I received a welcome text and daily texts to see if I needed anything.  They have a business center and plenty of lounge seating in the rear to relax. A place to enjoy a cup of coffee in the morning or a glass of wine in the evening.  Location is great there is a German restaurant across the street and a steak house down the street which we dined at that were good.  Within walking distance to the Subway.

title: Mr Nicholas  Conte
text: The Ascend collection Hotel was very pleasant staying there we where welcomed at check in aswell when we left service impeccable very clean had all the facilities needed with a beautiful room with city view we could see the Empire state building, great position next to 5th Avenue easy walking to most iconic places metro near by if you want to take train to move around quicker. Over all we had a great experience and certainly we would go back to this place if I would suggest something the rooms should have a light switch at bed side but that is a minor issue.

title: Clean and Comfortable
text: We were so happy with our stay. It was super clean and the beds were comfortable. We had a room with two double beds and it was a nice size for two people. The location was great and we enjoyed being able to walk to the Broadway theater district. The front desk staff were all pleasant and helpful. I would absolutely stay here again!

title: Lacking in many respects
text: I don't understand the positive reviews of this hotel.  It is a totally fine place to lay your head down for a night, but it really feels like a 2 star hotel that is trying to be nicer than it is.  There are only 2 elevators for a 24 story building and 1 was broken.  The second also had issues, so it took 15 minutes to initially get up to the room and I got trapped on the 15th floor for awhile trying to get down.  I assume that is a temporary problem, but there are other permanent issues: no privacy shade (just the blackout curtain or nothing), no iron in room, no closet (just a hangar over the coffee), most of the tv stations did not work, the elevator dinged loudly all night (not just when it came to the floor, but it reverberated throughout the hallway and room each time it stopped on any floor), no bottled water in room, etc.  Also, even by NY standards, this is a very small room.  It looks "cool", but it is not functional or comfortable to actually stay in.

title: Perfectly located hidden gem.
text: The Draper is a gem. We stayed four nights in a basic room. Not a lot of extra space, but it was clean and comfortable. Astonishingly quiet. The front desk staff was among the most gracious we have encountered. Especially Pathik. We are hoping to return soon.

title: Would stay again and recommend
text: Hotel was clean and well kept. Rooms were small but fine for a night and only using it to sleep. Bed and pillows were comfortable. Staff was friendly and helpful. They made the most out of the space they had to work with. Little cafe and large business area on first floor.

title: Excellent choice, lovely stay
text: Well priced, spacious room by NYC standards, spotless, well laid out and very comfortable beds.  The laminate wood floor is a great choice. Looks modern, and is easy to clean compared to carpet.  Bathroom also decent size, all tiled looks good and is also easy to keep looking clean.  Loved the full length mirror. No drawers which is not a big deal for a short stay.  Front desk staff are lovely.  Paid $50 for early check-in which was great.  Super location.  Would stay again

title: Four Night Stay at The Draper
text:
I would say that this was a decent hotel. The room was clean, and comfortable. The rooms are very small but they’ve done a decent job of getting creative with storage for clothing. You will not have room for laying out your suitcase in a standard sized king room. 

It’s rare to find an actual mini fridge in NYC hotels, in my experiences and this was a big perk at the Draper. Staff was friendly and expeditious with any requests. You do have to ask for house keeping to clean your room each day but that might be due to staffing. 

They don’t have a restaurant or bar and I didn’t see their coffee shop open at all but I might have missed it. Overall, it’s well located and I wouldn’t mind staying again. I do wish the shower had shelves though and an additional hook on the bathroom door or somewhere in the bathroom would have been nice. 
The rooms are really suited for one person, or two people max, but it could definitely start to feel cramped.

title: Perfect place to stay
text: Very clean and pretty place right in the heart of New York. We really liked the room (the bathroom was new and just lovely , we were so happy after all we had heard about that before) and the staff was amazing. Especially Deepika tried everything to make our stay as perfect as possible.

title: Great Stay
text: This was a great hotel with a very convenient location. Deepika greeted me with a smile when I arrived and made me feel so welcomed the entire stay. She helped answer my questions and stored my bags while I explored the city after check out. Really enjoyed the art in the room too! Would stay again.

title: Great Room/ Great Staff
text: The hotel and staff were great! The bed was very comfortable and the rooms were very clean. For a New York room it felt spacious. One of the elevators was not working so the wait to go up or down was longer Also bring an extension cord because on one side of the bed there are no plug-ins. Great location!

title: Convenient place to stay
text:
Staying here and finding the place was easy.  Check-in and check-out were also made easy with nice staff.  It is in a convenient location.

I did expect more for a $400 night but, I guess, that’s just New York. The space was small but had everything we needed.

The smell of cigarettes was pumping into our room from the vents when we returned later in the night.

title: NYC
text: The room was small, but clean and nicely appointed. The bed was comfortable. The staff at the front desk were very helpful and quick to respond when we had an issue. The hotel was central to everything we wanted to see -Time Square, Rockefeller Center, Empire State Building, Central Park, and close to Penn Station.

title: First visit to NYC
text: The Draper Hotel was a Great place to stay, right in Manhattan on 37th street. Close ( walking distance) to All the popular site ie; Empire State Building, Times Square and Central Park. Clean rooms and friendly and attentive staff that were great in referring us to places tho eat and sites to see. Definitely will be back again.

title: Excelente hotel en NY.
text: Excelente alternativa para alojarse en New York. Estrategicamente ubicado, cerca de todo en la 37 y la 5ta Avenida. Hecho a nuevo, muy limpio y lindo. Las habitaciones son muy lindas y confortables aunque como todo hotel en NY, son chicas y no tiene desayuno. 100% recomendable!!!

title: Perfect hotel for a perfect weekend stay in NYC
text:
Our family had a very nice weekend stay at The Draper.  The staff was very attentive and handled any questions we had.  Our room was very good with comfy beds.  Bathroom was spotless.  We had one slight issue with a non-functioning TV remote, but the staff took care of that immediately.   Getting text messages asking us how our stay was going and checking to see if we needed anything was also a nice feature, 

The hotel is in a great location for easy walks to many mid-Manhattan sites including Empire State Building, Times Square, Theater district, Bryant Park, Grand Central Terminal, etc.  There are plenty of restaurants near the hotel.  We tried Havana NY and The Westbury one block over on 38th and recommend them.  If you need supplies, there's a CVS around the corner at 38th and 5th and a coffee/pastry place at 36th and 5th.  The Draper also has a small "cafe" shop in the lobby if you need something immediate.

Thank-you again The Draper staff for providing us a perfect stay at your hotel which resulted in a perfect visit to NYC.

title: Terrible in Almost Every Way
text:
Undoubtedly among the worst hotel experiences I've ever had. And in the $400+/night category easily the worst. Other than the location which is very convenient and the water pressure in the shower which is great, everything else is shockingly bad. 

There are so many things wrong I barely know where to start but I'll go with 1 of the 2 elevators in the 23 fl building being out of service for 3 full days causing 15 minute waits to go up to the room or down to the lobby. Not to mention that there's no service elevator so the cleaning staff uses the guest elevators causing even longer waits.

No closets or drawers, only a bar located above a coffee machine so that pants or dresses hung on it drape into the machine. And hooks randomly strewn throughout the room so that when you hang your clothes on them it looks like a college dorm.

No soap in the shower -- some random combo of shampoo/body wash -- and if you buy a bar of soap or have other shower toiletries (razor, etc) there's no place to put them other than on the shower floor -- no basket or shelf.

Rooms and common areas that look dilapidated because the hotel isn't maintained.

Housekeeping only upon request but they don't tell you that when you check in (after traveling all day you're supposed to note the small sign at the front desk). And the request must be made the night before or by 11am day of. So on your first day by the time you realize no one has made up the room it's too late to get service -- we were so vocal about how annoyed we were by this that they did send someone.

No food or drink available other than what's stocked at a tiny pastry counter. And not a single glass in the whole place -- only plastic cups. 

A staff that is woefully untrained in hotel management, customer relations, hospitality and the basic functioning of a hotel, in particular the manager who is full of excuses for the abysmal guest experience. My 83 yr old mother was staying a floor below my husband and me and we were not able to reach her bc her cell phone wasn't working, the room phone wouldn't dial room to room and the front desk had no idea how to put a call through. 

It's unfortunate bc it wouldn't take much for The Draper to be an ok place -- some upkeep, a decently trained staff, a service elevator, some food. But as is, I would warn that you're in for a really miserable stay.

title: Great location, close to Bryant Park, Fifth Ave., easily accessible to anywhere you would like to go in NYC!
text: The welcoming and very helpful staff (Max, Deepika, and all of their colleagues) at the Draper provide a wonderful introduction to this friendly, accessible hotel.  The rooms are on the small side  but thoughtfully designed, the bathrooms are lovely and spacious, and the staff is very attentive to what you might need during your stay.  A lovely business center and an in-house coffee counter were a pleasant surprise.  It is a great "walking" location, or a quick cab or car ride will get you anywhere you might want to go in NYC.  And there is always a "welcome back!" by the front desk staff waiting for you when you return.

title: Ideal for a weekend stay
text:
Stayed here for a short break. Room was cosy and perfectly acceptable for a couple of nights and very reasonably priced for NYC. The location was brilliant too, just off 5th Avenue and a short walk to the closest subway. 
There is no wardrobe space as such (just a small amount of hanging space above the coffee machine) so you may struggle a little if you bring a lot of change of clothes. Everything was clean, tidy and modern. The bathroom was lovely and the shower was great. One small thing - helpful to have a plug in the sink to make it a little easier to wash and shave. All in all I'd recommend this place.

title: Best Front Desk Staff
text: There is a staff member Deepika who is absolutely the best. She is very helpful and super down the earth and strives to make your stay the best it possibly can. She assisted me with my luggage. Thank you so much!

title: Excellent location, excellent service
text:
Despite the size of the rooms (small), they have everything we need and space is very well optimized. All clean. Location is brilliant and surprisingly very silent for NYC (good soundproof). 
As always, the staff make all the difference: thank you Mohamed & Deepika for your warm and smiling service. Coffee ladies: thank you for the banana bread freebies: delicious :)
Strongly recommend. Would stay again.

title: Great Midtown Hotel
text: Excellent hotel for Manhattan. Room was clean. Great view of Empire State, we were on the 20th floor. General NYC street noise but nothing super loud like clubs or pubs with music. Enjoyed the shampoo/shower gel and conditioner they offered which had ginseng in it. Good shower pressure and hot water. Not a ton of storage space. One empty drawer under bed, other drawer holds the safe. Lobby had nice area to eat and relax, free ice cold water. Helpful staff, held my luggage until check in and gave us extra pillows and towels. Even walking back late at night, I felt safe, there were several other hotels on 37th. Le Pain Quotidian and other cafes are just steps away. Enjoyed visiting the Morgan Library and Museum which is also very close by. Hotel is an easy walk from Penn Station, about 10-15 minutes.

title: Nice place with questionable room design decisions.
text:
We just returned from a 3 night stay at The Draper and while we enjoyed many aspects there were a few too many "Why did they do that?" utterances to make us easily recommend it.  I'll give my pros and cons to help decide:

Pro:
Very good location - as others state close to the sights we wanted to see, but far enough from Times Square to make it not so crazy.
Staff at the front desk - the only staff we met - were professional if not overly friendly.  Check in was efficient but it would have helped to have 2 persons at the desk, which we never saw.
Beds were very comfortable and the shower worked well.
HVAC worked well and provided a soft constant fan noise which I like for sleeping, especially in cities.

Con:
Room was tiny.  For the price I guess I expected something bigger.  Think it was a King bed and it filled the room.
The bed had side sconces instead of table lamps - that's fine - but we could not find any way to switch them off individually next to the bed - someone had ta get out of bed and flip a switch besides the door, which shut off both.
The only other light, on the desk, would turn on and then start flickering 30 seconds later.
The 'closet' consisted of a bunch of metal tubes balanced on top of the refrigerator and not secured to the wall - anything you put on the hangers caused the whole contraption to lean.
There were no shelves in the shower and only the sink top in the main bathroom - very little space to put things out.
There was no sink stopper so if you shaved you pretty much just left the water running.
There was no bathroom fan so post-shower you needed to open the door to relieve the steam.

None of the 'cons' were deal-breakers but as I believe this is a new establishment it makes me wonder at all the poor design decisions - especially the annoying sconces.  Oh well.

title: NYC Mom/Daughter Trip
text: The Draper was the perfect hotel for my daughter and I.    We were in town for Bravocon 2022.  Max and all of the staff went above and beyond making sure we had everything we need.  Daily texts if we needed towels, housekeeping, etc,  This is the perfect location.  You are far enough away from all of the "action" but only a 15 minute walk if you wanted to get there.  Great hotel!!!

title: Great location, comfy beds, good stay!
text: Great location, comfy beds, and decent sized room for NYC. We got there early and were able to check in. They have luggage storage that we were prepared to use, but got in a room early. Beds were very comfortable, bathroom was clean, and water available in the lobby. Easy walking to Empire State Building, Times Square, Broadway shows, and walkable distance to Central Park. Didn’t use WiFi or food available, so can’t speak to that. Very happy with our stay and would stay again.

title: Nice, clean, comfortable and convenient
text:
The hotel is modern, clean and conveniently located. The bed was exceptionally comfortable. Staff was very friendly and helpful.
Caveats: The room is small. Efficiency is priority. City view is across from a restaurant that plays loud music until midnight. If you go to bed before then, bring earplugs. We asked for a taxi to airport. Staff arranged everything, but it was not a yellow taxi. Instead it was Chief Limo service at twice the price.
I would stay there again, but not on city view side.

title: Decent hotel worth mediocre staff
text: Decent hotel for New York City.  The rooms are small and cramped but that’s expected.  Decor is decent.  The staff however is poorly trained and while it didn’t happened to me I witnessed them being rude to customers due to the staffs own mistakes.  They also send out a lot of automated text messages to the point of harassment.  If you need a cheap play to stay in midtown it’s a good option so long as you can avoid the incompetent staff as much as possible.

title: Efficient use of space and very helpful staff
text: I enjoyed my stay. Perfect location and very friendly staff. Rooms are designed very well and efficiently. They have a late check out option for late night travelers. Free luggage storage available at check in and check out.

title: Great accommodations
text: Upon entering the lobby of the Draper Hotel you're greeted by the most helpful front desk staff.  The rooms are comfortable and NYC size (small as most are).  We had an excellent view the of Empire State Building.  There weren't any issues with noise as the windows are double pane.  I'd stay at the Draper Hotel again.  It's near many food options and very pedestrian friendly area.

title: Cute and quaint and friendly stafF
text: Located perfectly and accessible to Theater district, Time square and the best coffee shops ever! Love being right by the garment district where the best deals are!!. Boutique style with a lovely feel and very safe and cute details throughout.  Kind and courteous staff - all shifts. Can walk to practically anything if you enjoy walking. It was lovely with "New York Spacing of course." Would definitely stay again

title: A comfortable stay in a budget hotel
text:
First, what we liked:  location, clean, comfortable king bed, quiet room because we requested upper floor opposite 37th st side, good shower and water pressure, fast elevators, facility and rooms appear to have been updated/remodeled recently

What we were not too pleased with:  No daily housekeeping unless requested at from desk, no lamps beside the bed, no coffee in lobby, no hotel bar......even though website photos show many nice drinks, one very thin comforter on bed....had to request more, room extremely small.....only can place luggage on the floor.....no stands provided, 

Overall, an acceptable stay at a fair price for NYC.  Next time I would look around some more before booking again.  Would rate 3.5 stars if possible.

title: This a wonderful NYC hotel!
text: I traveled solo to NYC for work/play and This is my new favorite hotel. The location is great and the rooms are clean, comfortable, stylish and the staff is top notch. I actually had a cell phone disaster and not only did the gentlemen at the front desk try to help fix my phone, they generously assisted me with the logistics of navigating traveling with no phone. I have stayed in NYC many times and it’s hard to find a reasonably priced hotel. The Draper has an upscale boutique vibe without a reasonable nightly rate: Mostly, the staff is top notch and that very much adds to the quality of the experience. I can’t recommend this place enough!

title: My Go-To hotel in midtown
text: The Draper was wonderful. I am a repeat guest that travels for business. The Draper is my go-to and is always clean, quiet, and everyone is friendly. The beds are comfortable and the shower has nice water pressure. Always a pleasure to stay at the Draper.

title: Good location, nice hotel!
text:
This hotel is midtown, in a great location. Two blocks from the Empire State Building and close to shops and restaurants and Bryant Park. We felt safe walking at night in the area. 

Nice outdoor seating area in the back of the building. Housekeeping is at your request only. Towels are available anytime in the lobby. Lobby has free ice water and pastries in the morning for sale. Vending area in basement. 

The room was clean and modern. We had 2 double beds, refrigerator. Yes, rooms are smaller, but that was expected. Our room had a good view of the street outside. The windows opened.

If you want to stay in midtown, then I would definitely recommend this hotel for budget savvy travelers.

title: Weekend in NY
text: Very pleasant staff.  Rooms are clean but cozy & sized  commensurate with price.  If more than one guest, ask for more towels at checkin.  One thing that needs work is the lobby.  The lobby badly needs the stained couch replaced and a fresh coat of paint.

title: Great hotel and great location
text: I arrived 4 hours early prior to check in. Max was very friendly and helpful- he was able to get me my room! The check in experience was exceptionally smooth with Max. Hotel lobby is beautiful, location is great, and rooms are lovely (clean and spacious). Highly recommend!

title: Bel posto
text: Nell'impossibile impresa di soggiornare a Manhattan in un bel posto ad un prezzo accettabile, ho trovato The Draper. Posizione ottima, personale gentilissimo e preparato. Camera piccola, ma piuttosto confortevole e pulita. Bravi!

title: Good Location
text: I stayed in this hotel in May while visiting NYC. The location was great as it was walking distance to a lot of things in Manhattan. My room was small, typical for NYC, but overall clean. I liked the smell of the body wash, shampoo and conditioner the hotel had in their bathroom. I am now trying to figure out what the name of the said toiletry product is, as I write this review. The individuals at the front desk was friendly and welcoming. I definitely would stay here again!

title: Very clean and friendly but SMALL hotel
text: The people that work at this hotel are very helpful and kind.  The rooms themselves appear to be recently renovated and are very clean.  The rooms are very small, however. VERY.  There is no closet and very little space around the bed.  Obviously this is NYC so you can't expect much space.  But my room was good for 1 person, maybe two.  The bathroom is also tiny but very clean.  The shower does not have a shelf or bench or anything to put your things on, which I thought was a con.  I hate to put my toiletries on the floor of the shower.  All in, a very nice stay.

title: Not staying here again
text: I have just recently had to start coming to NYC frequently for work, so I have been trying different hotels in the area to determine which ones I want to use regularly going forward. With all the positive reviews of the Draper, I thought I would try it. I was aware of and accept the tiny room—this is NYC. But no luggage rack, no iron, fake creamer, and you have to get up to turn off the bedside lights—there are no bedside switches…really. Also USB port in the clock by bedside didn’t work though the sockets did. I had to unplug the lights around the mirrors to get the room dark—there was no switch visible to do that either.  Also the desk lamp kept flickering on and off—checked the bulb, the switch, etc.  nothing made it work as another option for a light I could control in bed, so to have light before bed, I still had to use the bedside lights and go to the door to turn them off. There is no easy place to plug anything at the desk in case you are using your computer unless you switch the plugs around—there is only one socket available at the desk. Resolution for any call to the front desk was that they had to send someone to my room.  I checked in before 11 pm—I was not going to have some stranger come to my room at midnight (when I discovered the problems) with me in my nightgown.  The few positives—I do like that the room has laminate floor instead of carpet. It is also very clean and neat. Bed a bit on the soft side. Check-in people nice. However, for the price I paid for 2 nights, I would rather stay at the Kixby or Kitano which are similarly well located. Those hotels are also much roomier and better appointed. I travel quite a bit for work—if other NYC hotels can provide the things I mentioned above, why can’t the Draper? While this hotel might deserve its great reviews for a leisure trip, for business, I am not a fan and will not stay here again.

title: Excellent visit
text: Reviews I read said that the rooms were small, but I found I had more than ample room for the week I was there. Everything was very clean and staff-at every level of service-was cheerful, helpful, and knowledgeable. The hotel was very conveniently located near the majority of places I planned to go, and the large ice water container in the lobby was always a welcome sight at the end of every day traveling around the city.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: Convenient and comfortable
text: The hotel is conveniently located and only a few blocks from midtown. My room was clean and looked recently updated. Comfortable bed. Nice bathroom.  There is not a closet, but there is a place to hang shorter items on a rod above mini-fridge. Close to Macy’s and Empire State Building.

title: Stay At The Draper
text: This was a wonderful hotel. The rooms are small, but they all are in NYC. They are meticulously kept and updated and the front desk is incredibly nice. Was there for business ans juggled a lot of moving pieces and the front desk and staff were super helpful. Would highly recommend staying there! They don’t have a restaurant, but there is a ton of options all around.

title: Moms and daughters trip 2022
text:
The hotel was wonderful… The location is perfect -walkable to pretty much anywhere you want to go and if not the subway is right there. The rooms were small (as  is to be expected in New York) but clean and the bed was pretty comfortable and I am definitely picky about mattresses and pillows!

The staff is always very accommodating . Special mention really needs to go out to Max who works the front desk - He went above and beyond to answer any questions we had, he tried to help us navigate our days even went so far as to Lend us his personal umbrella when we got caught having to go out in the rain. He is the epitome of service with a smile.

The café and lounge were not open when we were there but are we opening next week; there’s a lovely little patio at the back of the hotel where we were able to grab breakfast from one of the bakeries in the area and have it there every morning.

The hotel doesn’t have a lot of bells and whistles (no gym etc)  but location, service and price really can’t be beat.

title: Clique Tour 2022
text: Terrific hotel, spotlessly clean, very friendly and helpful staff. Max especially, going the extra mile to make our stay very special. Thanks Max! Great location and beautiful surroundings.  Would use this hotel again.

title: Girls birthday trip.
text: Lovely stay at The Draper. Great location, friendly staff especially Max. Beds are so comfy and room clean. We loved the lounge area. Can’t wait to come back. Round the corner and onto 5th Avenue. Fast food and pharmacy witching walking distance.

title: Draper near Times Square
text: Max was great! Hotel was a very convenient location. Front desk staff was very helpful and friendly. Have a good list of places to eat. Always felt good to get back to hotel after seeing sights and walking all day.

title: Very nice stay!
text: We loved staying at The Draper! The bed was very comfortable and the view was great! The elevators were easy to get and everything was so clean. The best part was the nice employees at the front desk. They were always eager to help. Thanks so much for a lovely stay!

title: Great stay
text: Very nice and helpful staff. Pretty quiet for a midtown hotel and lots around it. Bring your own snacks for sure. The rooms are very small, but that is NYC! Comfy beds and lovely shower too. I would stay here again and recommend to anyone who needs a great location.

title: Excellent hotel in the heart of Manhattan
text:
We strayed 4 nights in the Droper hotel and it was phenomenal. From the check-in with Max to the check out. Staff is fantastic. Specially Max, who is one of the most welcoming person we ever met. Hotel is super clean and rooms were excellent. They go way beyond to make us feel good and well taken care of. Central location near train stations and bus stops. Right by 5th avenue.

Even had a fridge on the room what was excellent.

Will for sure be back.

title: Surprising find in NYC
text: After much deliberation about where to stay for our 5-night trip to NYC, we settled on the Draper due to it's newness and location. We were quite happy with our decision! Every staff member we had contact with was very friendly, no matter what time of the day we went through the lobby. The king bed was extremely comfortable and the A/C worked great! Two things that were very important to us. The other reviews are correct, there is not a closet in the room. But, the hotel has done a great job providing alternate space options. There is a clothes bar above mini-fridge. We brought travel hangers so problem solved there! There are also hooks and knobs strategically placed to hang items.  By NYC standards, there was also plenty of room for the two of us. The location was perfect. Far enough from the hustle and bustle of Times Square but close enough to enjoy it. Bryant Park, MSG, Penn Station and the Empire State Bldg are just a short walk away. There's a great German Beer hall across the street and a wonderful steakhouse a few blds down. Highly recommend both! If you are looking for a plush hotel with all the amenities you could ask for, look elsewhere. But if you are looking for a comfortable and clean room with friendly staff close to just about everything, then this is your place! We will definitely stay at the Draper again on our next trip to the City.

title: A choice hotel not a CHOICE
text:
This is the second time that I have had interaction with a CHOICE hotel chain.. The first one was a disaster and this was almost as bad. If I had known that the Draper was a Choice hotel, I DEFINITELY WOULD Not have stayed here.
First and foremost, for the rate that we paid, it was pure robbery.
I haven't stayed in  a hotel with double beds since i was a child, traveling with my parents to motels. Our room had TWO double beds. My husband and I are tall, big people.  (NOT FAT), we had to sleep separately. Most hotels at least have two queen size beds or a King bed option, and  I have never been charged for a room by the siz of the bed.  We asked for a king bed and was told that we would have to pay an additional $400.
 The towels were PAPER thin. More like a YMCA towel, than a hotel of substance
There was NO closet. I have to hang my clothes over the refrigerator which served as a table fo the coffee pot.    GIVE ME A BREAK!

The staff was pleasant, which is all I have to say positive.

Think twice or three times before booking this place.

title: Nice boutique hotel in good location
text: My husband and I stayed here one night in September. We like supporting non-big chain hotels like this one. The room was clean, quiet and small, reminiscent of European-sized rooms which are completely adequate for those not intending to spend a lot of time in their room. The location is good, a 5-minute walk to the New York Public Library and Bryant Park and 20-minute walk to Penn Station, Madison Square Garden and Broadway theaters.  We would stay here again.

title: Amazing Hotel
text: This hotel has everything you need when traveling to the city. Close to all attractions, hotel is very clean, many amenities, and the staff is top notch!!! The Draper is my go-to hotel when I’m in town.

title: Great people, great place
text: Staff were incredibly helpful and the room was just what I needed. Very, very comfortable bed. It's a super convenient location, and walking distance to the world's greatest steakhouse, Wolfgang's, at 33rd and Park.

title: Great location, great price
text: We were in NYC for a concert at MSG and The Draper is in a fantastic location. Less than 1/2 mile to the venue and on a quieter street for midtown. We had a 2 double bed city view room (1702) with a view of the Chrysler Bldg. Pros: room was VERY clean and quiet, the staff was friendly and helpful, the location is close to Time Square and Penn Station, the price was reasonable. Cons: can't think of any, except the room was small, but it is Midtown. All in all, great value for the price and location. We would definitely stay here again.

title: Perfect spot for the price
text: The hotel is close to Times Square and within walking distance to area transportation. The room is small with beer little space for putting items anywhere. The staff was very friendly and responded quickly to requests.

title: Perfect Stay!
text: We booked a very last minute trip to New York and came across this hotel and decided to book it based off of all the amazing reviews! We had an amazing stay right from check in to check out. The front desk was incredibly helpful and check in was very quick and easy! Yes, the rooms are small but what more do you need when staying in a city? They have done everything to maximize the space with adding places to hand your stuff around. The bed was soo comfortable and very big. And the room was very very clean! We were extremely happy with everything. Not to mention, it is also a very trendy looking hotel. The hotel is located in a very good area to do all the touristy things and is not a far taxi ride away from the other stuff that you can’t walk to! It was perfect for us as it was one of our first times to the city, so we had to do the tourist things. The only downside was that there wasn’t an abundance of bars and restaurants that were super close, and as a young couple that’s what we were after at night, but there was still plenty of options near by! Overall, we would highly recommend this hotel and we’re very satisfied by everything that it had to offer!

title: Great value and location
text: Staff was very attentive and accomodating.  The room was very small (Hello, it's Midtown), but it was quiet and clean.  Great value for the price and would definitely look to stay there again on our next trip.

title: NO VOLVERIA
text:
Os digo puntos en contra y favor. En la web parece otra cosa diferente  a lo que te encuentras .

No hacen la habitación en 7 noches solo la han limpiado un día.  Vergonzoso. 

Antipáticos .

Nos cobraron por un menor como adulto y no nos hicieron devolución. Que estaba cobrado y punto.

Habitación con un ruido infernal de un respiradero  quitas el aire y aún así  apagado  se escucha un ruido súper fuerte  lo dijimos y contestación que se oye así en todas las habitaciones . Con lo cual no he dormido nada en toda la semana 

Las ventanas no ofrecen buenas vistas como anuncian aún si así fuese están los cristales tan sucios que poco se vería. 

Precio elevadisimo para lo que ofrecen 

A favor 

La situación. 

Camas cómodas 

Ni lo aconsejo ni repetiría.

title: The Draper
text: Super friendly front desk, helpful with taxis and a late checkout. The hotel is located in a central location with lots to see very close to the hotel. Cute coffee shop around the corner - Capital Coffee. Lots of shopping a few blocks away. Great stay!

title: Excellent Service
text:
We were two families with kids/teens. We arrived by car and were able to find a reasonable parking near the hotel through SPOTHERO APP. Check-In and Check-Out were very smooth. Great customer service. Staff at the reception were extremely helpful. 

The hotel is in the heart of Mid-Town. 2 min walking distance from Empire Estate Building. 10 min walk from Times Square. Lots of dining options nearby.

Rooms are clean with all the required stuff like towels, soap, shampoo, hand soap etc. There is a coffee maker in the hotel room. There is space in the lobby for a coffee bar.  

Highly Recommended. I will definitely return. Thank you for great hospitality. Both the families enjoyed the stay at this hotel.

title: 3 nights in the city
text:
