We arrived by car, which we were able to park right outside the hotel for a few minutes to unload our luggage, check in and get directions to the garage. The person checking us is was very efficient and provided great customer service and even helped us with our luggage into the storage room.  Parking is about a 5 min drive and just around the corner walking distance.  You leave your keys, they give you a ticket which you have validated by the hotel and that is it.  Our room was on the 17th floor looking at the Empire state building - amazing!  Yes the room is small but it has everything you need and the fridge came in handy. There are cut out spaces in the bed-frame footboard to store your luggage - genius!

The beds are comfy and there is a coffee maker in the hotel room.  There is space in the lobby for a coffee bar called the Pleat, but its not in service which is a shame as coffee or a snack would be great to purchase.  Hope that they make that happen.

I will definitely return.  Thank you for a great stay.

title: Super nice and clean
text:
Our stay was great! Room was nice and clean the bed was comfortable,Would definitely stay in this hotel again Súper friendly staff

The location is very convenient,Enjoyed our stay.

Ice  cold water in lobby 😀

title: Clean room
text: This was a great location. We needed a room close to NYC Langone while a family member had surgery. The room served our purpose for a one night stay.  A few very minor things did not work correctly - shower door did not close all the way and complimentary hand lotion did not work. Going up in the elevator you need your room key to get it to work.  One never knows about hotels in NYC but this one was great and I will stay here again.

title: Stay August 2022
text:
Add a couple towel racks/ hooks, and a floating shelf or three in the bathroom.  There is NO WHERE to set mouthwash, toothbrush, toothpaste, deodorant, etc.

Breakfast would be a nice addition too; scrambled (even boiled), and some bacon/sausage.

title: Great location, great beds, tiny room, breakfast should be included
text: For the price -- and the fact that this is a Choice hotel -- I expect breakfast to be included -- or at least coffee in the lobby. Instead, there is only a water dispenser. There is a space for food and drink in the lobby, but it is unstocked. Room was beautiful and clean and beds are great -- but it was tiny, really only suitable to 1, maybe 2 people -- not a family, despite 2 double beds. No closet and no shelves, no sitting area -- just a desk chair. Also, room cleaning is not automatic -- you have to request it, which I found odd. But I liked that you can specify the time of cleaning.  My rating reflects the value for money-- I would give 5 stars if breakfast was included or if the price was lower (without breakfast).

title: Relaxing stay, great place for podcast interviews
text:
The staff was great Max was incredibly kind and attentive.  I 1000% would recommend staying here again from the staff to the comfort of the rooms, very comfortable meeting area and good showers. 

SWEWTBABY JAY of the TALKIN SWEET 669-241-1422 podcast puts a stamp of approval on THE DRAPER👍

title: Nice place & great people
text: This hotel is super cute, clean, and in a very convenient location. All the hotel staff were extremely polite and accommodating, we had no issues at all. Room was small, but cozy, and has a nice, functional layout; good for nights where you want to stay in and not feel cramped. Would definitely stay here again :)

title: “Max was wonderful”
text: Best place to stay, The rooms were so clean, also the staff is very friendly , The view was so mesmerising and unrealistic, I loved the stay, also i would definitely visit again, Specially.! Max was really helpful and he went on extra mile to make our stay wonderful.

title: Great Hotel! Convenient for MSG shows!
text: We loved it here! The room was very small but clean, well-layed out and comfortable. Amazing city views and very quiet. The staff was also fantastic. Hotel was in a very busy part of the city, but once inside seemed very private. A+ would stay again!

title: Best place to stay.
text:
Hi,

I just wanted to take a moment to write a review about the hotel. I stayed here earlier this month it was my birthday.
The staff is very polite,humble and the treatment we got from them was completely overwhelming. Max was at front desk checked us in hooked us up with the nicest room with the good view. If I get a chance I would prefer the same hotel when am in the city again. It was worth every penny spent. 

Thanks and regards,
Mohammed hameed uddin.

title: Clean and great location
text: The Draper was a great affordable hotel in an awesome location in Midtown. Close to shopping and all the sights, but on a quieter side street. Will definitely recommend to anyone traveling to NYC! The room was small, but very clean. What more could you ask for!

title: Loud elevator waking up at night
text:
The elevator makes very loud dinging sound. Waking us up in the middle of the night.
As a bonus If you give them your phone number or email they will spam you with hundreds of emails and messages requesting review. Extremely annoying and opting out doesn’t work.

title: Reasonable price for Manhattan
text: Nice place for a long weekend stay.  Good:  clean, comfortable bed; clean, up-to-date bathroom; quiet at night; decent decor; great location; very nice and helpful staff.  Bad: room was very small; no closet, just a hanger rod in room;   Worst: no ability to control temperature in room - it was either hot or very cold.

title: Ottima scelta
text: Abbiamo soggiornato in due camere doppie. Quella con vista sui grattacieli era molto spaziosa e comoda, quella senza vista piccola come la media delle stanze a NY. Menzione particolare per l'ottima pulizia.. veramente eccezionale. Personale gentile e disponibile. La zona è a pochi minuti da Time Square ma in una via tranquilla e silenziosa. Proprio nel mezzo di due fermate della metro a circa 10 min a piedi. Ottimo rapporto qualità  prezzo.

title: Excellent location, Modern Hotel, Great front desk service
text: The location is central to all things Manhattan with most every attraction within a mile or two walking distance. The hotel is up to date and modern, with nice amenities such as a courtyard with plenty of seating. Hopefully the onsite café will reopen soon. Bakeries on every corner so no chance of starving! We stayed in both the regular King room and a King Balcony room. Both were just the right size and we never felt couped up. Staff is highly responsive and courteous. There are many Pro reasons to stay and the only Con reason was there is no microwave in the room. There is a shared microwave on the concourse for use however. I felt the area was safe with lots of nearby shopping. NYC isn't the cleanest place so don't be shocked. I was shocked by how friendly everyone was however! NYC has a rep for bad attitudes but we never encountered any negativity. We had a beautiful view of the Empire State Building from our courtyard balcony King room.

title: Wonderful room. Very comfy bed
text:
Really cool hotel. Great service!! I will absolutely be back. Cute view of the city and very comfortable bed. I appreciated how they checked in with me regularly. Also, since this was a business trip, wifi was super important and the wifi was definitely good which helped alleviate some anxiety for me around meetings. 
Thanks for a lovely stay!

title: Perfect solo getaway!
text: I booked the Draper for my birthday solo getaway! I did my research and read every review, and the hotel DID NOT DISAPPOINT!!  It was luxury at an affordable price! It's close to all Midtown attractions, but far away to give you a relaxing experience! Near tons of fantastic restaurants and i WILL be back!

title: Trip with my daughter
text: This is such a great hotel.  Rooms are clean. Friendly staff.  We had a lovely view of the ESB.  This hotel is in walking distance to subway and a lot of major sightseeing hot spots.  Would definitely stay here again.

title: Convenient and Comfortable
text: We felt warmly welcomed and well cared for as we spent a couple nights at the Draper.  The rooms were clean and comfortable and amazingly quiet for New York City.  We needed a place close to where family was staying for business and this fit the bill perfectly.

title: Nice and clean with good customer service
text: We enjoyed this boutique hotel on 37th in nyc.  We were in ny for a show, restaurants and shopping with 4 ladies. The rooms aren’t huge but plenty big and very clean.  The employees at the desk were very friendly and nice  I would stay here again

title: Draper Hotel
text: My room was modern and clean and I’ve experienced minimal noise. Hotel staff were very professional and prompt with answering any of my questions and addressing my requests. I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Great stay
text:
Brand new hotel  and very clean. The location is very convenient right in the heartof the city. amazing stuff.  Thank you Mohammed, you were a great help.
I would definitely visit this hotel again.  Highly recommend.

title: Excellent hotel in an ideal location!
text: This hotel property has only been open about a year and so it feels fresh and very clean at a great price. The service and staff were very helpful. This hotel is in an ideal location if you want to go down 5th Ave or head to Broadway/Times Square. (about half a mile to walk to most locations). As with many properties in NYC, the rooms are small, but they are well designed so it didn’t inhibit our enjoyment. We would definitely stay here again.

title: Wonderful experience; will be back!
text:
Really enjoyed my 5-day stay at The Draper! The staff is incredible. Mohammed was the person at the desk most of the time I was here, and he's a five-star human being. He helped us find amazing places to eat, and has been a friendly face greeting us at each coming and going.

The room & hotel are very nicely designed; everything is stylish and clean. I had a two-double bed room with a city view, and it was perfect. The beds & pillows are extremely comfortable, and the room was very quiet; I never heard noise from the street or from other rooms. Slept great. While the HVAC fan in the room was pretty noisy, because it was constant, it was just brown noise and didn't bother me.

The hotel uses the space in the rooms super cleverly, such that it genuinely feels cozy and not like you are lacking for space. Still, I got the two double beds so I could put my suitcase on one of them, and that worked really well; I recommend it. 

The hotel keeps itself affordable by *not* doing housekeeping during your actual stay unless you ask for it, and I discovered I'm a big fan of this. Elsewhere, I find it annoying and stressful that they send housekeeping around every single morning.  I like this hotel's approach better.

All around, it's been a great stay! I would definitely stay here again.

title: SUPER RECOMENDADO!
text: Me encantó la ubicación, a una cuadra de la quinta avenida. La calle es muy callada y no sales al tumulto como en Times Square, tienes muchas tiendas cercas como Target, Macys, H&M, el metro de Herald Sq, Bryant park a cuadras. El servicio en recepción super bueno. La cama una DELICIA. Lo unico malo que podria decir es que las habitaciones son bastante pequeñas aunque normal en NYC. Volvería sin dudarlo.

title: Great short stay!
text: Room had a cute design and the furniture was in good condition and not scuffed/worn like many other hotels in the same category in Manhattan. Bed was VERY comfortable. The room was tiny, but that is expected for a Manhattan hotel at this price. Very clean. Only issue we had was that the shower wasn’t designed well and got water all over the floor when it was used. I go to NYC frequently and I would definitely stay again.

title: Overall a good stay! Just watch out for the amenities!
text:
Overall this property was a nice stay near many things in Manhattan. I booked a king bed with city view. Was on the 18th floor and had a pretty nice view. Room was nice and average size for NYC. My biggest complaint is the amenities listed on the website is not at all what is offered at the property. 

Pros- good location (close to subways, Bryant Park, and Time square), clean room, nice shower, good view 

Cons- Amenities are not offered that are listed on website. States there is a bar/lounge- not true. They have the setup for one but when checking in the lady told us that it wasn’t ready yet. Why list it, if it’s not available. Also, listed is a clothing steamer- not available either. When I fly and pack to save the most money on bag fees then often my clothes get wrinkled. I liked that they said they offered a clothes steamer but when I asked they said oh we can bring you an iron. To me an iron and a steamer and two totally different items. 

Another warning is that there is only housekeeping upon request. I asked for towels and washcloths to replace my used ones and they brought two towels and 6 hand towels and not a single washcloth. 

Overall a nice hotel in a good location. Would consider staying there again especially if they open the bar that they say they have.

title: Exceptional Experience!
text:
Initially, I was supposed to stay in this hotel for three days, but my stay was so pleasant and convenient that I kept extending it. The staff was so friendly and accommodating, they made me feel at home.  

The room was comfortable, especially the bed. Location was perfect. It was central enough to be a walking distance away from most tourist spots, but still hidden enough to be able to relax after a long day. 

I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the city for the first time, family and solo travelers alike.

title: Perfect for solo traveler or couples
text: Quick and easy check in.  Small room, but perfect for 1-2 people.  Comfy bed (always a plus!). Very friendly staff.  Complimentary luggage storage was appreciated, both on arrival and departure days.  Water pressure in the shower could have been better, but wasn’t a big deal.  Quick walk to subway stations (close to Grand Central, Bryant Park, and 34th St stations).  Would definitely stay here again!

title: CLEAN AND FRIENDLY
text: We spent four days in NYC to sight see and attend a couple plays. I would highly recommend The Draper Hotel. The room, although small, was perfect for an individual or couple. The bed was comfortable; the room was clean; and all expected amenities were either in the room or available by request. EVERYONE at the front desk was kind, courteous, and helpful. The location was in walking distance to most places. We had a wonderful experience.

title: Wonderful Stat for Madison Ave visitors
text: This is my new favorite hotel in the heart of the city. Centrally located, friendly service, and beautiful rooms. It may be a little cramped for more than one person, but absolutely perfect for solo travelers.

title: Leisure trip
text: Draper, Ascend Hotel Collection has a professional staff who knows how to welcome guests in a very friendly manner. In addition, they are available to assist in whichever way they can.Besides, the hotel is a very quiet place and the rooms clean and comfortable. The only minus was the room size that was a bit tight. Apart from that, everything else was excellent. Thus, on the whole I would give this hotel a rating of 4.5 on a 0-5 scale.

title: New York getaway
text: The Draper hotel was amazing! It’s a very nice looking place, with polite and attentive staff. The king bedroom is small, but offers everything you need, seeing as you don’t book a room in Manhattan to spend most of your time in your hotel room!  Very clean (and comfortable) rooms and bathroom. Coffee is horrible, lol, but there are so many amazing coffee places right around the corner so that didn’t take anything away from our experience. Would definitely recommend! It’s also a GREAT location to soooo many attractions!! Walking distance to Broadway, Central Park, Piers, and if you’re lucky, you will have a view of the Empire State Building from your window like we did! Overall, great experience at The Draper and would definitely go back!

title: Great location and staff
text:
Mohammed at the front desk was personable and took care of business. 

This small hotel is in a great location on a relatively quiet street. Their ground floor lobby cafe wasn't open "because of covid", which sounds lame to me considering how the rest of the city is running at 100%.

title: Elizabeth S.
text: Great accommodations.  Ali was very professional, helpful and a pleasure to deal with.  Wonderful stay.  Would definitely come back to the Draper.  Check-in was smooth and had the best customer service from Ali.

title: Good location!
text:
My sister and I returned to NYC for a concert at Madison Square Garden and chose this location for its proximity to the Garden. We were not disappointed on that front. A quick 10 minute walk got us to the concert and it was a quick, safe walk back when the show ended after 11pm. We reserved a standard room with a King bed.

Check-in was quick and easy even if the person who checked us in was a little condescending when I misunderstood his initial instructions. It's NYC. I'm a New Yorker so I let it pass but if this is his manner with visitors who already think NYers are rude, then his attitude can only support that belief. The remaining front-desk personnel were mostly friendly and welcoming.

The room was small as expected but clean with no carpet. The housekeeping staff we encountered was very pleasant. The bed was comfortable and the AC was quiet and worked well and evenly. The walls are a bit thin so we were awakened at 3am by a person laughing and speaking loudly one of the days but otherwise the floor was quiet within minimum noise. We like hotels that require the use of the key card to access the floors for that extra level of security which this one has. 

There is no closet but the side tables have drawers and there is a drawer at the foot of the bed frame for clothes. Ample hangers to hang clothes above the cupboard containing the small fridge. The only true complaint I have about this room is the bottles of soap/shampoo, lotion and conditioner in the bathroom are refilled instead of individual, tiny bottles (this part I appreciate since it is more environmentally friendly) but they are not tamper-proof so unless they are completely switched out between guests (which I assume not) then it gave me pause to use them. 

Pros: Proximity to MSG, Grand Central Station. Location
Cons: Small room, walls are a bit thin. one drawer at the bottom of the bed. needs some sort of counter space in bathroom.

We would consider staying here again if needed.

title: Great location
text: I recently stayed on site at The Draper. The hotel was great! Great location, service, and room. Stayed on the 21st floor and had a great view. I would for sure recommend. I hope to return in the future and stay again.

title: Great Service and hospitality
text:
Highly recommend this accommodation, great locality rooms and service! Went out of their way to accommodate with a great big smile.

Will be back again should we visit the big Apple again.

Thank you team!

title: Customer Service
text:
The check in was great.  They would not refund me after me missing a flight but I still had to stay for the remainder of the weekend.  The gentlemen were not very friendly but still provided the minimum customer service.
The room was small but it is to be expected in some NY hotels this was my first stay at this hotel as well as my first stay from the Ascend collection from Choice hotels.  I was not thoroughly impressed.  It did have a refrigerator which shocked me because it is not always common in NYC.
The bed was comfortable but a spider bit me and twice while sleeping and upon check out the lady was not only rude she would not assist me with any sort of first aid kit or anything.  
I also did not like there is no bar in the hotel they offer you the option to go to a close by property to take advantage of happy hour options that are only three days and limited hours it would almost be a waste to go looking for the other property.  The bathroom was small yet clean,  I also enjoyed the tv and the fact that you needed a card to go up the elevator,
It was very easy to catch an Uber or Lyft and the walk to starbucks and 6th street or 5th is really close.
The Lyft from LaGuardia was cheaper of course that the Lyft to Newark upon leaving but that is to be expected.  I would not stay here again and as a Diamond member of Choice privileges and Hilton Honors it is not often that I say that about a hotel within the brand but the customer service upon check out was just horrible for me and unnecessary.  I checked out on a Monday so I had no previous interaction with her. I just wanted first aid assistance and to inform her of the bit and to turn in my card but she was extremely rude.

title: Great nyc hotel on a budget
text:
Pleasantly surprised… room much nicer than the lobby and spacious-ish for New York.  Central location and pleasant staff. Would recommend and stay here again 

Only con is  no bar or restaurant in the hotel.
I liked the ice cold water in the lobby :)

title: Great stay!
text: Hotel is located just off 5th ave which was very convienent for our needs. The room was small but very clean. The staff was great. Only drawback was that breakfast options weren't available at the hotel.

title: Game day trip
text: Cute hotel with great location!! The entire staff was so nice and accommodating!!! I would stay here again and recommend it to anyone else!!!!!! If you get a chance to visit New York City , don’t hesitate to book this hotel for your stay! Like I said , it’s awesome!

title: The Draper Hotel, NYC
text: The lobby and room was Very clean and appeared to be recently updated. The  staff was very friendly and accommodating. Paid parking was 2 blocks away on 35th st. No in and out with your car, once you park it it is there until you leave. But, the location of the hotel is great! Very walkable to many famous locations! The only reason I did not give this hotel a 5 star is the size of the room. We had a room with 2 double beds and it was tight!  Small room, but,  I did not go to NYC to stay in my room; I would recommend this hotel.

title: Great location!
text:
Stayed at The Draper for three nights, using it as a stopover before heading down to Orlando. 
GREAT LOCATION! Ideally located in the heart of Manhattan, easy walking distance to Times Square, numerous Subway stations, loads of restaurants, and plenty of shopping in close proximity. 

Despite being in such a good location - pleasantly surprised that there was no noise at night. 

The reception staff were really helpful and attentive. Check-in very quick. We had a late evening flight on the night of check-out, and they were happy to hold on to our luggage for the day until we left for the airport. 

Both JFK and LGA airports were easily accessible from the hotel. We opted for air train, mainline and Subway rather than sitting in a cab in the traffic.

I would best describe the hotel as boutique - it's clearly recently undergone a refurbishment. Nice decor, clean and fresh rooms with en suite. 

The layout on each floor appears to be the lift shaft surrounded by 6 rooms. You can hear the ping of the lift arriving on your floor, and the bedroom doors are heavy, with a substantial locking system on them, so it's not really possible to close them quietly. The whole hotel is not particularly spacious, but perfectly acceptable for a long weekend stay, and in comparison with other hotels in the same road and vicinity - I think very reasonably priced. 

I would definitely recommend, and if ever the opportunity arose to return to NYC, I wouldn't hesitate in booking The Draper again!

title: Good room and hotel
text:
Had a good time staying at the Draper. King bed is large, bathroom is nice, working mini fridge(rare!), room is a bit small but what can you expect for Manhattan. Comfy bed and pillows though. You can faintly hear the elevator as other reviews stated but that didn't bother us. Also, all the included soaps (hand, shampoo, etc) are very scented which wasn't a problem but I know people who it'd bother a lot. 

Front desk staff were super friendly and helpful, and location is nearby lots of great food/sights. Note as of this review the downstairs cafe is still closed which is a bit sad. Being a quick walk to a Marvelous by Fred was great too! If I need a hotel in midtown I'll be sure to return!

title: Great room and location
text: I chose this hotel based on location in proximity to shows and MSG partly because we wanted these things within walking distance, but not in the full chaos of Times Square. Opted for 23rd floor suite for a girls' trip to give us ample space. The room itself was fantastic with a great view. Beds were comfy, all was clean, and most of all we had plenty of room -- hard to come by in NYC. Not having daily cleaning service was not an issue for us, but I can see where others would find this as a missing element. The staff in the lobby were extremely pleasant, helpful, and accommodating. The only major downside was not having the cafe available in the lobby. The ability to grab coffee or a pastry or something for breakfast without having to venture out is something I would definitely prefer for a future trip. We ended up door dashing a few times to make up for this, which served its purpose... but when the photos of the hotel clearly feature a cafe (which looks amazing!) it should be up and running. The "not available due to covid" doesn't fly as a valid excuse for me anymore. Overall, we had a great stay. If the cafe were open I would stay here again WITHOUT HESITATION but provide this feedback because I think it's important to allow businesses the opportunity to hear honest feedback in a competitive environment, and this is the only thing that falls short of 5 stars.

title: Small room but very comfortable for 2 nights.
text: We stayed here for 2 nights and really enjoyed our stay. Very clean and comfortable. Updated bathroom and comfortable. We even had a great view of the Empire State Building. You can easily walk to subway and grand central. Staff was very attentive and pleasant and responded to requests for towels promptly. It’s not a big room but nothing in New York is big at this price point.

title: Most comfy bed
text:
Yes, the room is small but it has style and the bed was a dream- best hotel sleep I've had in a long time. Quiet and cold a/c.
The bathroom is new with beautiful tiles, good water pressure, and a nice glass shower door. 
Fast elevators. Paris bakery at the corner. Keens Steakhouse right around the corner. 
Staff were all nice. Great value. Def recommend!

title: Excellent hotel and great value
text: We loved our stay at the Draper. Everyone was so helpful. We knew we wouldn’t be in the hotel much and didn’t mind the smaller room. It was clean and there was no noise! We wanted to be away from the chaos of Times Square and this location was perfect. We will stay at the Draper again!

title: Clean but not very convenient
text:
Hotel is clean and rooms aren’t as small as most NYC hotels. They are a decent size to be comfortable. The beads were super comfy and provided great rest  after walking the city all day. The rooms has a small fridge which is convenient. Nicely located near many attractions and walkable sights. 
My feedback would be about accessibility within the rooms. Sitting space when not in bed is limited. There isn’t dresser or counter space to set items on. No suitcase stands. I hate putting my items on the floor. There is no type of closet. They do have 4 hooks on the walls but they don’t provide sufficient space for any type of storage. It made for a tight fit in our room with all of our suitcases, small stroller and anything we bought while visiting. No closet meant no iron or ironing board. Called down for one and was only given the iron. The bathroom is the biggest let down. It’s tiny tiny with NO space to set any personal items. The sink doesn’t have a ledge or anywhere to place items. The tub has NO where to place items. While you shower you have to put a towel down and put your soap dish on it after you’re  done. They could’ve added shelves or shower caddy for items. It makes for an uncomfortable shower experience. There aren’t even hooks in the shower for wash cloths. I don’t think I’d stay here again. It’s clean and seems to be a sufficient hotel but as you actually utilize the room you realize it’s inconvenient.

title: Wonderful Boutique Feel without Boutique Budget
text: A cute addition to the overwhelming amount of cookie-cutter hotels in Midtown. The lobby is relatively small but with an adjacent coffee bar (closed due to Covid) and a library area for working or relaxing. The real winner here though is the cozy and well designed room. The quality of the materials (beautiful Spanish inspired floor tiles in the bathroom, velvet accent pillows on bed, brass lighting, and cheeky art on the walls made the room feel like it was something you'd find in a hotel that was double the cost of The Draper. The layout is small as most NYC hotels but they still manage to fit a proper desk and well hidden refrigerator in the room. There is not closet but there is an area to hang clothes. If someone was coming for a week, the room might get a little tight but for 2-3 days the room is a nice retreat from the madness of the city. Highly recommend.

title: Wonderful time
text: Visited for a quick getaway with my teenage son. Arrived before check in time, very happy they stored our luggage for us.  Room is cozy with a modern feel.  View of the Empire State Building made it perfect. Hotel was quiet and we felt very safe. Overall, a great value.  Can’t wait to go back!

title: Great stay in NYC
text:
Perfect location
The room exceeded my expectations. Room size is reasonable and spacious for NY standards
My sister and I stayed in July 2022 and they have provided free cold water in the lobby for everyone this summer.
The staff were kind and approachable.
Would definitely stay again

title: Stylish, Clean, and Convenient!
text: This was the perfect weekend away - The Draper was so stylish, clean, and convenient, and for a good price considering we booked it last-minute!  Centrally located, quick to Grand Central, quick to our Broadway show.  We will definitely be staying again!

title: Great stay in nyc
text: The room exceeded my expectations. Very clean and spacious given hotel is located in the center of the city. The staff were friendly and helpful and the location is an excellent jumping off point to explore frim. This is a hidden gem.

title: Conveniently located, reasonably sized room
text: We cheated on Marriott because of the reviews for this hotel and it’s location. For the price is a fair deal but much more could be done with the property. The lobby facilities are neglected, bar is closed, no coffee, etc. Rooms are clean but housekeeping is dashy. Thumbs up for the bed and pillows. Also room size is reasonable, even spacious for NY standards. Management and all personnel is kind and caring but forgetful at times. If you are on a budget this will do without regrets.

title: Convenient
text: The Draper is in a very convenient location to many sightseeing opportunities. The rooms are very small for a family of four with two teenage boys. The only complaint that I have is that the elevator bell is constantly dinging. The footprint of this hotel is very small an elevator is situated in the middle of all rooms.

title: Excellent experience
text: the experience in the hotel was good, Max made my stay perfect, he is so nice and overwhelming, 5 stars for him and the hotel , the staffs were great too, the hotel is in the center of everything , great location, they have  business area where you can work and stay, brilliant idea, after checking out i stayed there for 3 hours ,

title: Bilal Mohammed
text:
Excellent Service and Hospitality, Friendly staff and cleanliness
Very convenient location to all the major attractions  
Looking forward to staying again and surely recommending to my family and friends too

title: New York visit!
text: Great hotel! Excellent location! We had a view of the Empire State Building! Central for busses, Macy's and Times Square.  Very clean and friendly staff. Eat at the Keg on 36th Street! Visited with my granddaughter!

title: Amazing Stay
text: Our stay here was phenomenal, the views we got from our rooms were breathtaking and really gave the NY feel. The rooms were clean, modern, and wonderfully decorated.  The front desk and room service were friendly and prompt to our requests or interactions. Highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great stay in Manhattan NY!

title: Amazing experience
text: My family and I stayed here during our vacation to NY Manhattan. I’ve stay at many hotels due to my work, and this hotel was Amazing! From the perfect location close to time square, amazing front desk staff, and very clean and comfortable rooms. Being a light sleeper the beds were wonderful. Highly recommend.

title: Excellent stay at the Draper
text: Our stay at the Draper was quite good overall.  The room was relatively small, but comparable to other hotels in the city we've stayed in.  The staff was extremely courteous and helpful, and the price was better than nearly all other hotels in the area.  Finally, the location was excellent: it was within a 10 minute walk of several subway stops, giving a lot of flexibility, and walking distance to Times Square, the Empire State Building, and many other attractions, while still being far enough so that the street didn't have too much noise (for New York). The only minor improvement would be if the hotel offered a small complimentary breakfast; even a grab and go bag might make it even more competitive with nearby hotels. Overall I would not hesitate to stay here again.

title: Nice place to stay in NYC!
text: The rooms are very nice and clean! They are a bit small but this is NYC! My only complaint was that there wasn’t much room for luggage and the doors slam a lot so it’s a bit noisy in the morning! I would definitely stay here again though! The staff members are super friendly and very accommodating!

title: Great find
text: I’m always on the hunt for a reasonably priced, clean nice hotel in NY and I will be coming back. The service was excellent my room was clean, quiet and with nice decor and small coffee machine. Location is convenient so there are plenty of food options around (not at the property- which is fine by me)

title: Summer in Ny
text: The experience in this hotel was amazing! Max at the front desk did an outstanding job, helping me and my boyfriend. He was very informative, and  basically gave us the best ideas of how to spend our days in New York City. The room was Perfect. I will highly recommend this hotel.

title: Front Desk Max Fantastic
text:
Max is Marvelous! 
Wonderful experience at check in. He’s charming, efficient and smoothed our entry into NYC. Made our quick visit completely hassle free.

Hotel is clean, well designed and the rooms very organized and modern. Decent location.

title: Max is the BEST!
text:
Max, at the front desk, was so accommodating to our group of women attending Broadway shows. We were able to check in on arrival with no problems and our room(s) is/are just perfect! 
It’s people like Max that make visiting NYC such a pleasure!
We will absolutely return and recommend The Draper to friends!!

title: Wonderful!
text: My 12 year old daughter and I stayed at The Draper this weekend and loved it! The location was perfect, the room was clean and staff was super helpful. The only thing the hotel lacked was cafe/food of some sort, but we knew that was not an option when booking. We would definitely stay there again!

title: Comfort Plus!
text: I was amazed at this NYC hotel for the price. It was in the perfect location for all if the things that we wanted to do. We had an amazing 21st floor view of the Empire State Building, that is just a couple of blocks away. The customer service was top notch! The room was nicely appointed and appeared recently remodeled with awesome finishes. The only down side is that it is small at about half the size, if that, of a average sized hotel room. We didn't care. All of the pluses and the amazing price made it so worth it. I had read that the rooms were "compact" so I was expecting it. Best value I have ever found on an hotel room in beautiful NYC!

title: Es hapert heim Personal...
text: Das Positive vorweg: Die Lage des Hotels ist super. Auch die Zimmer sind schön eingerichtet. Von unserem Zimmer im 20. Stocks hatten wir einen hervorragenden Blick auf das Empire State Building. Würden wir das Hotel wieder buchen? Eher nicht. Der Grund liegt beim Personal. Leider mussten wir das Hotel drei Mal anfragen, ob bei uns ein Late Check Out möglich war. Auf unsere erste schriftliche Anfrage wurde leider nur mit zwei Worten geantwortet: "Nach Möglichkeit". Somit war unsere Vorfreude etwas getrübt. Leider setzte sich die Personalunfreundlichkeit vor Ort fort. Beim Betreten der Lobby wurde man nicht gegrüsst, beim Verlassen wurde und kein schöner Tag gewünscht. Das war bei jedem anderen Hotel in New York bislang anders. 10 Minuten vor abgemachte Check Out-Termin wurden wir dann noch vom Housekeeping aus den Zimmern gerufen, wir sollen doch nun bitte auschecken. Am Ende wurde uns mitgeteilt, dass ein Late Check Out bis 15 Uhr für 100 USD möglich ist. Grundsätzlich in Ordnung, für uns war die Sache bis zu diesem Zeitpunk aufgrund der Vorkommnisse gegessen. Mit zwei zugedrückten Augen vergeben wir aufgrund der Lage und der schönen Zimmereinrichtung 3 Sterne. Ansonsten müssten wir leider 2 vergeben.

title: Great Customer Service from Max
text: Hotel was in a great location. The best part of our was stay was Max helping us stay in the same room, when we extended our stay a night. Max was also very personable and friendly taking the time to look at all options to accommodate our extra night in the same room.

title: Great hotel experience
text: Rooms were great. Staff were nice and friendly. Max was welcoming and was always helpful. Whenever we has requests, hotel staff would always accommodate us. Overall I would definitely recommend others to stay here when visiting New York.

title: Lovely stay in the heart of Manhattan
text: The Draper is a fun boutique hotel within walking distance of many major attractions. We loved the new fresh look, the comfortable rooms with cold a/c, and most of all, the friendly staff. Max was especially helpful from my first call asking questions about the hotel to helping me with extra bookings due to airline changes, booking us a cab to and from the airport, giving advice on local attractions, helping us with daily needs. It's not often you find a staff that remembers you by name. Thank you to Max and the rest of the staff for making us feel welcome so far from home.

title: Truly worth your time and money.
text: I'm keeping this short but know that The Draper was clean, quiet, friendly, well located, affordable, and a great choice! We stayed in April (sorry for the late review) and I'm so glad that we found this place to book. Yes, small rooms. No drawers, and it took me too long to realize that there were drawers in the bed and space to put your suitcase. That's on me. Very happy with our stay!

title: Amazing Staff in a clean NYC hotel
text:
WOW! We can’t say enough great things about everything about our week in NYC as guests here at The Draper. Mustafa, Crystal and Max were so efficient and accommodating! Max, with his huge beautiful smile was seemingly on duty 247 and was always upbeat and genuinely happy in his job. It will be our “go to hotel” when we visit again in December.

The rooms are not huge… yes, but hey, you’re in NYC and are out and about enjoying this incredible city,  a big room isn’t necessary!

If you want a very well situated hotel room in the City That Definitely DOESN’T Sleep…. By all means, book a room here with the delightful and friendly staff at The Draper on 37th at 5th Avenue!!

title: Amazing place to stay
text: The views and the rooms are amazing. Withing walking distance to Times Square, Broadway shows, and everything in Manhattan.   Max and Shineeza at the front desk are absolutely the best, very friendly. and very helpful.  I will always stay here because they make it feel like home away from home.  Thank you Max for making our stay memorable.

title: Nice, clean and friendly hotel
text: The room is nice and clean. Max is really friendly,nice and helpful and so are other staffs. The location is close to everywhere which is very convenient to walk around to shopping places and restaurants. I would definitely be back here on my next visit

title: Womderful 6 day trip to NYC
text:
We had a great stay! Nice rooms, city view. Very clean hotel. Regular rooms are small but that‘s NYC :-)

What makes the hotel suoer special are Max and Amreen from the front desk! Their friendliness and customer centric thinking is 10 Star Level. Any hotel would be blessed to have such great people!

title: Nice place and very friendly service!
text: Excellent hotel. Rooms are clean and well designed. Location very good for sightseeing in Manhattan, New York. Everything is in walking distance. Super Service by Max and Amreen! Will pick this place again when back for a trip to the Unites States!

title: New York stay at The Draper Hotel
text: Our stay at The Draper Hotel was pleasant and quiet. The room was cleaned and well organized.  The staff was courteous and tried to accommodate our needs to the best of their abilities. I could stay there again and would recommend it to a friend.

title: Staying at Draper NYC
text: It was a nice stay. Hotel is located very close to center. Clean, tidy rooms, friendly staff. Liked the interior at lobby. Special thanks to Max for helping out whenever i had a question about the city or needed anything at the hotel. I could stay there again.

title: Review of the frapper
text:
The hotel is really clean and the staff is nice and joyful, especially Max! He is welcoming and takes care of all your issues. The room is cute and gives you a nice view of New York City! However, the bistro is closed. I would clearly come back! 
Thank you hôtel the draper xoxox

title: Very comfortable place to stay with great views on upper floors
text: For the price, this was a great find. Stayed 5 nights in king room on an upper floor. King bed was large enough to sleep two very comfortably. Shower and bathroom was very clean and modern, could have benefited from additional towel holders, but we made it work with one hook. Not too cramped, but not spacious. Just the right size. They always had ice water available in the lobby which was very convenient. Great service too. I recommend saving some money and giving the Draper a try.

title: Beautiful new hotel with exceptional staff
text: Beautiful new hotel with exceptional staff. Max and everyone at the front desk go out of their way to be helpful in a way that is warm and friendly. Rooms are modern and intelligently designed (nice TV, smart storage space, hardwood floors). I can’t wait to visit again

title: Small but clean and great location
text: We stayed here on an unexpected overnight layover. We had a king room which was well appointed. Not a huge room, but honestly it’s NYC and so for the area it was in it was great for us! Only blocks away from Times Square but not stuck in the middle of it all. We didn’t have time for breakfast so I don’t know if they had/what it would have been like. Clean room and bathroom.

title: Elegant hotel which exceeded my expectations
text:
This place deserves 3 or even 4 starts, they way the arrange and decorates the room, very clean and always you can smell an elegant aroma in the room and every where you go in the hotel. 
I stayed in many hotels in Manhattan during the past year because o f work trips, and this one fairly exceeded my expectations. Kudos to the management and the friendly and responsible staff.

title: One of NYC’s Finest Boutique Hotel
text:
The Draper has a very chic aesthetic.
The interior decor evokes modern style with a vintage flair.  Think mid century modern.
The rooms are cozy.  Large widescreen television, a desk, mini fridge, ample bathroom and with a powerful shower head.  

Behind the lobby & elevators,
there is a huge seating area and business center.
Having an ATM inside the hotel is quite convenient.  It extends to a lovely outdoor patio.  

The front desk staff is very hospitable.

I especially want to recognize Mr. Marish
for his professional manner and politeness.  
As a courtesy,  Mr. Marish ordered us a taxi to the airport.  He offered a wake-up call.  
We had to be at the JFK airport very early.

title: Clean friendly wonderful hotel right in heart of Manhattan
text: I have stayed here a few times and love this hotel. It's private, quiet and in a perfect location. Manish at the front desk is extremely helpful. Will always defer to here for my Manhattan stays.  Always recommend to friends and family.

title: Barely Average, Tiny and Noisy
text:
I stay in NYC a lot. My first time at The Draper. Tiny rooms, even by NYC standards. Not thoughtfully outfitted. For example, not a single hook, rod or shelf in the bathroom. Fridge in the tiny room was really noisy, I had to turn it off. Shades had to remain down on full length window since view was directly into another occupied building just feet away.

Seemed clean. Bed is okay. And shower fine. Location is good. Being close to 5th means you've got to walk a few blocks for any quick services, snacks, bodegas. 

It's a small hotel, so you can hear the hallway and elevator from even the furthest room. Not well insulated. It was busy, and very noisy. Some hours the elevator would ding and open multiple times a minute (not normal). People in the hallway woke me up 2am, 3am, 4am.

Glad I was here for just one night. For the price, you can do way better in this town. Unsure why it's ranked so high here.

title: Quality not Quantity :-)
text:
Okay, we knew hotel rooms in NYC would be smaller and pricier but oops - we definitely should have gotten two rooms. Family of four including 2 teenage boys - we were all over each other. 

BUT - still loved it! Wish I had taken a photo of the bathroom. Really nice shower - LOVED the shower head and tile and lighting. Just lovely. 

Room was very nicely put together. 

EVERY single person we came in contact with working at the Hotel was lovely. Very nice people.

I only give it 4 out of 5 because the storage was rough - even for 2 people it would have been tricky. No closet and the clothes hanging bar thing above the coffee station was better than nothing BUT could have been better if the bar extended out on each side providing more places to hang clothing. Along those lines, MORE hooks all over the room would be helpful to make up for no place to hang anything.

We found the drawers under the bed on the last day.- we hadn't seen them because our luggage on the floor was blocking them and we couldn't even walk around the room :p

Same notes for the bathroom - lovely fixtures and lighting BUT need more shelves and hooks. 

Regardless - I recommend! I'll just be sure to tell people no more than 2 people per room.

title: Tasteful
text: Small but well curated and tastefully furniture and trims. Staff is friendly especially Pathik. No issues, had a good stay. Easy to connect chromecast on TV and comfortable bed and work area. Will be good to have room service:

title: Stay here in NYC!!!
text: This is where you want to stay in NYC. We stayed for 5 nights 6/9-6/14. First: the location is perfect. Easy walk to Times Square and easier walk to the subway. Next: the staff is amazing. So very helpful, kind and welcoming. If you’ve ever stayed in NYC you’ll know that waiting for the hotel elevators can be painful. Not here. Never had to wait more than 90sec for the elevator. Cafe in lobby isn’t open right now, but walk down 37th to 6th and grab coffee/pastries at Paris Baguette. Room is cute and immaculate. Bed is super comfy. Stay on higher floors at back of building. You’ll have an amazing view of the Empire State Building. Everything is very clean. And again, can’t say enough about how helpful and kind all of the staff were. Having stayed other places before, this will 100% be our place when we come back. Perfect is a hard goal, but this hotel achieved perfection for many reasons. We can’t wait to come back!

title: Modern, Clean & Convenient!
text: This hotel was very clean, modern, quiet and very convenient. The rooms are small, but big enough for two people and space is functionally designed. Beds and linens weee comfortable. Staff were friendly and attentive. We stayed for two nights and were able to walk to several spots nearby. Great choice! We loved it!

title: Amazing Staff! Makes you feel welcome!
text:
I've stayed at the Drapwr Hotel multiple times and it was ALWAYS been wonderful. 

Besides being conveniently located in Midtown Manhattan, the rooms are super clean, but most importantly the service is exquisite. Pathitk deserves special recognition as he has always made me feel at home.

I highly recommend it.

title: Small, but mighty!
text: My room at The Draper was small, but truly had everything I needed - first and foremost, a VERY comfortable bed!  A small refrigerator and coffeemaker ensured that I had that first cup of coffee to start the day, and that cold water when I wanted it.  The hotel is in a good location to be able to walk to lots of "touristy" things (Broadway shows, Macys, restaurants, shopping) and yet each night I fell into a deep sleep because my room was quiet and cozy.  The staff is wonderful; helpful, problem-solving when needed, warm, and friendly.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: Excellent service
text: I stayed in The Draper hotel for 2 nights with my family and I can't express enough that it was the best decision. The hotel is perfectly located in the heart of Manhattan from where you can walk to all the main NYC attractions. The hotel staff were really helpful, courteous and looked after us in every possible way throughout our stay. Can't recommend this hotel more. We will definitely be visiting this hotel soon. There was this staff, in particular, I believe that his name was Max. Excellent gentleman He went above and beyond to make sure that my family and I were provided with great service.  :)

title: Great location had everything you needed for ANYC stay
text: It was perfect. It had everything you needed to stay and see an Explorer NYC it was centrally located comfortable comfortable clean accommodations. Would definitely recommend and stay again.  They want me to keep adding more characters so I am trying to submit this review

title: The Drape NY city
text:
Great location and clean. Well maintained.
The only bad experience was that they offer assistance for transportation to the airport for a price that they have  in a display in the lobby and when the car came the next day, the price was higher. The hotel should make sure that the prices that they offer are in agreement with the car service company Aerolimo. Other than that we enjoyed our visit. Thanks.

title: The Draper
text: Hotel is very nice and comfortable, Max at the front desk was extremely helpful and welcoming. Location is prime and  rooms are chic, clean and comfortable. Definitely recommending this to my friends and family

title: Wonderful Stay
text: My son and I stayed at The Draper in June 2022 for a quick weekend trip.  We were both very impressed with this hotel. The location was perfect, centrally located and a quick walk from every train you need.  We felt safe walking to and from the hotel at all hours.  The rooms were spotless and the bedding was very comfortable.  The staff was very warm and welcoming and always greeted us with a smile. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in NYC and we will be back for sure!

title: Poor communication
text: I have booked a stay for September & have been trying to contact hotel via email with no response. Has anyone else had similar problems?? I am reading glowing reviews but it is frustrating that I cannot get a reply to my email.

title: Great for a short trip to NYC!
text: This hotel is perfect to stay at if you want to spend a few days walking around the city and exploring. It is central to many things and was very nice. The staff was very kind and accommodating, especially Hafeez. I would definitely recommend staying here!

title: Amazing Stay
text: Stayed here for a week during our NYC visit. Max was super helpful in accommodating all of our needs. Everything was super convenient and clean. Would stay again if I were to come back. There is a business center and patio as well.

title: Clean and convenient
text:
Max was amazing. He was polite and courteous.. Made the stay real easy. Everything was as requested. Location of the hotel was perfect. Would recommend without question.

Looked at many options before selecting this one

Thank you Max

title: Gem of a hotel
text: Great location, Comfortable rooms. Fantastic staff. Quiet yet in the heart of the city. Affordable for Manhattan. Max and Ali go extra mile for customer service . Whenever I’m in midtown Manhattan this is my go to place. As a busy entertainment executive I need access to many parts of the city. The Draper is perfect OK

title: Perfect stay..
text: Max attended us very well.. very accommodating and gave us all the answers we needed..  Everyone else from the Draper team was very friendly. The Draper felt very comfortable. Fresh linens and all. .  Thank you Max...

title: BEST HOTEL TO STAY AT!
text: I came here to stay with my best friend for my birthday and it was an amazing experience! It is the perfect hotel because it is close to so many things. The hotel it self was very clean and has the best views. Pathik from front desk was very helpful during my stay and gave me good customer experience. I highly recommend anyone looking to stay in nyc to stay at this hotel, you will not regret it! Only good things to say about this hotel!

title: Amazing stay!
text: I stayed in this hotel over the weekend and I have no complaints. The rooms are very nice and clean, staff is incredible, including max who helped me check in. Very friendly and made me feel welcome :)

title: Bachelorette Weekend
text:
Thank you Max for all of your accommodations. 
Not only did they waive my early check in fee but they recommended parking with a personal discount code also. The rooms were clean, beautiful yet had there own personal touch the represent the Draper hotel. My friends were staying in to celebrate a bachelorette weekend which the hotel highly supported and encouraged. Most don’t due to possibilities of typical noise complaints and so on so that was refreshing to see. Honestly my only complaint would be the ice machine being on one level. I highly recommend this hotel to future guests and I’d be happy to come back!

title: Ayman The Man!
text: AYMAN is the man. He made my checkin so much more pleasant today and he takes care of me and makes my stay(s) extra comfortable, whenever I request help with my AC. He shows up and handles it!  always on top of his game when it comes to making sure the Air-conditioning systems are all up to Par! He is skilled at what he does and my exchanges with him are always pleasant he makes a tremendous asset to whatever property is lucky enough to have him.

title: Great service from Ayman
text:
Clean brand new hotel and very well located in midtown

outstanding service by Ayman who will do whatever it takes to make your stay as comfortable and smooth as possible.
Super devoted to his customers

title: What an amazing hotel at a great location
text: Stayed at the Draper two nights. The hotel itself is beautiful (it is new). I think if the purpose of your stay is to explore a beautiful city, stay in a clean and beautiful hotel, be walking distance to so many great things, and have great customer service this is the location for you. Lastyly, Max is an incredible agent - he is so kind and offered such great service at check in and check out. Overall, a wonderful experience.

title: Totalmente recomendable
text:
Ubicación perfecta
Cómodo
Habitacion y baño pequeños pero no faltaba de nada
Solo le encontré la pegq  de tenter que  avisar diqriamente para que limpiaran salvo excepción siempre se quiere limpieza diaria 
El personal encantador y muy servicial

title: Management need to sort out the housekeeping and lack of facilities
text:
We have just returned from 6 days here, this was my 3rd trip to NYC and this was the worst hotel I've stayed in.  On arrival we were allocated a room for wheelchair access as no other rooms available, this was fine but the room was not what we expected - no iron, ironing board, kettle, wardrobe or anywhere to store luggage.  The "wardrobe" is a hanging rail above the coffee machine........

On day 1 we unpacked as best we could and headed out to explore the city.  Absolutely shattered we fell into bed for an early night!!  Not to be as you can hear the lift pinging all night long and can hear conversations from outside the lift and room next door.

Day 2 we showered, dressed and were out fro. 7am until 11pm - on our return we noted that no housekeeping had been done, too tired to enquire we just went to bed, next day I commented to reception on our way out.  Day 3 no housekeeping, had to take out our own rubbish and ask for clean towels which didn't arrive.  Day 4 I again asked at reception for housekeeping and towels - towels were there on our return but no housekeeping.  Day 5 I phoned and asked about the rubbish being removed and was told to leave outside room and it would be lifted, unsurprisingly it was still there the next morning.  Day 6 and we checked out and had not had any housekeeping at all.

Bar and snacks are not available at all either despite their pictures !  I have never stayed in a hotel without housekeeping even travellodge provides clean towels and linen.

Plus side is location, just off 5th near Bryant Park but there are much nicer hotels nearby for less money.

title: Such a Welcoming and Personable Hotel
text: We were due to stay at a large hotel in Times Square but just before our trip we were told it wasn't ready to re-open after being refurbed.    We searched the web to find a replacement and were won over to The Draper because of the good reviews.    We were definitely NOT disappointed.    A much smaller hotel but this meant we were undisturbed in our room and elsewhere in the hotel and there was never any waiting for the elevator or at Reception.     All the staff were friendly and helpful and if we requested fresh towels or similar the matter was dealt with promptly.    Everywhere was clean and tidy and the ice cold water available at Reception  after a long, hot day out was very welcome.     No food in the hotel (pastries and coffee etc are due to be available from September) but the 3 or 4 minute walk early in the morning to the Paris Baguette shop (turn left out of the Draper) set us up nicely to enjoy their delicious pastries & coffee.   Being just out of Times Square was, for us, beneficial as it was much less busy and less noisy -  even meant  we could open the window in our room, which was a plus.   We would be happy to recommend the Draper and would certainly return ourselves if ever we are back in NY.    Thank you to all Reception/Housekeeping Staff for their part in making our visit so enjoyable.

title: Would definitely recommend!
text:
We enjoyed our stay with Pathik and his staff very much. Pathik made sure I had an amazing stay in the most amazing room that was well maintained by Ayman. They were so helpful and it was one of our best stays in New York. 
Our room was spacious for New York principals. It was centrally located and very clean. 
Only thing I missed was a closet and some extra hooks in the bathroom for towels. 
Would love to visit again next year!

title: Great stay
text:
I just returned from a week in New York City staying at the Draper.

Overall, I’m very happy with my stay.  Staff are friendly and helpful. Room was clean and comfortable.  On the first day, I was smelling something perfume and it was recommend that I open the windows and door to mu room to air it out, it was likely the cleaning products used by maid staff, and that did the trick.  Another issue was hearing voices from the room next door, but it was mostly ok.

I was on a high flor facing north, if you face south, you can see the Empire State building from your room.

The café in the lobby was closed.  The microwave in the lower level was just sitting on a small table in a very narrow hallway, so not inviting.  Basically, you get your room and it’s a decent room.  I’d stay here again.  I’d recommend getting a slightly larger room if you’re staying for a week and want to be able to sit somewhere other than the desk chair or your bed (I was in a King room).

title: Draper Hotel
text: I’ll like to share my awesome experience at the Draper Thanks Draper for a good stay for our family. It was accommodating and good. Good customer service especially by Ayman. He made sure the common areas we used were clean.  Thanks

title: LOVE IT HERE!
text: 20/5! This is my second time staying at the Draper and I have nothing but great things to say about this place. Super cute aesthetic, GREAT location, clean rooms, and EXCELLENT STAFF! Ayman was wonderful help and I can’t wait to come back! #Luv

title: Ayman saved the day
text: What a welcome. Totally floored that last minute Ayman and the the team at The Draper. Got us rooms for a large party for a relative’s graduation and was gracious to have us have a meet and greet on property. Plus in the heart of Manhattan and close to all the attractions. Definitely recommend.

title: Fantastic Family Experience
text: Ayman was amazing and made the experience worth while. Phenomenal service and the rooms were great. They provided great room service and provided towels when I needed it. The location was also amazing very close to a lot of notorious locations.

title: Incredible Service
text: The hotel is clean and incredibly well-serviced, especially for the price and location. The facilities are excellent and the rooms are beautiful as well. The staff were amazingly kind and accommodating, I cannot recommend this hotel enough.

title: First class hospitality
text: Lodged at this facility for 2 nights to attend a graduation ceremony.   It was clean and had super friendly staff.  From the front desk to the faculties staff.  Ayman was especially accommodating and helpful.  I typically stay at Hotels on Times Square when I visit NYC.  This Gem will be my new accommodation every time I visit NYC!  Great place!!!!!

title: Nice hotel - reasonable rates
text:
Lovely hotel- it’s still quite new. Fixtures and everything well maintained. Hotel staff where helpful and present. 

Room was facing street on 15th floor limited noise. 

Room was a little tight bathroom was small- but it not unusual for this type of hotel. Liked the toiletries provided.

Loved the back area of the reception where there was a terrace and space to work/chill 

The bar area was not open out our visit would have been nice to come back from a long day and get a drink in this area.

title: The unexpected traveler
text: Very nice atmosphere and the staff, rooms great. I don't have to chase down a housekeeping staff for wash cloths. They don't bug you or give you a hard time also the main attraction the staff answers the phone or they get back to within a certain amount of time.

title: A surprisingly nice hotel
text: I was a little afraid to stay in a small room without a closet, but the room was well designed, there were all sorts of storage spaces and enough room to walk around. Nice decor, a good shower, very friendly staff. There's a nice lobby with work spaces and a small patio.  Very good location. Only downpoint is the view from the window - needed to keep the curtain down. All and all - recommended.

title: Very comfortable but compact rooms. Friendly and helpful staff.
text:
The hotel is new and comfortable but rather compact rooms. The breakfast counter wasn’t operating which was a shame. We’ll located nest to 5th avenue and Bryant park which is very convenient as there are lots of restaurants near by. 
Friendly and helpful staff particularly Ayman. 
Recommend it!

title: Great hotel!
text:
Travelling for business in New York City, this hotel is great, clean, friendly, quiet, easy to access and centrally located. Highly recommended. 
Thx again to the team for feeling welcome! Will book again for sure and already recommended to my colleagues.

title: Great Stay in Manhattan
text: I fully recommend the Draper. We stayed for 6 nights in May - 3 people sharing a double room. Very clean, friendly. Very affordable for the quality. Perfect location for business and pleasure. Safe area and greet dining and eating options around.

title: Fabulous hotel
text:
The location is really good 
The room is very clean and nice
A special thanks to Aymen he was so nice to us and very helpful guy and so professional the good thing he was talking in Arabic so helped us a lot 🙏🏻👌🏻
We will comeback for sure 
Thank u the draper for our amazing stay in New York

title: Friendly Front desk
text: As a frequent visitor to NYC I had stayed in a lot of different hotels. The Draper has been the only one in a long time to make an excellent impression, due to Max and Shenezia, in the front desk, who were extremely friendly and helpful, accommodating my request and making my stay much more agreeable. The room is not big but comfortable, the bathroom is spacious enough, more than in so many others, and the location is great if you need to be in midtown.

title: Kpop concert
text: Well let me start off with saying I work at chick fil a and hospitality is very important me, so if you looking for a hotel with exceptional hospitality The draper is for you, the front desk was so kind greeting us with a smile everyday Max was amazing he gave us a complimentary late check out because we waited awhile for our room the staff was so sweet , they text you everyday to see how you are doing and if you need anything. They even help you get a taxi if you came from the airport. Beds so nice, bathroom shower spacious. I loved this hotel, we needed one close to radio city music hall for a monsta x concert so happy I found this hotel, and its family owned. Thank you boys for your exceptional service see you on the next concert. Just hope the Cafe is open next time.

title: Broadway Weekend
text: The location couldn't have been better. So many great restaurants within walking distance as well as theaters. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful.  The outdoor patio is lovely. Unfortunately (most likely to covid) the food station and bar were not operating.  The room was comfortable and the bed was heaven.  Everything was very clean and modern. Loved my stay and will definitely be coming back!

title: ótimo custo-benefício em Manhattan
text:
Ficamos uma semana no The Draper. O hotel é bem localizado, com metrô e restaurantes próximos. O quarto é confortável, com uma ótima cama e um ótimo chuveiro. O único porém é que, pelo menos no quarto em que fiquei, a porta do box não vedava muito bem e acabava alagando o banheiro depois do banho — mas nada que tenha abalado a estadia.

Os funcionários foram solícitos e simpáticos (em especial o Max, da recepção). De modo geral, foi uma ótima experiência e um ótimo custo-benefício para NY. Certamente ficaria no The Draper de novo.

title: Great Night
text: This place was great..the staff was great.. the place was emulate ..I will be staying there again soon!!Next time we plan on staying longer.. I can't wait to get back to the city so we can stay there!!

title: Great location. Amazing staff
text: Excellent location. Great staff. Highly recommend new hotel. Corner of 5th and 34th and very close to everything including time square, Subways and restaurants. Will definitely come back to stay here again.

title: Nice hotel, great people
text:
Very well located, clean and modern design. The staff is really helpful, Max at the front desk is very attentive and a real delight!

The WiFi works well, beds are comfortable. I recommend this hotel. Enjoy

title: Pleasant checkin experience
text: The check-in was smooth and seamless. Max was super friendly and had great energy. The room was clean and aesthetically pleasing. After a busy night at the airport, was nice to be serviced how they did at the front desk. Definitely going to recommend this  place to friends and family.

title: Superb hotel and location!
text: Stayed this week. Visited NYC a number of time and this hotel is definitely the best location. A few mins walk from 5th Avenue, Bryant Park, Macys, Times Sq. About 15 mins to Rockefeller and Grand Central, another 15 mins to Central Park. Hotel is spotless, very luxurious and staff are extremely helpful. Would thoroughly recommend.

title: Great stay and staff were extremely nice and helpful!
text: Stayed in the Draper for one night before catching an early flight. Room was clean, air conditioned very well, and staff was extremely nice and helpful!! Would definitely stay again! Also only blockes away from time square !

title: Great Hotel!!!
text: Amazing service and great rooms. Decent location if you want to be close to to Times Square. Fairly priced, highly recommend u stay here! They were very accommodating and ensured we were as comfortable as possible.

title: Draper Hotel New York
text: Very friendly staff who went out their way to make you feel welcome!  The room is clean, cozy and surprisingly quiet.  It’s surprising because the hotel is conveniently located close to the attraction, food places, and stores (heavy traffic area). Although, the room is very small and takes creativity to get our luggage out of the way, our view make up for it.

title: Post-college visit
text:
I was very pleasantly surprised with the Draper.   Reviews of hotels in NYC are scary.  The Draper was not so.  Easy check-in with courteous staff.  Nice, clean lobby.  The room was great.  2 double beds were comfortable, clean sheets.  The A/C was really quiet and worked well.  Plenty of room for 2 people and our 5 large bags.  The under bed drawers and storage are a great feature.  I was surprised at how quiet the room was with little to no noise from the street below.  View was what it is, another building across the street, but we enjoyed watching the activity on the street below and taking in the sounds of NY with the window open.  There was also a really nice lounge area on the first floor and even a little outdoor space for sitting in the courtyard.
Bathroom was very clean with a great shower and soft towels.
The front staff arranged our cab to the airport for us on checkout day.  Nice touch.
Only downside is that the cafe and bar are still closed.  I understand, but the website seems to feature this part of the hotel and it was a bit misleading.
This place is in the Garment district and was pretty central to everything.  You will be walking at least 10 minutes to the metro, but that wasn’t a big deal.  Would certainly stay here again, especially knowing first hand how nice it is.

title: Don't let the stars fool you.
text: Great room, great rates, clean and friendly.  All you can ask for in NYC.   The staff was very friendly and accommodating.  Needed an iron and quickly had one brought up.  Room was very clean and perfect size for a NYC hotel.  Location is perfect for midtown.

title: Great stay
text: The location, style and reasonable price of the hotel was a. huge draw for me. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. I would have given a five star rating but I had a few little hiccups. The filter in my room needed changing so the heat wouldn’t work right the first night making it a little chilly but was corrected. I was disappointed that the drink and food area wasn’t operable but I guess that’s because of Covid and not really the hotels fault. I knew going in that my room would be small but it was manageable and cozy. I look forward to returning someday and staying in the room with the balcony when I have the excess funds to splurge. Overall I really liked the mid century charm and staff of the hotel.

title: Best Location and Price
text: I flew into NY strictly to see the Holbein Exhibit at the Morgan and catch a play. I found the Draper through Priceline and it had the lowest price in the area for a nice hotel. The photo of the room looked clean and simply decorated. It was perfect! Everything was perfect. I checked in late at night and was greeted by Hafeez’s smiling face welcoming me. There’s nothing worse than checking into a hotel and feeling like you’re inconveniencing the staff. Everything I wanted to see was so close so if you’re limited in your walking ability then this is a great place to make as your home base. I can’t say enough good things about the hotel. The bed was soft, but firm. The bathroom is beautiful and the water pressure is spot on. The pump gels and lotion provided smelled divine. I will be back!

title: Great time!
text: My husband and I had a great time at the Draper. The bed was very comfortable, and it was in a central location! We especially loved Max at the front desk who hooked it up and let us check in super early while it was pouring rain outside- total life saver!

title: Great Place!
text: The Draper is conveniently located, clean, and affordable. We found great restaurants in the neighborhood and were able to walk to many sites, walk to Penn Station, and walk to the subway. The staff were helpful and friendly- I would stay here again.

title: Pathile Patel 10000%
text: Relly good service , nice people  , i really liked Pathile Patel in the reception , 1000%%% recommended , really clean , nive view , water with ice at the reception , i really liked my stay and i will be back for sureeeeee

title: City view & Comfy
text: We arrived yesterday 5/8, Max was super friendly and welcoming, he saw how tired we were from traveling and took great care of us! Enjoying my stay so far, meant to post this yesterday but was so exhausted and knocked right out in the comfy bed. We also have a pretty cool view

title: Excellent stay, lovely room, great location
text:
Our 2-night stay here was excellent. Our room was lovely, perfectly clean, and aesthetically pleasing, with a very comfortable king bed and clean bathroom - the rooms aren't super spacious, but it's clear that great care is taken to make them pleasant and comfortable for guests regardless - so no complaints. The whole hotel - hallways, elevators, etc - was very well-maintained and clean and pleasant. You really can't ask for better, given the very reasonable price plus the Manhattan location.

The hotel staff is incredibly friendly and accommodating as well - five-star service. Shoutout to Max at the front desk, who checked us in and provided excellent, friendly service - we booked a room online directly through the hotel's website  and came early just to drop off our luggage, about three hours before check-in time, and he offered us an early check-in without us even having to ask, and waived the early check-in fee. Fast and easy check-out as well. I also appreciated that on the morning of our check-in, we received a text from hotel staff that allowed us to ask questions/clarify any details via text as well. 

The hotel's location is also perfect for visiting Manhattan, with a lot of standard NYC tourist attractions and great restaurants within easy walking distance, and metro stations nearby - Bryant Park is very nearby, and Times Square, Broadway theatres, the Empire State Building, etc. are all walkable as well. Despite being conveniently close to all the fun stuff, it was quiet at night for sleeping, and I also didn't feel unsafe walking alone (as a young woman) back to the hotel later at night either. 

Basically: everything was great! Definitely planning on staying here when I come back to NYC.

title: Fantastic Service, lovely hotel!
text: We had a wonderful stay at The Draper! The staff was exceptional and went over and above to make sure our stay was great. They were always smiling and friendly, and they made our 4 year old feel special by greeting her and asking her about her day each time we came back from exploring the city. Max especially was so helpful and kind. The rooms have less space for clothes than we’d anticipated, but everything else was so clean and nice that we still would stay here again in a heartbeat. The location was also very convenient, within walking distance of Times Square, the broadway theaters, and a very short walk to a metro station.

title: Great location, amazing staff, beautiful rooms!
text: This was a great location, and the staff was super friendly everything we needed they made sure we had! The hotel is very beautifully decorated. As most rooms in Manhattan they were small but they did have a king size bed in there room which was hard for me to find. Would definitely recommend this hotel!

title: Espectacular
text:
Superó nuestras expectativas, igual a las fotos, todo limpio y ordenado el personal súper atento, Max el mejor se preocupa por tus necesidades siempre va un paso más a delante por complacer tus requerimientos.
Todo positivo

title: Great check in and room
text: Max did a nice job getting us in our room quickly (and early) and was very friendly. We are happy with the room and the cleanliness of the hotel. The location is not far from restaurants and other hotels.

title: Excelente
text: Recomiendo 100% este hotel queda cerca de todo en el ámbito turístico y de negocios,  las habitaciones son súper acogedoras y cómodas pero lo mejor de todo es la atención, en la recepción hay un chico de nombre MAX que te hace sentir como si llegaras a casa bastante educado y muy amable pendiente de los detalles y ofrece un excelente servicio, cuando regrese a NYC me volveré a hospedar aquí.

title: Draper service is on point! MAX FOR THE WIN.
text: We arrived early, very early. It was raining. We were fully prepared to drop off our bags and wander the city while we waited until check in time. Max at the front desk went over and above getting us into a room right when we arrived. He happened to have one avaliable and said it's raining let's get you into your room now. It's like he read our minds and knew what we needed. He made the start of our trip kick off right. The room is cozy with the most comfortable bed and has cool sleek style. Such a great find. So happy to be here.

title: the Draper is excellent and Max totally rocks
text:
I cant recommend the Draper hotel enough. The location is excellent, the accommodations are elegant and pristine. We were greeted with some of the greatest service experienced. 

Max was professionalism itself and totally elevated our stay right out of the gate.

title: Wonderul  Hotel
text: The Draper was the perfect hotel for our quick trip to NYC. The location, the staff and the rooms were incredible. The icing on the hotel was Max at the front.
