He was so helpful and always had a smile on his face. We always looked forward to seeing him as we came and went. We look forward to our next stay!!

title: Outstanding and affordable on Fifth avenue.
text:
It’s not easy to find a well equipped hotel within a affordable (relatively) budget in Manhattan. The Draper met our expectations perfectly, beautiful room and flexible space to arrange our luggage. 

Also shout out to Max, who made our trip way more easier and enjoyable for his exceptional service hospitality. We will definitely come back.

title: Wonderful experience ! Great Stay !
text: The hotel is just amazing! Beautifully constructed. The location is on 37th which is like the best to visit manhattan. Max at the front desk was really humble and was fast with the services he provided! Also guided us through some good places nearby which were worth a visit! Definitely coming back!!!!

title: Great time!!
text: Best hotel! View was great and the service was better!! Thanks Max! Definitely going to come back. My mother and I wanted a hotel that was near everything and boy did the Draper deliver. I am going to recommend this hotel to everyone!

title: Beautiful hotel Flawless Service
text: Max was delightful and so helpful with getting me checked in when I arrived. After walking into the room I was so pleased to find a gorgeous little space. The bathroom is absolutely incredible and comes with shampoo and conditioner which is very helpful. I look forward to returning!

title: Good experience
text:
The hotel is excellent. The location is great and the service in the hotel was good. 

The staff were friendly and helpful. I would definitely visit again.

Thanks for Max my check out experience was great.

title: Nyc trip
text: Comfortable, new room. Friendly and helpful staff. I highly recommend this hotel, as it is affordable and conveniently located in midtown nyc! Only a  10 minute walk to Grand Central and 20 minute walk to Broadway shows.

title: Confortevole
text:
Personale accogliente, locali molto puliti, camera splendida con una bella vista. Decisamente consigliato per un breve viaggio. Ci ritornerò assolutamente. 
Fate attenzione a dove prenotate, spesso si trova online con prezzi molto differenti

title: Hôtel bien situé
text: Hôtel très bien situé, à proximité du métro et des rue principales de New York. Nous avons été bien reçu par l’équipe hôtelière. Literie très confortable répondant à notre attente. Les deux seuls bémols sont la taille de la chambre un peu petite et le fait qu’il faut demander pour que le ménage soit fait ( mesure sanitaire). Nous avons pu laisser nos bagages le jour de notre départ à l’hôtel sans supplément afin de pouvoir profiter avant le transfert vers l’aéroport.

title: Super Aufenthalt
text:
Waren für eine Nacht in diesem Hotel ! Suuuuper ! 
Sehr gutes Preis Leistungs Verhältnis. Sehr zentral gelegen . Hilfsbereite und freundliche Hotelangestellte. 
Sauberes Zimmer , Badezimmer tip top . 
Lieder nicht sehr viele Ablagemöglichkeit. 
Waren schon oft in New York und dies ware eines der besseren Hotels zu einem guten Preis . 
Kommen gerne wieder .

title: Super clean and great staff
text: Perfect for solo trips or stays in the city. It’s so hard trying to find a hotel in Manhattan that is super clean, great staff, and doesn’t cost a million dollar a night. The only one downfall is that the rooms are super small. Just enough room for the bed to fit in, and then space for one person to walk around. But the bathroom was pretty immaculate, as well as the room, and it had pretty much anything you’d need (fridge for you — not a minibar but actual fridge), small desk, coffee maker if you like that kinda thing, and comfy bed. There’s a nice business center that doesn’t feel “office-y” and a cafe (that wasn’t open when I was there). It’s a new hotel and you can kinda tell from the state of the rooms (really nice) so I’d take advantage of this hotel sooner than later. Also, I communicated with the hotel reception staff via text the entire time and it was so easy to get requests sent and completed. Loved that.

title: Excellent quality down to the smallest details
text: My stay at the Draper was superb. Facilities were clean and well maintained and the staff was warm and pleasant to be around. I will stay here again and will certainly recommend this to my friends. Thank you!

title: Outstanding hotel right in the heart of midtown
text: I stayed at the Draper hotel in April 2022. I had an absolutely amazing stay. It's clear that it's a new hotel and everything is nice and well-furnished. The rooms are decent-sized for Manhattan. The beds and sheets are extremely comfortable, the showers and water pressure are just great. The business area and the back I found to be a great place to get some work done from with good wifi speed. The staff is always friendly and always greeting us. Mustafah, one of the managers, was awesome to get to know a bit as he really cares about the guests' experience. The location of the hotel was excellent. Right in the heart of midtown, really easy to get everywhere, so close to so many different subway stops. Great great location to stay. The hotel had big windows and so especially for midtown, you'll get great sunlight and decent views. The outdoor patio area is also nice. It's a really outstanding place to stay whenever I'm in New York. When I need to stay at midtown, I will definietely go back and stay at the Draper hotel.

title: Great stay!!
text: My daughter and I stayed at The Draper for 5 nights. Location was great!  Walking distance to many restaurants and places of interest.  Subway nearby as well, which was convenient. Hotel staff were friendly and very helpful. Room was slightly small, but that is expected in NYC. We don’t go to stay in the room, so it wasn’t an issue for us. Clean, modern, updated and quiet. Could use a little extra storage space, but that did not hinder our stay. Would definitely recommend The Draper for your next stay in the Big Apple. Don’t forget to check out Paris Baguette at the corner, for breakfast, dessert or both, you won’t regret it. Quickly became a favorite spot!

title: Great stay in a great location of New York!
text:
Our stay in this Draper hotel was amazing. From the reception staff to our very clean and extremely comfortable bed and fantastic shower. The location was great as we were literally around the corner from Empire State Building and Macy’s. 

Plus we loved the decor

title: The hotel is very nice and it’s in a convenient location.  Rooms are small but adequate.  Beds and pillows are comfy.
text: Great location.  Staff was kind, courteous, and helpful.  Fresh water near front desk.  Nice community room and a small outdoor space.  I would stay again.  No food on the premises but plenty of restaurants nearby.  We walked to most of our destinations.

title: Will stay again
text: This hotel is at a great location, safe, close to attractions and with good restaurant options. They have a beautiful business center and a yard. The staff are friendly. It was very nice to get good rest and support for it work trip.

title: very nice hotel
text:
the room is good looking, with a view right in front of the empire state building 
the location is ideal 
the bed is so comfortable 
staff is welcoming
shower is nice 
you can walk to many places close by and take subway

title: Great hotel and good location!
text: Max was super helpful from the very moment I walked into the hotel and helped me checked in. The Hotel is brand new and the location is great. I would recommend this place for everyone that wants to stay centric without paying a ridiculous amount of money in Manhattan.

title: A week at The Draper!
text: We just returned from a weeks visit to NYC. We had such a great time! We stayed at The Draper Hotel. The hotel was very clean and modern. It’s in a great location. Max at the front desk was super helpful! I was iffy about taking the subway. He assured us it was safe and the cheapest way to get around. He even wrote out directions for us to get to/from where we wanted to go.

title: Great hotel
text:
The Draper was clean and modern. It’s in a great location, within easy walking distance to the Empire State Building, restaurants and more. The rooms are small but make nice use of vertical space. As a family of four, we could have used hooks on the back of the bathroom door to hang more than one towel. Staff are friendly accommodating. Max spent several minutes in easy conversation with our kids and they enjoyed being “seen”. 
Thanks for a great stay!

title: Charming
text: The Draper was the most charming hotel right in the heart of midtown. The room is small but comfortable. Immaculately clean. Has everything you need- coffee maker, shampoo/conditioner, hair dryer - the bed was heavenly!  Front desk staff is very helpful. Will absolutely return!

title: AWESOME!!!
text:
Clean, and Great location!!!!!!!!
Great location at 37th between 5th and 6th. The hotel is immaculate.
The room is perfect for two people and has everything you need to be happy. We chose a room with a view and it was spectacular. The employees are very attentive, tremendous people. The bathroom was updated with a beautiful shower. The most important for me is that,  it's clean,  you have water and snack vending machines and a refrigerator in the room. We will be back soon. .

title: Incredible beautiful City view
text: The Draper had an incredible city view the front desk are very welcoming and friendly the rooms are clean and smell good .The staff are helpful and the service was a top notch I highly recommend for anyone who wish to have a good time with a nice view

title: Had a great stay!
text: The service was excellent. We checked in with no delay at all. Fast, efficient, and friendly.  The elevator was fast too! The rooms were more spacious and modern than I anticipated. Very artsy and comfortable. We loved it so much we came back a couple of days later as we were touring around DC and NYC. Great location - central to everything. This will be our go to hotel when visiting NYC.

title: A night in the city
text: The Draper, Ascend Hotel Collection, is a cute boutique hotel without any added thrills. The lobby is welcoming and so are the staff. The hallways are tight but the rooms are more spacious and clean than expected. The location of the hotel was perfect and centrally located to midtown. I would recommend this hotel for a short stay in the city, especially if going to a show on Broadway.

title: quite nice and a very good value
text: Clean, quiet, helpful staff and an excellent location. And a very good value for Manhatten. The rooms are small, but the big king bed was very comfortable. Bathroom and shower were a good size and nice. no closet, but a space to hand cloths and plenty of hooks on the wall.

title: Needed a break
text:
Needed to focus on an upcoming important business mtg. My place was packed with family visiting for the holiday…Soooooo Booked The Draper at the last minute….honestly The Draper was not my first choice.  My first choice was booked and they recommended another member of Ascend Hotel Collection which was nearby….I was happy that they did.. 
checking in was smooth…it was nice that they noticed that it was my first stay at the property..(not that they threw me any extras!😇 but with COVID and all the cutbacks I wasn’t expecting anything…room was comfortable quiet and just what I needed…there is one aspect of my short stay that I have to share…the Hotel TV offered connection to Google to mirror my vids,etc ….not one person at the hotel knew how to make the connection work…I gave up after an hour on the phone…yes the phone, with Google support

title: It’s Delightful.
text: The Receptionist Manish was very welcoming and friendly, I have some problems with the room and he able to try his best to fix the problems for me. the place is well Decorated Very modern and fashionable, I love the Perfume smell of the hotel, most Importantly it’s very clean, and last the bed is Firm and soft enough on the top, it has perfect Support for the body, I had very good sleep. The only thing missing is the gym, but Overall I had a pleasant stay, I would recommend it to everyone.

title: Very good & friendly service
text: Max at the front desk was very helpful.the staff is very good. The service is very good.I have gone there with my business colleagues for a meeting we were there for about 6 hours they were very good rooms, everything was perfect

title: Great location and great service
text: The location of the hotel was just far enough from Time Square to be affordable but close enough to make visiting manageable. Check in was easy and the room was clean. The room is very very small especially for 2 people and their luggage. There are some hooks on the wall to hang things and drawers under the bed. There’s a mini fridge (ours didn’t work but it wasn’t a big deal to us) and a coffee maker. There’s also a small desk next to the bed with a chair that we used to hold things. Make sure to keep the floor area completely clear or walking around the room could be difficult. The blinds in the room are amazing and make you believe 10am is 7am as no light leaks through. The only change I would make is the lighting. The light switch by the door controls all lights so if you want to watch tv in the bed you have to turn the lights off before you lay down or sleep with the lights on.

title: Spring Break Getaway in NYC
text: This was our second stay at The Draper.  The location is super convenient to Penn Station, Macy's, Herald Square, Bryant Park, Grand Central Station, Murray Hill, and Times Square. Every time we walked into the lobby we received a friendly greeting from the hotel staff.  Our room was very clean, and the bed was really comfortable.  The rooms are small, typical for NYC, but I prefer to think of them as cozy rather than cramped.  The fact that there are only 8 rooms per floor gives that cozy feeling as well.  No cafe yet in the lobby, but there's a Dunkin Donuts on the same block, as we as a Parisian bakery and a Chick Fil A on the corners of 6th Ave.  The Draper is a hidden treasure of a hotel and we'll be back!

title: Girls visit
text: We had an amazing time at The draper hotel with an impeccable view of the city. Spacial thanks to Max ! Who made our stay more comfortable and happening. We really liked the hotel and the ambience is truly amazing. Location wise it’s perfect!

title: Family trip
text: One of the best hotels in the heart of Manhattan city. The hotel was neat and clean ...the staff was very understanding and helpful in nature especially the receptionist Mr Max , helped and guided us throughout the trip. Hopefully will come back again

title: No complaints
text: Great location. Bryant park is a couple blocks away with cool local vibe on front of the NYC public library, then keep walking to grand central station, radio city music hall, Rockefeller center etc, just prepare for Very small room, no hair dryer, or closet, but quiet and clean with big super comfy bed. Max at front desk was fantastic!

title: Very Clean, Convenient Location, Comfy Room!
text:
I went to NYC for a few days and stayed at the Draper. It is in such a convenient spot in Manhattan. You can walk to a broadway show, a restaurant any many attractions. It is also close to metro stops to get uptown. We really liked the hotel. 

It was tastefully decorated and had a mid century modern feel. It was SUPER clean! The room was a good size, big enough for 2 people. There is a large space in front of the bed if you wanted to do a hotel room work out. The bathroom was nice too and the shower had very nice water pressure. 

We had a room with a city view and it was awesome to open up the windows in the morning and at night. The king size bed was very comfortable and I slept peacefully each night I stayed. The hotel was also quiet, despite having an elevator close to our room.

title: Truly overwhelming ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
text: My First time visit to New York city, the hotel is very clean and the rooms are well maintained with an impeccable view from the rooms. The services were really immediate and the front desk agent Mr. Max was really friendly. Location was really good, In the heart of manhattan city this hotel is a gem.

title: Family trip
text: Heads up to the location and the rooms are pretty beautiful inside out. The staff is really friendly especially Max at the front desk. Helped us and guided through everything and recommended places which were worth having experiences with. Going to come back soon!!

title: GREAT HOTEL
text: This was such a great stay. The staff was SO friendly, and the hotel was super clean and following all COVID guidelines. Max, was the front desk staff and was wonderful. He attended all of our needs and was so friendly. He was so great at costumer service. I will definitely be recommending this hotel to my family and friends.

title: Spending a night in NYC
text: Overall a good hotel but not worth the money. The positives are location, comfortable beds, clean and pretty quiet. Negatives are no space. Had a king size bed and no where to put carry on suitcase, not even room for a luggage stand. Bathroom had no hooks to hang a towel though easy enough to put one on back of the bathroom door. No space for toiletries. Here too there is space enough to mount a small 3 shelf shadow box on the bathroom wall.

title: Amazing experience ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
text:
Had a wonderful time. The ambiance, The atmosphere everything was fantastic. 
Max at the front desk was extremely helpful and went an extra mile to make sure we were comfortable.  
Thanks Max, this is for you ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ ……………………………………………………………..

title: Best vacation ever
text:
Max
has best location in manhattan with clean rooms and max at the front desk was really helpful. Guided with the best places and subway. The hotel has really good staff. The staff is really awesome most humble ones

title: A gem of a hotel if you don’t mind small.
text: This is a gem of a hotel. It’s very small but super cute. Being relatively new, it it welcoming, clean and bright.  We found the front desk staff to be helpful and friendly. We had a double on the 10th floor. The room was clean and very stylish.  Because it’s a tight space they got clever with wall hooks and a hanging rack for clothes, but there is no dresser or closet. But there is a drawer under each bed and a convenient place to slide your suitcase under the bed.  The beds were extremely comfortable. The room was quiet (my #1 issue when staying in NYC). The HVAC is quiet and controlled in the room so we were always comfortable.  Bathroom is small with very little surface area but we made due (I was there with my teen who has FIVE cosmetic and toiletry bags!). The hotel has a very nice business center which is like a big working lounge, with an outdoor courtyard too, very nice for working remotely.  The location was perfect for us as we were at an event just around the corner.  The price was excellent, with a AAA discount we paid less then $700 for three nights.  We would stay here again for sure.

title: Business
text:
My stay at Draper was amazing!this is my second time here and i loved it, location wise and everything!the staff is very kind as well, especially Max!
Cannot wait for The Pleat cafe and bar to open!Cannot wait to comeback again and again!!!

title: great stay!
text: front desk staff very friendly. we were able to check in a little early. room request was honored. hotel is clean and modern. beds were comfy. great location. excellent value. i would highly recommend!

title: Perfektes Hotel mitten in der Stadt
text:
Das ideale Hotel für einen Citytrip. Perfekt gelegen, wir konnten alles super zu Fuß erreichen, sei es das Empire State Building (direkt um die Ecke) als auch Times Square (toll wenn man nach einem Broadway Musical direkt zu Fuß nach Hause laufen kann...) oder zum Shoppen an der Fifth Avenue...wir würden auf jeden Fall wieder hier buchen!
Die Zimmer sind sehr schick und individuell, das Bett riesig und bequem, Dusche super! Besonderen Dank an Max, der uns einen herzlichen Empfang beschwert hat! Auch das restliche Team war sehr freundlich und zuvorkommen!

title: Good food, fun shopping, lovely hotel
text: The hotel is lovely, fresh and clean. Our room was ready so we were allowed to check in a little early which is always a bonus. The desk clerk, Max, was the best. Very friendly and helpful and made our trip that much more enjoyable. We stayed in the room with 2 beds and were quite comfortable. Just a friend and I for the stay and the room was great for 2 adults. Beautiful new bathroom! I would recommend the Draper and will most definitely stay here on my next trip.

title: Great Hotel
text: As an former Manhattan resident, this is now my go to hotel.  The location is fantastic, the staff is great & the hotel is really well done- everything is new.  This was my 5th stay & it was perfect.  I am coming back in 2 weeks.    Great restaurants nearby and easy to get to midtown, downtown & to the airports (fast to JFK or Newark). I 100% recommend the Darper

title: Fantastic stay
text:
I’d rate The Draper a 4.5 out of 5.  I’m rounding up because we really enjoyed the hotel overall.
Pros: 
-fantastic staff, helpful and personable
-fresh water in lobby
-super comfy bed and pillows 
-storage drawers under bed and room to store suitcases under bed
-water gets hot quickly and stays hot
-great location in midtown 
-refrigerator in room
Cons:
-no full length mirror in room
-could use an extra hook in bathroom

title: Weekend trip
text: Great location. Very clean. No breakfast or rooftop view. Had to clean out the fridge when we got there. The last guests left us their leftovers. Very safe for a girls weekend trip. Close to Times Square, subway and plenty of food options in all directions

title: Recommended
text: We booked at the Draper for a last-minute trip to New York. Check-in was quick and simple, the room we had was clean, and check-out was easy as could be. Our room was on the 21st floor with views of the city and it looked great. The location is within walking distance to Times Square, Herald Square, and Central Park. For the price, the room and stay exceeded our expectations.

title: The Draper NYC
text: I stayed here with my 2 teen daughters & we could not have been happier! The location was perfect! We felt safe walking back to hotel at night. The staff was unbelievably helpful & nice. The room clean & cozy. Our 2 beds each had a convenient luggage storage cut out from bed frame making it easily accessible while saving space. We highly recommend!

title: Excellent Location
text: We really loved how close this hotel was to Time Square, Herald Square, the Theater District, Fifth Avenue... very convenient. It was surrounded by good restaurants and bars, and our room was very clean and comfortable. It was also quiet for the most part, except Friday night when some people in a neighboring room decided to throw a party lasting past 1:00 am. We called the front desk, and it was handled. The room was tiny, but we spent minimal time in there, so it worked well for a weekend getaway.

title: Great value and friendly service
text: I had a group and a big block of rooms, and the whole experience was fantastic. Good value, good location, nice space in the lobby and business center. Max was fantastic and friendly at the front desk

title: New York experience!
text: We came to New York for the experience because we wanted to experience the world of New York together! The Draper made that experience the more special and very comfortable for us! It was an amazing experience and the room was very comfortable and perfect for us! The city view room is worth it with the balcony that also give you a look of the city from your room balcony!! Absolutely beautiful and worth the stay!

title: Excellent hotel, wonderful location, fantastic value.
text: This hotel was great from the start.  Gurleen at front desk was very helpful and friendly at check-in.  Room was nice and well-appointed.  Location of the hotel was convenient.  Hotel sitting area + business center + patio area were all nice too.  Everything always seemed clean / fresh there too.  I'll be back.

title: Great base for seeing the city
text:
Arrived on a late train and a pretty quick walk from Penn Station, and we’re so happy to have an easy check in process. We were headed up to the room in just a couple of minutes. The room was small, next to the elevator and facing the street. It was perfect.  Quiet, (other than loud neighbors leaving in the am), comfortable bed, great shower.  Counter space is nonexistent but so what. The TV had lots of channels and it was big.  

I would say this is my favorite hotel in the city and very well located for exploring. And on our last day Rahman at the front desk, like everyone we dealt with, was personable and kind. A great team has been assembled here.  Thank you for a great few days.

title: Great, convenient hotel with an accomodating staff
text: I have to travel a few times east over the past few months for business and stumbled across this gem of a hotel.  As we all know, around Mid-town, you're either paying top dollars or sleeping in a closet.  This hotel was a fantastic combination of value and comfort.  Gurleen, who attended the front desk every time I stayed was incredibly accommodating and friendly, helping ensure my experience was positive.  I can't say enough positives about the play.  Highly recommended.

title: great location comfortable visit
text:
Nothing bad to say. Prime location, comfortable rooms, Manish also extended us for a late check out. 

Not much in terms of amenities but the room / bathroom were a good size. There is water that you can refill on first floor 24/7. 

Would recommend.

title: Spring Begining!
text: The staff and manager were amazing! Thank you for a comfortable stay with an awesome rate. Perfectly situated between times square and soho and New Jersey is a quick train or bus ride away! See you next time!!

title: AMAZING STAY!!!
text: This hotel is great for your stay in NYC, in the heart of midtown and nice clean rooms for great price! My company has us stay here when we come in for company meetings and it truly is such a wonderful experience

title: Great Hotel
text: Nice decorated, comfortable, and clean. If you like contemporary, you'll love this hotel. Really nice common area with ample space and a business center.  Love the outdoor courtyard too. The location was perfect.  This is my new go-to hotel for biz trips and visits to NYC.

title: Comfortable visit
text: The hotel is in a great location. The staff is accommodating and pleasant. Beds are very comfortable. Our room did not have a dresser so for a short stay it is great. We had a 2 bed room (double) and had just enough space. Heat is great but has to be set at a higher temp to be comfortable. Would have given 5 stars but hotel is still getting to the point of having everything available.

title: Great hotel
text:
We had to book in last minute due to an issue with our Airbnb and the team were so helpful and accommodating.

The room was lovely and very clean. Very well located and comfortable.

Really recommend, especially for the price compared to a lot of other hotels in the area.

title: Hotel novo, mas não quarto pequeno
text:
Excelente localização, mas quarto muito pequeno para mais de uma pessoa.
Quarto não tem guarda roupa e pouco espaço para deixar as malas.
Pontos fortes: localização (faz tudo a pé) e hotel novo, sem carpete, quarto bonito 
Pontos fracos: quarto pequeno demais e acústica péssima, vc escuta as pessoas conversando no quarto do lado

title: Great stop over
text:
We had a 2 night stay and it was amazing! I'd like to particularly mention Hafeez, Umreen and Ayman. They were helpful, polite and always had a smile. Great customer service. Thank you!  
Looking forward to coming back.

title: New, clean and convenient
text: I really enjoyed this hotel. Everything was new and clean. Bed was comfy and location is great. I paid less than $100 total but expect that it will be hard to book again at that price(?). Room is typical small size but space is well planned. Could use a towel rack or another hook for towel in the bathroom. I didn’t like the body lotion but shampoo/conditioner ok.

title: Great hotel!
text: My second time at The Draper. Beautiful and well located hotel. Rooms are small but functional, the baggage holding service is awesome. Bathroom has a problem with the shower doors leaking water everywhere. Very nice hotel!

title: Great Hotel at Great Price
text: The Draper is a really great hotel as long as you keep your expectations in check. The rooms are small--very small--but the bed is very comfortable, the decor stylish, and the environment spotlessly clean. It is a great value for the money, and if you're in town for a weekend of touring or an overnight stay or two, it might be perfect for you. However, longer stays might prove challenging. There's not much room to hang or store clothes, the desktop is the size of a cafeteria tray, and if two of you are staying together, there'll be a lot of choreography involved when moving through the tight spaces.  My biggest complaint - there is no place to hang wet towels after showering (a real issue in these days of decreased housekeeping visits). But will I stay there again and recommend it to others seeking an inexpensive, safe, comfortable place to stay in NYC? Absolutely!

title: The Draper Ascend Hotel Collection
text: Mister Hafeez was very professional, kind and knowledgeable , beautiful hotel front desk employees very professional , kind , the room was beautiful very clean and the bathrooms was clean and organized

title: Impressed
text: We experienced the “day after the winter storm” in NYC (1/30/22). Our room temp registered 42 degrees on the thermostat when we checked in. Not good. We selected “heat” and set it at 70, left to go eat and explore, with hopes of coming back to a warmer room. It didn’t happen. We came back later in the evening to the chilly room, called front desk, they sent maintenance. It was determined that the thermostat was broken, unrepairable. Front desk moved us quickly to another room, with heat! A bit of an inconvenience, however I must say, thank you to the staff for the attention, quick responsiveness, accommodation and overall amazing courteous professionalism! This will now be our destination for our upcoming stays in NYC!! Thank you!!

title: Mother /daughter  trip to Garment district
text:
Beautiful new hotel, better than expected. Very comfy  beds, heating, upscale  towels and upscale toiletries. Good storage, and room size with 2 doubles is fine for 2 people, however, would be pretty cramped for more than 2. 

Staff was gracious, welcoming and accommodating. The gentleman (Ahmen?)  who helped us access our Netflix arrived to the room within 2 minutes ! 

This will be our hotel in NYC from now on!

title: A Little Weekend R&R
text: Wanted to get out of the house and away for a little while. We both had to work so didn’t want to go too far from the city and this was perfect hideout in the heart of Manhattan. Walking distance to most transportation and attractions. I love that there were no carpets in the room and it was very modern. Service was great. Staff was very friendly and always greeted us. The linens were very clean and I had no problems getting more.  Both check in and out was fast and easy. I also appreciated the text messages. It was all the little details that made this a pleasant visit  I was a little disappointed that there was  no microwave in the room and I had to go to the lower level for one. The fridge wasn’t plugged in so I had to wait for it to cool. I couldn’t get a dial tone from the phone in the room so I used my cell to call the front desk. All minor things that didn’t really bother me too much.  All in all, I’m going to bookmark this hotel for a return visit.

title: Little gem of a place!
text: The front staff was wonderful! The first night we were there, we had broadway tickets but didn’t realize until the very last minute that they needed to be printed out, they were so sweet and when they saw how I was trying to rush and was stressing a little, they told me to just email the tickets to them and they printed them right away so we would be late! The room was really nice and clean and the beds were so comfortable. The location rocks. Amazing value for such a great place! Thank you for making my trip even better.

title: A 2 star hotel that wants to stay that way
text:
Stayed for a week , had high expectations as the place is only new and that I work in a hotel myself.

Arrived and was given our room was nice and big lovely city view after being there for about 20 minutes we realised there was alot of noise coming from the vent in the room , rang and asked was there any way to close it tighter and maintenance came up , he said there was nothing he could do so we moved rooms. 

This room was alot smaller! I had booked a deluxe king with a city view ,which is what the first room was and then we were downgraded.

There was hairs on the bed linen and after asking for it to be changed there was still more hairs , asked for new linen to be sent up , checked them and more hairs, after shacking the linen and making the bed our selfs it was OK. Definitely need a new linen company.

Hygiene standards was not good at all,housekeeping vacuuming the room would actually be a big plus as the floor was not clean at all. I would say they spend max 20 minutes cleaning the room.

What I've taken away from staying here that if you are booking and the housekeeping problems are solved is that don't pay for a city view as one side you have the city and the other side you have a view of them Empire state building. This is a LOUD hotel the elevator doesn't stop dingING and you can hear people in their rooms and alot of creaking from your own room.

Staff aren't too involved at all didn't seem bothered by the bedding complaints.

title: Great find!
text:
Great location at 37th between 5th and 6th. It’s just far enough out of the fray to be a bit quieter without being too far from tourist spots. The hotel is immaculate. The rooms, as previously noted in other reviews, are very small. I’d 100% agree that it’s a great crash pad but a not so great honeymoon choice. The room was modern and clean. The bed took up most of the room and boy was it comfortable. The bathroom was updated with a beautiful shower. 

One of the perks is that you can text the front desk for help. I had an awful headache at 5:30 in the morning and did not have meds. I texted for help and got the location of the nearest CVS locations. I also asked for breakfast recommendations and they came through with a great suggestion (Paris Baguette- 37th and 6th). 

The front desk personnel are nothing short of fantastic. I’d 100% stay here again without hesitation.

title: Great choice for a NYC visit!
text: Very clean, fresh, nicely decorated rooms. Small (like most NYC rooms) but well layed out for functionality. Bathroom clean and modern with good shower pressure. Paid for a city View room and we were in 1902 with a nice view of the Chrysler building. Great location, close to grand Central, times Square...... My only complaints are small. Bar/snack area is still not open post COVID, and on the website it said robes were provided but I was told that's only in suites. Also the bathroom plug didn't work but there were plenty of other plugs in room. All in all really enjoyed our stay here and would stay at the Draper again. Beds were very comfortable and it was a surprisingly quiet hotel. Never heard other guests or honking horns below.

title: Tiny Luxury
text: The most luxurious tiniest room with an awesome king size bed.  Modern gorgeous bathroom.  The window shade was the only annoyance as it could not be partially closed as it was one big pull down so it was hard to let light in.  Also the room view on their website is deceiving.

title: Excellent NYC Hotel
text:
Had a really enjoyable stay at the Draper. Staff were really friendly and checking was easy & quick.

The room was clean and comfortable. Beds were very comfy and there were the kind of things you expect like a coffee machine.

My only gripe is the shower room, which was modern but missed a couple of basic towel rails, which was more just frustrating than anything.

Overall a very good value for money hotel to stay in, great location and if you can get a midweek price, you won’t have much to complain about at all. Would definitely like to visit again in the future.

title: Midtown Manhattan Quiet
text: I spent a night at the Draper, a bright new hotel just off Fifth Avenue, in Manhattan's garment district. I was welcomed at the desk and sent to my room. The room was small and very clean, dominated by a huge smart TV. WiFi was free. The hotel is so new that its bar/restaurant have not yet opened; I explored, and found the location of the future restaurant in an interior courtyard. There is a huge variety of restaurants at all price levels in the immediate area. What impressed me most was that, in spite of the midtown Manhattan location, my room was quiet! Street noise barely penetrated. In the morning...in-room coffee and a speedy, friendly checkout. Highly recommended!

title: Incredible stay
text:
I usually don’t leave reviews but this hotel deserves one the staff was nice the hotel is Luxury Definitely worth the price the view of the Empire State building was amazing walking distance to Times Square close to the train stations  a lot of restaurants to choose from what more can you ask for ? 

I definitely recommend

title: Awesome stay!
text: Had an awesome stay at The Draper. Room was clean, staff was friendly, bed was comfortable and good location. I've actually stayed in much smaller rooms while visiting Boston, this one was bigger. 100% will come back here next time I visit.

title: Draper
text: This hotel is a great value in a great location! Stayed here for 5 nights and loved it. Great rooms, comfy bed, and nice heater in the bathroom. So many great things within walking distance of the hotel. Complimentary luggage storage was awesome as we got in super early on our flight. Only negative was there are no amenities. There is a closed down cafe and the outdoor patio that was advertised was taped shut and we weren’t allowed out there. So you’re just paying for the room, nothing more nothing less. Overall still a great deal and nice stay.

title: Short business trip
text:
My room (1506) was very cozy. I worked from the room all day and went out in the evening. The location is excellent! Plenty of places to eat and drink and explore. Port Authority, Bryant Park and Macys are all near-by. The room had a refrigerator and a cute little desk to work from. 
My only issue is staff needs to communicate better. One day the delivery person was able to come upstairs to deliver my food, the second day the person was not. One person told me I can check out by 12pm on the first day, the second day I received a call why I did not check out yet at 11:53am. 
I recommend this hotel and I look forward to coming back but the staff really should all be on the same page.

title: Great Hotel!
text: This is an excellent hotel. The location, employees, everything was just perfect. The bed super comfortable, the room very modern. I highly recommend staying in this hotel because of how affordable and convenient it is. It’s just a couple of blocks away from Macy’s in all other shopping venues.

title: Lovely hotel and staff
text: We just stayed at The Draper for a weekend getaway and it was great all the way around. Staff was all attentive, rooms were clean and beautifully decorated.  Location was ideal to lots of cute bars and pubs.

title: Impressed.  The Draper is a Gem in NYC!
text: Impressed by Draper!  I love this hotel in New York City.  I was looking for a hotel within walking distance to Port Authority, Penn Station, and Grand Central.  The hotel is situated in what I can say is in the center of all the action.  You have most of NYC within walking distance.  The hotel rooms were FABULOUS!  I was impressed by the decor and the attention to detail on the bedroom, bathroom amenities, and even the fridge/closet combo.  The staff at the front desk were always energetic and willing to help out with any requests.  I asked for a high-floor room and received one with a fantastic view.  I am simply impressed with this gem in NYC and will stay here again.  Thank you Draper Hotel!

title: Rooms were not clean but staff was responsive to requests
text:
The first room I stayed in was not clean. There were stray hairs in several places, including the bathroom and the bed. I also found a crusty residue on the sheets, which looked like some kind of food stain.

I called down to complain and switch rooms. To the hotel's credit, they agreed and they found another room... where yet again stray hairs were found. I called down again to complain. They quickly responded with a supervisor and housekeeping, who swapped out all the sheets for a new set.

Note to the housekeeping, don't assume the guests don't know Spanish if you're going to talk trash about us.

All that said, good location though.

title: Mrs
text: I came to visit NYC our stay was great, thank you to Gurleen from front desk best customer service in the Hotel, she's the best. Thank you for everything! Everything else was good room was very clean and all amenities in place, beds bathroom all good...

title: Great staff
text: With constant flight changes and change of plans the staff was extremely helpful with the check in process. Huge thanks to Gurleen, she was the one that checked me in that morning! Great room, super clean

title: Great little hotel in the heart of it all
text: Never heard of this place before. Read the reviews, saw the pictures, and the rates and figured I'd give it a shot. I can not state just how much I enjoyed my stay. Clean, large rooms. Chromecast to the TV, blast some music and do some pregaming. 5 minutes away from the subway. Go wherever you want to go! You're literally in the heart of it all. 15 minutes away from Times Square. 5 minutes away from the Empire State building. And the price! Sweet sweet deal. 10/10 recommend to everyone and definitely will be back

title: Comfy bed, grand view, close to everything
text: The bed was so comfy, the view was grand and they have ice and cold water available. The staff was super friendly and texted me a couple times per day to see if I needed anything - and responded when I did! I will stay here again when I visit. It was only an 8 min walk from Penn Station.

title: Great Hotel
text: The hotel was very well decorated, staff was very friendly, and the room was clean. The hotel is also has a pretty nice location - close walk to major sites in NYC. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Excelente
text:
O hotel era muito bom, super bem localizado, atendimento muito bom na recepção, tudo muito limpo e organizado.
O quarto era bem pequeno, para um casal com 4 malas fica bem apertado, o banheiro ao contrario era bem espaçoso, com ótimos produtos de banho.

title: Great hotel in NYC
text:
We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and we think we were very lucky.
Great service at the reception
Great bed
Great shower
Great view
Great location
Great value for money
We'll be back again for sure

title: The first week of 2022
text: Stayed for a week while son was doing a course in the city. awesome location, great front desk service, tons of affordable and gourmet options, very convenient to the subway lines at 34th st. East stroll or subway to all the major spots

title: Great location and service
text: Wonderful!   15 min walk to Times Square and 15 to the famous shops on 5th avenue and Proposal to my now fiancée at Tiffany’s.   Rooms were very small but extremely well appointed. I worked for 4 Seasons for 7 years and although this was a limited service property, they were 100% with all of the important items such as cleanliness, friendliness and advertised services.  And also, I have been in the hotel industry for 30 years and I have never seen faster elevators.  10 out of 10… I’d stay there again!

title: Classy, clean, great for quick vacation visits.
text:
Came to town for a five night business trip. Hotel was clean and well-kept. Rooms are small, so adjust your expectations. They were kind enough to accommodate my need for quiet (work calls) and gave me a new room. 

Honestly? Not a great hotel for business trips. The works spaces are tiny and the walls are very thin, but it’s perfect for a vacation visit to NY at an affordable price. Centrally located, with very polite and attentive staff. Can’t ask for much more than that!

title: The best
text: This hotel is amazing, super clean and nice, best location in Manhattan near to everything. I am really happy and we will for sure staying again. The hotel is near to Times Square and many of the train stations

title: Great new hotel
text: We stayed for two days and this hotel was perfect.  The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet.  Ou king room was small but well appointed.  My teenagers shared a double that was much bigger.  I hope to return.

title: Great one-night stay
text: Really great one-night stay. Our room was clean and modern and the bathroom was also beautifully updated. It’s a narrow hotel and there were only 8 rooms on our floor (maybe the same on other floors?) so it was quiet, aside from street noise, which was surprisingly calm this close to Times Square. Check in was a breeze.

title: Best deal in NYC!
text: Great stay at the Draper, nice staff! They held our bags both pre and post checkout and let us check in early. Much needed after a red eye. Location is awesome too, easy walk to Herald and Time Square, Bryant Park, Broadway Shows, Shopping and the subway. We will be back!

title: What a great find!!
text: This is a lovely boutique hotel in the Garment District. We stayed here using points + cash with Choice Hotels. Our room was very comfortable and clean. It looked out on the Empire State Building- 20th floor. The linens are all very nice too. Not a lot of room around the bed, no real closet, but plenty of space to hang up stuff. It was just great and a stroke of luck to find it. Desk staff was very efficient. I can’t wait to stay here again.

title: Draper Ascent Hotel Excellent Location
text: We had a great anniversary trip to NYC, seeing the van Gogh Exhibit and the Temptations Ain't Too Proud. We walked to the hotel from Gand Central, and from the Hotel to Bryant Park, Sardis for dinner, and to the show on 45th Street. The hotel staff were friendly and the room was clean with all the amenities you would expect. I would stay here again.

title: Great Boutique Hotel
text:
Girls trip visiting New York City with my daughter. We enjoyed the Draper very much. We arrived on an early flight and our room was available so we were able to unpack and get on with our day. As with all NYC hotels the room was small but adequate.  There was no closet but there was a small rod with hangers over the mini fridge and hooks for coats, scarves and purses to hang on. 
There was a full size desk with a mirror which we used as a vanity to dry our hair and do make up. We really appreciated the 4 outlets on the desk so I could have my phone laptop and watch all charging on one side of the bed  while she had more plugs on her side for her electronics. The bed was very comfortable and a true King not a smaller “New York king” many hotels try to pass off. The bathroom was spotless and seemed to be newly re-tiled. They did not have daily maid service which I prefer during this Covid era. I don’t want anyone in the room breathing on my things and I was able to get fresh towels everyday. The front desk staff were so helpful directing us to different restaurants and helping with transportation. I loved the location near Times Square and  Bryant Park which I fell in love with on this trip. We had a late flight and they held our luggage for us until our flight. 
I would recommend the Draper to anyone who loves boutique hotels this is the finest one we have stayed in.

title: Not 5-Stars, But Very Good
text: This is a 3-star hotel. They will tell you that if you call (contrary to places on the internet that says 5-stars in some places). Great value for the price though. Few issues (malfunctioning thermostat, leaking shower door), but the service I received to help me resolve issues was excellent. I would recommend.

title: New, modern hotel-awesome location
text: The hotel and the room was clean with a pleasant modern decor. There was plenty of space in the room and the shower had nice pressure. The location was perfect-easy 15 minute walk to so many sites. The staff was friendly. I’d stay here again with my family.

title: First trip to NewYork City
text:
Hotel is very clean and rooms are nice and cozy.  Beds were very comfortable. Excellent location and Supper friendly staff. Special thanks to Max, Hafeez  and pratik for all the tips and making our trip memorable .
We will defiantly come back.

title: Great service and great property
text:
Max at the front desk was very helpful! The view from 
The room was extremely good. Overall a very clean environment and amazing experience. Would recommend to anyone staying in the NYC area as it is also located perfectly.

title: I brought my family for Christmas. Great location near  a few blocks from Times Square, Empire State Building and Macys.
text: Location and cleanliness 5  star. Walking distance to Times Square, and Empire State Building. Rooms are small but perfect for us. Highly recommend to anyone wanting the true NY experience.. We had 3 rooms with 6 beds perfect accommodations

title: Good hotel and very friendly staff
text: Gurleen was very friendly and helpful! And we were really enjoying the stay! Will definitely come back. Rooms were clean! Our checkin and checkout was super speedy, this is a big plus, during holiday season a lot of hotels have long lines. 💫💫💫

title: Great Stay!
text: Great location! Stylish and clean rooms. Polite and helpful front desk. Although the rooms are small they are modern and updated and very efficient with storage. The decor of the rooms and hotel are quite nice yet the overall feel of the hotel lacks atmosphere and liveliness.

title: A Great Girls Getaway
text:
The Draper Ascend Hotel in Midtown was a spectacular experience!  The moment we entered the lobby, we were warmly greeted by Max who made us feel at home immediately! 
Rooms were clean & cozy & had all the comforts of home at your fingertips!!! And Location, Location, Location!!! Walking distance to all the sites to see at Christmas ( Radio City, Times Square, etc) . 

Look forward to booking again next year for a memorable Christmas Spectacular!! Thank you Max & all the staff!!!

title: Girls Trip to NYC at Christmas time
text: This hotel was wonderful! Beautiful,  new,  and with a great location in Manhattan!!  Rooms were perfect for our group. We were all pleased. I would recommend to others and come back myself. Max and the entire front desk team were very helpful and friendly.

title: Wonderful, clean hotel in Mid town!
text:
Beautiful, sparkling clean hotel, well located in midtown Manhattan! Great service, especially our wonderful front desk representative Max. 

Great girlfriend trip for the holidays! We will be back! Thanks for a great stay!

title: Draper visit
text: Visited with a group of girls. Clean and close to everything.  Rooms new. Thank you to Max for your attention.  Front desk was exceptional. We had a great time being tourists in the city. Very reasonable and we all loved the location and can’t wait to come back.

title: Draper Hotel stay
text: Excellent location in midtown, great service from behind the front desk, importantly nice clean rooms. Max and the entire front desk team were particularly helpful and friendly making our trip even more fun and easy.

title: We will return
text: We were completely surprised by this hotel.  We are usually faithful Marriott travelers but decided to give The Draper a try.  We were so happy we did.  Rooms were smaller than we’re used to in NYC but it was still a very comfortable room.  The beds are amazing and everything was very clean.  The location was perfect!

title: Location, location, location — but no closet
text:
There’s a lot to like about The Draper, but there are enough drawbacks to make it a $200/night choice. Higher than that and I’ll look elsewhere. 

WHAT I LOVED
The location. It’s very central and only a 12 minute walk from Penn Station and Amtrak. Bryant Park is only a stone’s throw away. 

The bed. It’s new and comfortable. 

An empty mini fridge is provided for personal use. 

Coffee maker (but the coffee is weak as water).

The bathroom. It’s modern, updated, and clean. Walk-in shower with good water pressure. Artsy Spanish floor tiles.

DIDN’T LOVE
The bathroom. Nowhere to place toiletries. The shower head only has one setting: 4 jets of water, no spray. 

Harsh LED wall lights with no dimmers.

Privacy issues. There’s one floor to ceiling window with a black out shade but no sheer curtain. My room was across from a large apartment building with plenty of windows, so my choices were shade down (cave) or shade up (fishbowl).

No closet or dresser for clothes. Installed instead are a series of wall hooks and a closet rod attached to a table top. There was one drawer in the base of the bed but I quickly tired of bending down to floor-level every time I needed something from my suitcase.

title: Perfect location, clean and comfortable
text: Quick overnight for business dinner.  Perfect location in midtown.   The property and public areas were clean and the room was spotless.  Very comfortable bed.   Rooms were small but not as small as other NYC hotels.  Reasonable price for the stay.   Friendly front desk service.  No breakfast or drink availability other than a water dispenser.   Would stay there again.

title: Disappointing
text:
The location of this hotel was great for my holiday trip to New York City.  It's close to Bryant Park and a reasonable walk up to the Rockefeller Center / Broadway area.  

Our city-view king room was large for a standard room in NYC.  Our view looked out over 37th street and noise was never an issue.  That's where the positives end. 

The heating / air conditioning unit was inoperable.  The unit could NOT be shut off.  It continuously blew old cold air for entire 3-night stay.  Neither the front desk or maintenance were able to fix the situation.  In fact, right after I checked in, an unmasked worker got into the elevator with me holding a small ladder and complained to me about how this hotel doesn't care about air conditioning.  No follow the next day from management or an apology were ever received.

Hairs not belonging to me or my wife were on the bed.  There were also lipstick stains on one of the pillows.   I tried calling down the front desk but couldn't get an answer.  On my way out to a show later, I told the front desk about the issue but it was never handled.  Upon returning to the hotel we were too tired to inquire again so we did our best to clean off the bed with our bare hands.  We also didn't feel like packing / unpacking again.

In the shower, their own soaps are provided in dispensers.  That's fine - a lot of hotels are doing this now.  The problem is there wasn't a little shelf for personal items.

title: Weekend in NYC during Christmas holiday, to visit our son.
text: Room was a small, but it’s very clean.Small closet space & bathroom small as well. It’s good enough for a weekend stay. Hotel is a walking distance to Bryant Park, to the theatre, to nice restaurants in the area. Staff is nice & friendly. Overall my husband & I were satisfied w/our stay.

title: A great experience
text: Rooms look new and fresh. They are on the smaller side but like most rooms in the area. The bed was very comfortable which is a big plus for me. Water pressure was also good. The front staff was very nice and the elevators were fast. I came for a mother daughter trip and this location was perfect for walking to all the action. Would definitely stay here again

title: Clean and Comfortable MidTown Hotel
text: Terrific location, very centrally located.  Lobby was clean and decorated for the holidays.  Front desk staff was welcoming and friendly and clearly explained housekeeping expectations due to Covid.  Our room was clean and comfortable and well appointed.  Beds were cozy and room was super quiet at night, too.  Toiletries were provided and the bathroom was also clean.  Bathroom design is a bit tight (to be expected in NYC) and the shower door had some leaking issues, but nothing that affected our stay.  In the morning after our first night we asked for additional towels and they were brought to our room in a timely manner.  Elevators were clean and fast.  Each floor only has six rooms so the entire place feels very cozy.  Front desk staff at checkout were also very nice, asked if we wanted to store our bags for the day (we didn't but it was nice to know this is an option for future stays).  It looks like there are plans for a little coffee bar in the lobby which will be nice; there was ice water available.  We didn't use the vending or ice machines so I can't comment on those.  Overall, this was a wonderful stay, decent price, and we will definitely keep it in mind as a top choice for our next visit to the city.

title: Great value
text: Great location, good value for the money. I will stay there again. The only issue I had was with the front desk guy at night. He had no personality and never once smiled.  This place has the ability to stand out and this will not happen with sullen staff.

title:
Hotel Decor and Ambiance - yes
Staff - NO
text: After driving 5 hours and spending about an hour trying to check-in I finally got to my room. Partially my fault because my bank was having issues with my travel schedule. Still the front desk agent was extremely cold and unpleasant. I noted in my reservation that I had a certified service animal in my reservation. Then when I went back to get him from his crate and bring him in the front desk guy asked me for paperwork?? I said my dog was not causing issues or damaging the property. He tells me they accept service animals, then why are you asking me for proof? If my dog was being an issue then yea that would be reason to not have us stay, but he is a TRAINED SERVICE animal. Would never recommend this hotel and I’m a Choice Gold member too, and yet no thank you for your loyalty.

title: Nice hotel
text: We stayed in two different rooms during our stay because we needed to extend it for an extra day. The first room we were in was a normal size for NYC. The view was not bad, and the bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was great, except the soap smelled so strongly of cologne it lingered until the next day. There were also no shelves in the shower so I had to put everything on the floor. The room was very clean, and the front desk staff was kind. The second room we were in was stunning! It was large, with a city view and clean as well. The only issue was that the door scraped against the floor every time we opened it. The curtains also were not blackout curtains so if you don't mind a little light seeping through this is a great hotel for you!

title: Christmas sightseeing  in NYC
text: The Draper is newer hotel that utilizes space in smart and elegant way. The rooms are beautifully designed including comfortable beds that offer a cozy retreat after a long day of exploring NYC. The hotel is a great location within walking distance to alot of popular sights.Staff is friendly and helpful.

title: Pretty good short stay in the heart of midtown!
text:
My boyfriend and I decided we wanted to visit NYC for the holidays. We saw this hotel to be one of the cheap nicer hotels in midtown, so we booked a two night stay. Upon arrival we could tell that the hotel was new because the coffee bar section was not completed yet. We unfortunately paid $40 for early check in which is a rip off, but a lot of hotels are doing it now a days so we didn’t really argue about that. When we got up to the room we saw that it was relatively clean but did notice some hairs in the bed and on the toilet. We cleaned them up with a Clorox wipe (but I also wiped everything down anyway because COVID) and did not say anything to the front desk because we didn’t want to deal with it. Additionally, the sheets were linty but they seemed to be clean. It would have made me feel better though if the sheets were spotless. The room was a bit small but most likely what you would normally get in the city, but the decor was nice. 

Overall, it was a good stay. A few issues but nothing too big. The hotel room wasn’t spotless when we arrived but we still had a good time.  And the hotel was in a great location! I’d recommend

title: Great Service
text: The hotel staff was very friendly and went above and beyond to assist, when needed. Gurleen at checkout was knowledgeable and expediate at providing transportation to the airport.  Although the rooms were a bit small, they were ckean and orderly.

title: Business visit
text:
Draper is a Modern and beautifull  hotel with a very good level or service
I will come back here for sure 
Very Well located close to bryan Park Penn or grand central station 
The Perfect place to stay and not too expensive

title: Good hotel for the price
text: The staff was friendly. My room was ready at 10AM vs 3PM. Walking distance to Macy's. Fast food and convenient store were close by.  The room was small but 2 adults fit comfortably. The room was clean.

title: Not a 5* property
text:
I booked the Draper for a 2-night stay in November 2019, based on positive TripAdvisor buzz and the incredible rate ($250/night) for a hotel listed as 5*. The proximity to Grand Central was also key to my travel plans.

The property is brand new and was apparently still in its "soft launch" phase, perhaps leading to some of the hiccups. 

The Draper was not up to a 5* standard and I was disappointed with the stay. The staff at the front desk seemed overwhelmed and I had to guide the agent through the check-in process; the room was not cleaned well--dirty rug and an errant "Froot Loop" underneath the nightstand, as well as unclean sheets (which we had mentioned to the front desk and were assured would be dealt with, but weren't ... our beds were simply made but linens not changed the next day); no standard amenities in the room either (e.g., hair-dryer, safe, toiletries beyond soap).

Overall, the stay felt like a budget hotel but not at budget hotel cost.

title: Small but perfect
text: Hotel is right near herald square which was perfect to watch the parade. Lots of restaurants nearby and walking distance to Bryant park and Times Square. Room is small but it arranged to perfection to hold all your stuff. Bathroom was quite roomy. Has fridge and coffeemaker. A lot of hotels make you ask for it now. Bed was super comfortable. Windows open for fresh air which I think is so Important with the heat on which makes rooms so dry. Price point was perfect. I would definitely stay here again.

title: No service even when requested repeatedly
text: Stayed 4 nights with Choice points.  Requested room to be cleaned repeatedly, and it never happened.  “You need to request service because regular service is cancelled due to COVID.”  Yes, but I did.  Each day I would call back and the same message that you didn’t get room cleaning because you have to request it in advance and then there would be another reason why it was not done, “We don’t have anyone checked into that room, are you sure that is your room number, so you couldn’t have requested service.”  Ok, we’ll do it tomorrow.  Next day, not done.  “Oh well, the team did not do it because we knocked on your door and you refused service. “ We were not in the room, and this never happened.  Ok, but can we at least have towels?  There are three persons in this room and you only provide 2 towels in the room.  Ok, we’ll send towels.  No towels.  Ask again and towels brought.  Ask again for more and two more brought.  Next day, room still not cleaned.  Call again and they say they will look into it.  Calls back and says it was because there is a do not disturb sign on door.  Well, that is true at the time they investigated it, as we had then put it on the door around dinner time, but it was not on the door all day while we were out.  Ok, they can come make up the room now, and I say not quite now and we are getting dressed for dinner, but please come make up the room while we are out.  Go to long dinner and evening out for about 4 hours and come back and room is not cleaned.  Room was never made up at all during a four night stay.  I understand that staffing is very challenging right now, and that might be part of the issue.  However, all the excuses and not fixing it ever is way below par.  Also, when we checked out, they still never had us checked in.  Lol!

title: Vacation
text: All great, very professional front desk staff! Hotel clean, new, excellent location, prepared when I arrived. Absolutely no complaints, or concerns. Second time staying here in last month, and stay was great both times. Thanks so much!!!!!!

title: Great location
text: Great location. Easy to get everywhere in the city. Clean. I stayed there with my two children, 11 and 13. The only downside is that there is not a lot of space to put anything. The bathroom did not have any storage. I wished they had put more hooks in the bathroom and maybe a shelf to put things on. Other than that it was clean and comfortable and very centrally located.

title: Amazing
text: Super clean room! The location was perfect, it made it easy to move around since it was centric from our activities. The front desk let us leave our baggage with them and made it easier to explore the city. Definitely would stay again for my next visit!

title: Everything was perfect and beyond my expectations!!
text:
I came to the city during Veteran's Day weekend! I absolutely loved my stay, and I had the most amazing city view. Loved that the windows allowed you to crack open.  It's a beautiful, brand new hotel.  There are only 8 rooms on every floor which I loved.  Yes, rooms are small, but  cleverly made to make the space useful!  

Location was amazing!  I was able to hit up so many sights during my stay including, but not limited to -Central Station, Summit @ One Vanderbilt, Madison Square Park. Broadway, Times Square, Bryant Park, and Flatiron building.

The staff was all nice.  I was a solo traveler, and felt very safe!

Will definitely stay here again!!!

title: Perfect location for a visit to NYC
text: Hotel was great .  Bed was so comfortable very clean and the location is perfect right off 5th ave 2 blks from Bryant Park . I have friends that live a couple blocks away so it was close to them which was perfect . My only compliant was the front desk staff . I found every person I encountered to be extremely rude , especially upon checkout.

title: Stunning boutique hotel!!
text: We stayed at this stunning hotel for several nights. The rooms are very clean, modern and beautiful. The staff was very friendly and greeted us with a friendly smile at every pass. The location is blocks away from fantastic Midtown shopping, restaurants and Time Square. The area was very safe as well. We would definitely stay here again.

title: Hotel acaba de ser renovado, tudo novo e limpíssimo !!!
text: O quarto que escolhi não era grande mas o projeto é super moderno e inteligente ! Cheio de cabideiros para pendurar casacos e cachecol , no caso de NY no inverno é super útil ! Não tem carpete o que para mim e ótimo em termos de limpeza. A cama é excelente ! O banheiro novíssimo assim como todo mobiliário , uma vez que acaba de ser reformado ! A localização e ótima , quase ao lado de Briant Park.

title: Overnight trip to NYC
text: Came to NYC to celebrate our anniversary. We enjoyed our stay at The Draper. Chose them due to walking distance from train station and events we were doing in the city. The room was a little small but clean and well appointed. I would definitely stay here again for another trip to the city

title: French fry in the "clean" sheets...
text:
We just checked into The Draper about an hour ago, after landing from a very early morning flight. Wanting to take a quick nap to reenergize before some work meetings this afternoon, we pulled back the (neatly made) sheets to find...a french fry. A FRENCH FRY. IN THE SHEETS. The sheets also had several yellowish stains.

There are two possibilities:
1. Their laundry service is horrifyingly subpar. How yellow stains and french fries can make it through a full wash and dry cycle is beyond me.
2. Their housekeeping is horrifyingly subpar. Did they just re-make the bed with the sheets that had been on it, without changing out the sheets?

We called the front desk to notify them, and they said they would switch us to another room, which they did. (Their quick response is the reason this review is two stars instead of one star.) However, by the time this all got sorted out, our window for napping was gone, and we had to run to our meetings. So, I haven't checked the sheets on the new bed yet...but here's hoping we don't have to move again.

title: Great hotel and perfect location!!
text:
The hotel cleanliness was great! No complaints!

The staff was very respectful and attentive when needing extra things

Location was perfect, walking distance to almost everywhere we needed and close to train or called Uber for anywhere else. 

Would definitely stay here again when in town!

title: Gem of  hotel
text:
Found this Gem in the heart of NYC. The hotel is brand new and very nicely designed. The rooms are typical NYC size ... small but efficient and met all our basic needs. The bathrooms were clean and beautiful. The shower was nice and hot. The hotel staff was extremely helpful and new the area very well. 
The best part was location. We were able to walk to all the major tourist attractions and we were only 2 blocks from the train station.

Considering the price I paid I have no complaints. We will definitely be back for another stay.

title: Disappointing visit
text:
On the positive side, the elevators in the hotel are very fast. The room was clean and the linens were very nice. 

The location to the theater district is convenient if you are able to walk about a mile or take public transportation or a taxi.

There was no handrail at all in the shower, only 1 hook in the bathroom, and no closet in the room. The wifi and TV disappeared intermittently. We asked the front desk to get us a taxi and they called a limo without telling us that is what they were going to do. It cost us $50 to go under 2 miles. There are many NYC taxis available.

title: Hair in FOUR SHOWERS
text:
If I could rate this hotel 0 stars I would. The hotel is listed as five star but has no five star amenities or service. This I was willing to put aside but the cleanliness is the most important thing to me and the rooms were dirty. I checked into my room at 1am after a long day of travel. I slept in late and went to take a shower the next day at 3pm. Tons of red hair in the shower drain... I am blonde and haven't used it.. obviously not mine. Go to the front desk to ask for cleaner room and get another room #2. Go with the attendant to make sure its clean before I accept and black hairs all over the bathroom. Ew. Go back down and ask to see another room. Room #3 with attendant. Check room, black hairs all over the shower again. Nice. Go back down and he insist this room is clean. Ok. Room #4 with attendant go and see nice long black hairs all over the bathroom floor. Wtf. Four rooms and not ONE with a clean shower. I am not even asking for much...just to not have other peoples filth in the room I am sleeping.
SO I ask for a refund and to leave. He says they can't refund me and that this is just how the housekeepers clean here. I.e. they don't? Really disgusting hotel and no one wanted to take responsibility for the lack of hygienic care in these rooms. Save your money and your energy.

title: GV Halloween parade
text:
Brand new hotel with excellent Midtown location, close to GSS, Bryant Park and subways. We stayed in a King room with street views…and that famous city noise. Great use of space, by scarifying a closet you get a large tiled bathroom with a walk-in shower!!!
Restaurant isn’t open yet, but check-in was easy.

title: Undiscovered Gem In The Heart of Manhattan ... Excellent Stay
text:
As a Diamond Elite member in the Choice Privileges guest program, I booked my stay at The Draper using my award points.  I was pleasantly surprised to find that every aspect of my stay, from the time I arrived until I checked out the following day, exceeded my expectations.

The hotel appears new and recently remodeled.  The lobby area was bright, clean, and tasteful.  The staff who checked me in was professional, cordial, and efficient, and even thanked me for being a loyal Choice Privileges member.  My room was not large (as is typical on smaller Manhattan hotels) but was spotlessly clean and functional.  Bed was comfortable.  Adequate work space.  Flawless internet.  Shower delivered a powerful stream of piping hot water.  Check-out the following morning was handled quickly, with a warm "thank you" for staying with them. 

Hotel is just off of 5th Avenue on West 37th Street - about a 10-12 minute walk from Penn Station or Grand Central and with easy access to various subway lines, PATH, and buses.  

I would definitely return.  Highly recommended.

title: Perfect hotel
text:
The Draper was a perfect choice for our vacation.location is central ,walking distance from all attractions .the staff was very helpful and attentive.room was clean ,new and cozy(but a bit small).
I recommend this hotel and sure will be staying here again

title: The Draper hotel
text: Place is new , clean and stylish .  The only 2 drawback are no breakfast included and they are strict with their checkout time.   That’s the only thing where I might not stay there much   I am diamond member for Hilton and gold with Marriott where the both hotels do not bug me to check out so early plus they both have a nice breakfast

title: Nice basic hotel but room is not the same as photo
text: I booked for 4 days and arrived at the hotel yesterday. The room is clean and modern but small and basic. I paid extra $$ for a city view king room from their website because I will stay for 4 days and from the photos on the website the city view room has more space for the desk. But when I got to the room on 20th floor, the layout is totally different from the photos. The room is much smaller and is the same layout as standard king room. And no city view either. So no need to book a “city view” with extra $$ at all.

title: Great value
text: Rooms are small but comfortably arranged. Not the upscale hotel it claims to be, but location and price are difficult to beat, at least at this time. Highly recommended. Not much guidance from staff unless you ask, but that's typical NYC, I've found.

title: Great place in NYC
text: Small but comfortable hotel in central Manhattan. Courteous and efficient staff during check in and check out. Room was small but this is typical for this area and type of hotel. Excellent cost for location and services.

title: Peaceful and comforable
text: Clean nice rooms and lobby.  Quiet room with fridge and coffee and good TV.  Everything seems new.  No food in the lobby (coffee, etc)  Front desk was friendly. Location is convenient for much of mid town.

title: New, modern, friendly, location, location, location
text:
I'm enjoying my 4th day of a 7day stay at The Draper Hotel.  The location is excellent for walking to theaters (less than a mile to all Broadway theaters), convenient to subways, buses, yet out of the noise of heavily-trafficked streets.  The neighborhood is safe, clean, and convenient to shopping, restaurants, and nearby parks.  Bed is comfortable, water is hot, interior noise is minimal since there are only 8 rooms per floor.  Mini-fridge is a nice touch for keeping perishables accessible in the room.

The staff is friendly.  Special shout-out to Sunny at the front desk who goes out of his way to make sure that guests are satisfied!

title: Great like NYC
text:
Weekend in October, tried a brand new hotel.  Nice modern clean room and reasonable price.  Great staff.  Discount parking.  Near Times Square and MOMA. 
And view of the Empire State building right out our window!  NYS's Eifel tower.
Local restaurants spanning all price ranges.  Lovely.
Would stay again!

title: Stay in the heart of the city!
text: We decided to stay at Draper for our anniversary visit to NYC. The place is new and definitely a great opiton to consider if you want to stay in the heart of the city. To sum it up: Clean, no-frills hotel, great location, friendly front desk staff, small but well designed rooms. I am coming back!

title: Weekend Stay
text: This hotel was very nice. Exceptionally clean. Beautiful, modern decor.  The staff was very accommodating. Close to everything Manhattan. And did I mention beautiful?  I will definitely consider them again. Until next time.

title: Very nice Hotel
text:
We enjoyed the stay ,the hotel is nice and clean 
Location is great
 The room is a bit small but it is utilised and designed Right 
The bed is comfortable 
The staff are friendly and helpful. 
Definitely I recommend it.

title: Hidden Gem
text:
The Draper Hotel is a hidden gem in the heart of NYC. Located within blocks of almost every subway line, it is easily accessible and safe. The hotel is very boutique with only 8 rooms per floor. The rooms are NYC spacious, meaning they are not hue but the use of space is well designed and worked out great for our family of four. The elevators were super fast and the outdoor patio was a nice touch on the first floor. 

The staff was great and held our luggage when we arrived early and departed late, making it very easy to explore the city without worrying about or luggage. 

Great hotel!

title: Excelente lugar recomendado
text: Estuvimos en este hotel la semana pasada del 6 al 9 de octubre, y nos encantó. Las instalaciones son nuevas, todo muy aseado, la ubicación es estupenda, muy céntrica para ir caminando a time Square, igualmente Bryant Park, a Herald Square donde esta el Empire State, y otras atracciones, Muy cerca del Korea Town y otros sitios. Es un hotel ideal para viajeros que buscan comodidad a un precio razonable en una muy buena ubicación en  Manhattan, felicidades por este hotel, sigan así con ese estándar de servicio y calidad. Todos muy amables. Esperamos escribir del sitio en informeaereo.com

title: New Hotel with Sophisticated Room Decor and Modern Design Bathroom Style.
text: We were extremely pleased with The Draper. It’s a new hotel- opening 3 wks before our visit in Sept 2021. The rooms are very nice and whomever the contractors hired to do the renovations did quality work. The room decor is simple but sophisticated and the bathroom also has an understated elegance with its simple white modern design and glass-door shower. The room and bathroom are small but on par with other NYC hotels and may even be a smidge larger.
